Excruciating experimental trials might be able to alleviate some of the symptoms for a while, but a complete cure would take decades of knowledge and wealth that few in Etharis possess. Even then, it would still require a great deal of luck.

entries.name: Ooze Stages
entries: At each stage of this Transformation, follow the instructions provided for that stage.

entries.name: Achieving a New Stage
entries: To move from one stage to the next higher one in this Transformation, an event or some other notable occurrence tied to the story of the character should take place. The following events are suggestions for ones that might trigger a move to the next stage of the Transformation:

items: Become {@condition Bloodied|XPHB} or {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} by the attacks of an Ooze
Undergo experimentation by an arcanist or diabolist
Suffer from the Weeping Pox or other disease
{@action Study|XPHB} an ancient tome from the time when Oozes first came to Etharis

entries.name: Ooze Stage 1
entries: When you initially undergo the Ooze Transformation, you gain the Ooze Form Boon and one other Stage 1 Boon of your choice. You also gain the Stage 1 Flaw.

entries.name: Ooze Stage 2
entries: When you reach Stage 2 of the Ooze Transformation, you select one Stage 2 Boon and gain the Stage 2 Flaw.

entries.name: Ooze Stage 3
entries: When you reach Stage 3 of the Ooze Transformation, you select one Stage 3 Boon and gain the Stage 3 Flaw.

entries.name: Ooze Stage 4
entries: When you reach Stage 4 of the Ooze Transformation, you select one Stage 4 Boon and gain the Stage 4 Flaw.

{@i Her skin turns black and peels away. But underneath, her bones are made of rock and her blood is fire. "What's happening?" the girl cries. Heat radiates from behind her eyes. "I can't control it!" She walks away from the ashes of her village sometime later.}

{@i The city dwellers raise their eyes to the thundering sky. Lightning strikes the cobblestones, then takes the shape of a man. Cries ring out as the figure, sparks scintillating from his body, clenches a fist. The earth trembles violently. Buildings crack and begin to crumble. Commoners flee whilst others throw themselves at the mercy of the elemental manifestation. Its voice booms, "I have heard it. I heard the song of creation!"}

Primordials are created when a creature absorbs a spark of primordial chaos. Primordial forces are the purest building blocks of creation, and a fostered spark quickly grows to an all-consuming flame. Mastering the elements requires unlearning the limitations of mortality, a process that sparks rapid transformation.

entries.name: Becoming a Primordial
entries: There are several ways for a mortal to consume a primordial spark. They might be born with one due to some sorcery or gifted one by accident in the dreams of a slumbering Primordial. A mortal may consume the power of an Elemental through arcane rituals. Or a body could become infused with primal energy after surviving a calamity caused by an Elemental creature or rift to an Elemental Plane.

Once acquired, one must spend a great deal of time contemplating and understanding the spark to unlock its full potential. The process of attaining elemental mastery is dangerous. The slightest slip in control can cause devastation on a massive scale. Such facts are why isolated individuals like Druids, Monks, or Rangers are most likely to see the Transformation through to its end.

entries.name: Reversing Primordial Traits
entries: Once a primordial spark has taken hold, your mortal body will continue to deteriorate from the roiling elements it now tries to contain. You will inevitably become one with the elements, your soul pulled into the Elemental Plane. Only magic on the level of the {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell can then revive you, with or without your Transformation and its Boons and Flaws.

entries.name: Primordial Stages
entries: At each stage of this Transformation, follow the instructions provided for that stage.

entries.name: Achieving a New Stage
entries: To move from one stage to the next higher one in this Transformation, an event or some other notable occurrence tied to the story of the character should take place. The following events are suggestions for ones that might trigger a move to the next stage of the Transformation:

items: Defeat and absorb the power of a greater Elemental
Come into contact with an elemental node
Make an alliance with a being from one of the Elemental Planes
Use your powers to defeat an encroaching civilization
Free an imprisoned or indentured Elemental creature

entries.name: Primordial Stage 1
entries: When you initially undergo the Primordial Transformation, you gain both Stage 1 Boons and the Stage 1 Flaw.

entries.name: Primordial Stage 2
entries: When you reach Stage 2 of the Primordial Transformation, you select one Stage 2 Boon and gain the Stage 2 Flaw.

entries.name: Primordial Stage 3
entries: When you reach Stage 3 of the Primordial Transformation, you select one Stage 3 Boon and gain the Stage 3 Flaw.

entries.name: Primordial Stage 4
entries: When you reach Stage 4 of the Primordial Transformation, you select one Stage 4 Boon and gain the Stage 4 Flaw.

{@i Incense burns dimly as muffled coughs echo through the musty room. Loved ones hold each other as a bedridden woman exhales a final breath, her scarred face bearing the mortifying lesions of the Weeping Pox. Her family sobs, too lost in their sorrow to notice how the smoldering embers radiate and shine. A woman with flowing robes and platinum hair approaches from the shadows, radiant energy emanating from her folded, angelic wings. "Hold on for but a moment, my child," she whispers. "Mercy has been granted."}

{@i With a thunderous boom, a Seraph's hammer collides with a clot of writhing corpses. Scraps of bone and offal scatter across the dilapidated chapel floor as voices wail in pain. Gritting her teeth, the angelic figure proclaims, "You foul spirits are dead. Begone! I condemn your cadavers to dust!" Golden fire erupts from her hammer as she prepares for another strike.}

Seraphs are mortals transformed into Celestial representations of a virtue or ideal. Exalted by a higher power, Seraphs are selected by divine beings after long and patient observation, confirming that the mortal displays pure character. Seraphs are selected from noble martyrs, tireless crusaders, or other exemplary individuals prepared to become the physical manifestation of righteousness.

entries.name: Becoming a Seraph
entries: To be chosen by an Arch Seraph is to become a vessel for the principles they uphold. This is a charge not to be taken lightly, and those who display righteousness with the intention of becoming a Seraph are usually overlooked for this reason. When becoming a Seraph, consider why your character was chosen. Do you display hidden merit? Are you devoted to a cause they will value?

entries.name: Relinquishing Divinity
entries: Characters who reach Stage 1 of the Seraph Transformation do not typically seek power without righteous cause. The Transformation's Boons and Flaws can be removed at any time by relinquishing divinity, as a warrior retires their sword when the war is over. Regaining such power may not be so easy.

entries.name: Seraph Stages
entries: At each stage of this Transformation, follow the instructions provided for that stage.

entries.name: Achieving a New Stage
entries: To move from one stage to the next higher one in this Transformation, an event or some other notable occurrence tied to the story of the character should take place. The following events are suggestions for ones that might trigger a move to the next stage of the Transformation:

items: Defeat a powerful force of darkness
Create a hallowed landmark for pilgrims
Establish a parish of worshipers who uphold your virtue
Redeem a soul that was considered beyond redemption

entries.name: Seraph Stage 1
entries: When you initially undergo the Seraph Transformation, you gain Celestial Form and one other Stage 1 Boon of your choice. You also gain the Stage 1 Flaw.

entries.name: Seraph Stage 2
entries: When you reach Stage 2 of the Seraph Transformation, you select one Stage 2 Boon and gain the Stage 2 Flaw.

entries.name: Seraph Stage 3
entries: When you reach Stage 3 of the Seraph Transformation, you select one Stage 3 Boon and gain the Stage 3 Flaw.

entries.name: Seraph Stage 4
entries: When you reach Stage 4 of the Seraph Transformation, you select one Stage 4 Boon and gain the Stage 4 Flaw.

{@i The cloaked figure hunches over a dusty tome, incanting words of power. At intervals, the figure caresses a dark rod with a sharp point, then jabs themself, causing a sharp gasp of pain. The victim of the figure's curse, sleeping across town, rolls over in his sleep. He will soon suffer the ravages of a Shadowsteel curse. But the curser has a much worse fate awaiting them.}

In Etharis, sometimes the metal of the earth itself carries an enormous, vile power. Such is the case with Shadowsteel, a material that has absorbed corrupt power. This makes this substance perfect for warping the magic that passes through it, making it perfect for cursing or enhancing spells.

Cursing an enemy, however, requires an enormous amount of work and personal power. These efforts, though enhanced when passing through Shadowsteel, take a toll upon the magic-wielders handling it. By using it, spellcasters and ritualists bind their soul, a bit at a time, to the energies of the fell metal. Those who use Shadowsteel often feel its effects as they move closer and closer to undeath.

entries.name: Becoming a Shadowsteel Ghoul
entries: Curses are wrought from and woven with intense feelings of loathing, spite, and bitterness. Humanoids who choose to wield such deeply evil magic leave an indelible mark upon their own soul. When enough of these marks pollute a person, their spirit begins to rot.

A creature who uses a Spellcasting Focus made of Shadowsteel, particularly to cast curses, risks acquiring the Shadowsteel Ghoul curse. Being attuned to a Shadowsteel magic item or wielding a Shadowsteel weapon for a prolonged period also carries a similar danger.

entries.name: Curing Shadowsteel Ghoul Curses
entries: Once the character reaches Stage 1 of the Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation, no typical magic like {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} can remove the affliction. Magic on the level of the {@spell wish} spell is needed to completely remove the Transformation and its Boons and Flaws.

entries.name: Shadowsteel Ghoul Stages
entries: At each stage of this Transformation, follow the instructions provided for that stage.

entries.name: Achieving a New Stage
entries: To move from one stage to the next higher one in this Transformation, an event or some other notable occurrence tied to the story of the character should take place. The following events are suggestions:

items: Casting a Shadowsteel curse on a powerful creature that later reaches culmination
Casting a ritual that consumes a Shadowsteel magic item, allowing you to absorb its power
Making a bargain with a Fiend who gifts you with a new object made of Shadowsteel
Casting a 7th-level or higher spell for the first time using a {@item Shadowsteel Focus|GrimHollowPG24}
Slaying a powerful foe with a weapon forged from Shadowsteel
Failing two {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws}

entries.name: Shadowsteel Ghoul Stage 1
entries: When you initially contract the Shadowsteel Ghoul curse, you select one Stage 1 Boon and gain the Stage 1 Flaw.

entries.name: Shadowsteel Ghoul Stage 2
entries: When you reach Stage 2 of the Shadowsteel Ghoul curse, you select two Stage 2 Boons and gain the Stage 2 Flaw.

entries.name: Shadowsteel Ghoul Stage 3
entries: When you reach Stage 3 of the Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation, you gain the Stage 3 Boon and the Stage 3 Flaw.

entries.name: Shadowsteel Ghoul Stage 4
entries: When you reach Stage 4 of the Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation, you select one Stage 4 Boon and gain the Stage 4 Flaw.

entries.name: Shadowsteel's Temptation
entries: The Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation might be the most likely change for characters to undertake. Each time a caster uses a {@item Shadowsteel Focus|GrimHollowPG24} to cast a spell, or a warrior wields a Shadowsteel weapon, they risk losing a bit of their soul to gain a bit of power. Players should know what is happening to their characters when they wield Shadowsteel's power. It's a boost to the power of a character, and the risk should be offsetting that power. The toll it takes on the character should be explained by the GM, and hopefully the player—in the spirit of a dark fantasy campaign—should be able to express and illustrate that toll through roleplaying.

{@i The young woman walks the cobblestone streets every evening. No one ever speaks with her. Few even dare to pass her by. She searches for her home, unaware that it's long demolished, and she is long dead. Her haunting image illuminates the dark streets. Her voice echoes in the dusk, "Help me!"}

{@i A blue figure shambles into town from the graveyard; their body is luminous and ghastly. Their soiled clothes are held together in tatters and their head is marked by twenty gashes. They raise a ghostly hand to point. Their eyes are haunted and filled with rage. The wraith unleashes a cry of the dead that would chill their murderer's blood to ice.}

A living person becomes a Specter through death, by contacting the realm of the dead, or through magic that breaks the body's ties to the material world. This Transformation tears at the substance of body and mind, until what is left is a spiritual shadow.
Specters have a tenuous grasp on reality, and some fade into oblivion while others become monsters that sow the same. Few cursed with this Transformation have the fortitude to remain whole.

entries.name: Becoming a Specter
entries: Methods of becoming a Specter vary, and few find their way willingly. One that dies of an unjust or violent cause may find their spirit refusing to depart, despite their physical form fading. Contact with the forces of death can drain the soul of vitality—a would-be hero is corrupted by the force they wanted to fight. Sinister rituals can also infuse a body with the powers of unmaking from the realm of the Aether Kindred.

Alongside incorporeal beings and the magic of death stand entities that exist in a reality untethered from the material world as mortals understand it. These others and their minions, manifestations of otherworldly chaos, can infuse a person with that chaos, making the victim's ultimate home a dream of cosmic horror.

entries.name: Reversing Specter Traits
entries: Once the character reaches Stage 1 of the Specter Transformation, typical magic like {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} cannot remove the affliction. You cannot be revived or restored by any magic lesser than the {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell due to the ties that anchor your spirit to the corporeal world.
Once you die completely and your soul departs, you may be brought back to life by more conventional magic, free of the Transformation and its Boons and Flaws.

entries.name: Specter Stages
entries: At each stage of this Transformation, follow the instructions provided for that stage.

entries.name: Achieving a New Stage
entries: To move from one stage to the next higher one in this Transformation, an event or some other notable occurrence tied to the story of the character should take place. Suggestions include:

items: Defeat a powerful, ghostly Undead and absorb its power.
Defeat an Aberration that has powers over space, time, or death.
Use a ritual that infuses your body with the forces of death or primordial chaos.

Survive a near-death experience caused by a ghostly Undead creature or an Aberration, especially one in which your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum is reduced, such as by a Wraith's Life Drain, or in which you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
Kill a significant foe with Necrotic or Psychic damage, or by using Necromancy.
Infuse other willing people with the power that corrupts you.
Interact with ghosts and similar spirits, or beings of other realities, perhaps as a conduit between them and other mortals.
Open a gate or path to places of the dead or the dreams of the Aether Kindred.

entries.name: Specter Stage 1
entries: When you initially undergo the Specter Transformation, you gain the Spectral Form Boon and one other Stage 1 Boon of your choice. You also gain the Stage 1 Flaw.

entries.name: Specter Stage 2
entries: When you reach Stage 2 of the Specter Transformation, you select one Stage 2 Boon and gain the Stage 2 Flaw.

entries.name: Specter Stage 3
entries: When you reach Stage 3 of the Specter Transformation, you select one Stage 3 Boon and gain the Stage 3 Flaw.

entries.name: Specter Stage 4
entries: When you reach Stage 4 of the Specter Transformation, you select one Stage 4 Boon and gain the Stage 4 Flaw.

{@i A twisted figure lurks in the shadows of a castle wall as the roaring infantry charges through a breach. In a flash of black mist, the figure appears in front of the soldiers, one by one, striking them down with inhuman speed.}

{@i Candlelight flickers as a hooded advisor leans over an ornate throne, whispering machinations into her lord's ensnared mind. The chamber erupts into commotion as the lord announces further powers be granted to the resident merchants' guild.}

{@i A terrified villager flees through the forest, hoping to outrun his pursuer. His eyes burn with tears, sweat, and blood. He stops, listening for the sounds of footsteps behind. His sigh of relief is stopped before it escapes his throat, as fangs sink deep into his neck.}

Vampires are creatures of accursed blood and tragic existence. Exquisite food, a warm summer breeze, and growing old surrounded by loved ones: these are luxuries a Vampire will never experience. Unable to enjoy many of life's pleasures as they once knew them, Vampires often become bitter creatures, filled with hate for everything they once loved.

entries.name: Becoming a Vampire
entries: Vampires are spawned into the world when a mortal contracts the Sanguine Curse, dies, and is reborn undead. There are a variety of ways to contract the curse. A Vampire may have offered their blood to a loyal servant, powerful ally, or loved one they wished to elevate. More commonly, a Vampire may bite a victim, who survives the attack long enough to contract the Sanguine Curse before perishing and being reborn.

Other methods of becoming a Vampire include ancient and dark magic, as well as powerful but cursed magical artifacts. Vampirism may be passed along when an ancient Vampire allows a beloved plaything to drink blood from the Undead creature's cursed veins. Regardless of how you become a Vampire, you should discuss with your GM what type of Vampire you might become and how it can be implemented in the campaign.

entries.name: Curing Vampirism
entries: Once the character reaches Stage 1 of the Vampire Transformation, no typical magic like {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} can remove the affliction. Magic on the level of the {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell is needed to completely remove the Transformation and its Boons and Flaws.

entries.name: Vampire Stages
entries: At each stage of this Transformation, follow the instructions provided for that stage.

entries.name: Achieving a New Stage
entries: To move from one stage to the next higher one in this Transformation, an event or other notable occurrence tied to the story of the character should take place. The following events are suggestions:

items: Severing a tie to your mortal life, such as discarding a sentimental trinket or abandoning a loved one
Making a further bargain with the Vampire who gifted you with the Sanguine Curse
Drinking the blood of another, more ancient, Vampire
Failing two {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws}
Performing a blood ritual using Sangromancy

entries.name: Vampire Stage 1
entries: When you initially contract vampirism, you gain the Fanged Bite Boon and one other Stage 1 Boon. You also gain the Stage 1 Flaw.

entries.name: Vampire Stage 2
entries: When you reach Stage 2 of vampirism, you select two Stage 2 Boons and gain the Stage 2 Flaw.

entries.name: Vampire Stage 3
entries: When you reach Stage 3 of vampirism, you select two Stage 3 Boons and gain the Stage 3 Flaw.

entries.name: Vampire Stage 4
entries: When you reach Stage 4 of vampirism, you gain the Regeneration Boon and one other Stage 4 Boon of your choice. You also gain the Stage 4 Flaw.

entries.name: Feeding
entries: As a Vampire transforms further and further from its mortal form, its metabolic requirements change. The first change is a need for mortal blood. This need is approximately 1 pint of blood from a Humanoid, Beast, or other creature with mortal blood.

As an action, you can bite a living creature within 5 feet that is {@condition Charmed} by you, or that has the {@condition Incapacitated}, {@condition Paralyzed}, {@condition Restrained}, or {@condition Unconscious} condition. You drain the target of one pint of blood (or similar life-giving substance), leaving a visible bite mark on that creature. The bitten creature gains one {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level.

A Vampire that does not feed within the required time enters a rabid feeding frenzy under the GM's control until they drain a creature completely (killing them), at which point the Vampire falls unconscious for 4 hours.

{@i The strange man sat back from the candle on the table. The small flame barely sputtered since he entered the room, yet its glint caught in the man's dark eyes. The commoner sitting opposite the stranger stared at a parchment on the table, admitting, "I'd like to sign, sir, but I'm afraid I don't know my letters." The man's pale hand entered the candlelight, offering a small needle. "That's alright," he spoke softly, "a single drop will do."}

{@i A priest screams as the Fiend presses her thumbnail into his forehead. A blasphemous rune burns itself into his skin. She grins at the smell. The priest collapses, horror etched onto his face, his shaking hand reaching for the brand. "Don't weep," the Fiend purrs, "to whom did you think you prayed?"}

Many tales are told in Etharis of the evil of fiends. Folks fear meeting a stranger at the crossroads, lest they be tempted towards the wickedness resting in their own heart. A champion rises from a battlefield of broken bodies, a blood tithe paid for their glory. Fiends are the brokers of bargains that reward only the ruthless, selfish, jealous, and cruel. The true horror is that many Fiends began as mortals who surrendered to that seed of evil nested in their heart.

entries.name: Becoming a Fiend
entries: A mortal can become a Fiend in a variety of ways. Some forfeit their souls and become one upon death. Others undertake excruciating rituals to be granted forbidding power by an Arch Daemon. Some mortals may become Fiends unintentionally, as a reward or punishment for their life of cruelty and misdeeds. Yet it is rare for a creature to be chosen to join the legions of the Netherworld without first having made a bargain for such a gift.

Communicating with your GM about creating deals with mortals in their story is a great way to roleplay your influence within the game world. As a Fiend, you should consider your character's motivations and which NPCs might serve to achieve their goals.

entries.name: Reversing Fiend Traits
entries: Transforming into a Fiend usually requires deeds of great evil. You may have performed blood sacrifices or made bargains that resulted in others suffering. Even magic on the level of the {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell could not atone for your actions or redeem your soul. Only once you perform a deed of incredible sacrifice or atonement could such magic remove your Transformation boons and flaws.

entries.name: Fiend Stages
entries: At each stage of this Transformation, follow the instructions provided for that stage.

entries.name: Achieving a New Stage
entries: To move from one stage to the next higher one in this Transformation, an event tied to the story of the character should take place. Suggestions include:

items: Defeating a greater rival Fiend and taking their place in the hierarchy.
Ensnaring a particularly powerful or influential soul with a contract.
Establishing a cult of worshipers who offer their strength to you.
Establishing a portal between the material plane and the Netherworld.

entries.name: Fiend Stage 1
entries: When you initially undergo the Fiend Transformation, you gain the Fiendish Soul Boon and one other Stage 1 Boon of your choice. You also gain the Stage 1 Flaw.

entries.name: Fiend Stage 2
entries: When you reach Stage 2 of the Fiend Transformation, you select one Stage 2 Boon and gain the Stage 2 Flaw.

entries.name: Fiend Stage 3
entries: When you reach Stage 3 of the Fiend Transformation, you select one Stage 3 Boon and gain the Stage 3 Flaw.

entries.name: Fiend Stage 4
entries: When you reach Stage 4 of the Fiend Transformation, you select one Stage 4 Boon and gain the Stage 4 Flaw.

entries.name: Gifts of Damnation
entries: Gifts of Damnation are benefits you gain after offering mortals infernal contracts via the {@optfeature Devilish Contractor|GrimHollowPG24} boon.

entries.name: Stage 1 Gifts
entries: You can gain Stage 1 Gifts whenever you sign a victim to an infernal contract.

entries.name: Stage 2 Gifts
entries: You can gain Stage 2 Gifts whenever you sign a victim to an infernal contract while at Stage 2 or higher of the Fiend Transformation.

entries.name: Stage 3 Gifts
entries: You can gain these Gifts whenever you sign a victim to an infernal contract while at Stage 3 or higher of the Fiend Transformation.

entries.name: Stage 4 Gifts
entries: You can gain these Gifts whenever you sign a victim to an infernal contract while at Stage 4 of the Fiend Transformation.

feat.name: Blood Hound
entries: Your senses are heightened beyond those of most folk. Whether these senses were strengthened through training or the loss of other senses, or they simply matured as you did, you are a master of finding those whom you seek. You  gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Motion Sensor
entries: Whenever a creature that is Small or larger moves within 10 feet of you while you do not have the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition, you immediately become aware of its presence.

entries.name: No Hiding
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks that rely on sound or smell.

feat.name: Convincing Inquisitor
entries: You know how to spot a liar, and you can get people to see your way, whether through charm, reasonable arguments, or force of will. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Charming Presence
entries: When you take the {@action Influence|XPHB} action, you don't have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on checks to influence {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} creatures, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on checks to influence {@variantrule Indifferent [Attitude]|XPHB|Indifferent} creatures.

entries.name: Multiple Paths
entries: You can use any ability modifier when you take the {@action Influence|XPHB} action to make an {@skill Intimidation|XPHB} or  {@skill Persuasion|XPHB} check.

entries.name: Zealous Insight
entries: When you succeed on a {@action Search|XPHB} action's Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) check to detect lies or evasive answers, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls involving combat against that creature for 1 hour.

feat.name: Deathbound
entries: You have seen death many times, up close and personal, and sometimes at your own hand. These experiences have affected you deeply, teaching you about life and death. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: One Last Breath
entries: If you have two {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB} failures, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws} until you are no longer at 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Recuperation
entries: When you spend a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} to recover {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} twice and use the higher roll.

feat.name: Fortune of the Thaumaturge
entries: Your connection to the Thaumaturge puts you in touch with forces outside mortal understanding, making others think you were born under a fortunate moon. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Fortune's Fortitude
entries: When you fail a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can expend and roll one {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die}, adding that number to your result. You can do this only once per {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}.
You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all uses of this ability when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Fortune of the Unknown
entries: When using the Fortune's Fortitude benefit, if you roll the highest or lowest number on the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die}, you regain that {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die}. It still counts as a use of Fortune's Fortitude.

feat.name: Free Sword Mercenary's Will
entries: Your training with the Company of Free Swords has given you an increased stamina and an attitude that make you less likely to succumb to hardships. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Hold the Ground
entries: When you are moved without using your movement by a creature, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to reduce the distance you are moved by up to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Resolute
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws that would apply a condition.

feat.name: Insightful Collector
entries: Your expeditions, transactions, and mercantile activities on behalf of the Augustine Trading Company have put you in contact with collectors of historical artifacts, relics, and tomes. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Object Intuition
entries: You can take a {@action Study|XPHB} action to examine one magical object and learn its properties and how to use it without attuning to it or taking a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} in physical contact with it, but you don't learn any curse the item might bear. There is a cumulative 5% chance for every rarity above Common that you misidentify the nature and the power of the object.

entries.name: Rare Find
entries: You begin play in possession of a Common magic item. Work with your GM to decide on which object fits your character and the campaign.

feat.name: Resolution of the Syndicate
entries: Membership in the Ebon Syndicate provides perks—one of which is the motivation that comes with the understanding that the Syndicate kills those who fail too often. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Quick Strike
entries: On your first turn after an {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll, add {@dice 1d4} to the first damage roll you make. This extra damage increases to {@dice 2d4} at character level 9, and to {@dice 4d4} at character level 16.

entries.name: Resilient
entries: Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by an amount equal to your character level when you gain this feat. Whenever you gain a character level thereafter, your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by an additional 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}.

feat.name: Survivor
entries: Your ability to make the best out of a bad situation has served you well. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Hardy
entries: You need half the amount of food per day based on your size.

entries.name: Intuitive
entries: When you take the {@action Study|XPHB} action, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence checks made when taking the {@action Study|XPHB} action.

entries.name: Shake It Off
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, your {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level, if any, decreases by 1. Additionally, when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, your {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level decreases by 2.

feat.name: Triage Expert
entries: You are trained in dealing with injuries on the battlefield, and with the saving of lives afterward. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Bedside Manner
entries: Whenever you cause a creature to regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or the Blood and Bone benefit, you can roll one extra die and discard the lowest die.

entries.name: Blood and Bone
entries: Taking the {@action Utilize|XPHB} action and expending the use of a {@item Healer's Kit|XPHB} lets you heal a creature within 5 feet of you. The creature can expend and roll a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} and regain that number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

feat.name: Blackpowder Pistol Expert
entries: You have become practiced with the use of Blackpowder Pistols. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Deadeye
entries: Attacking at long range doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your attack rolls with a Blackpowder Pistol.

entries.name: Quick Load
entries: You ignore {@itemProperty LD|XPHB|Loading} of the Blackpowder Pistol.

entries.name: Trick Shot
entries: Immediately after a creature within 5 feet of you moves, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make a ranged attack with a Blackpowder Pistol against that creature.

feat.name: Expanded Grip
entries: Your natural ability with larger weapons lets you use them in a way others can't. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: One-Handed Grip
entries: When you use a Versatile weapon with one hand, the weapon deals the damage in parentheses when used to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Zealous Grasp
entries: If an effect forces you to drop what you are holding, you can make a DC 15 Strength saving throw to maintain your grip. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a saving throw to maintain your grip, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the saving throw.

feat.name: Hulking Figure
entries: Either from extensive training or a natural build, you have a broad and formidable size for your species. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Brutal
entries: Once per turn, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d4} Bludgeoning damage to a target you hit with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

entries.name: Intimidating
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation|XPHB}, {@skill Performance|XPHB}, or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}) check, you can also add your Strength modifier to the roll.

entries.name: Powerful
entries: You count as one size larger (to a maximum size of Large) when determining your carrying capacity.

feat.name: Iron Gut
entries: You can eat like a hill giant and drink like a fish. Years of punishing your stomach and liver have led to a powerful fortitude. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Inured to Poison
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Everything Looks Delicious
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Survival|XPHB}) checks to forage for food.

entries.name: Quick to Recover
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one of your {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}, roll the die and add your Constitution modifier, and regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll's total. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Lightning Caster
entries: Your rapid-fire style of casting cantrips allows you to weave magic with uncanny speed. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Dual Target
entries: When you cast a cantrip with a casting time of an action that targets a single creature, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to target a second creature within the cantrip's range.

entries.name: Immediate Response
entries: When you cast a spell as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, that spell doesn't expend a spell slot. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Medician of the Morbus Doctore
entries: You are a master of the medical sciences because of your association with a medical institute. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Adept Medic
entries: When you use the Blood and Bone benefit of the Triage Expert feat, the creature can spend up to three {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} instead of one.

entries.name: Battle Surgeon
entries: When you use the Blood and Bone benefit of the Triage Expert feat, the creature can spend three {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} to end one of the following conditions on itself instead of regaining {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}: {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, or {@condition Stunned|XPHB}.
Alternatively, you can cure one {@variantrule Grievous Wound|GrimHollowPG24} affecting the creature (see Grim Hollow {@variantrule Campaign|XPHB} Guide).

feat.name: Nimble Physique
entries: You are small and thin for your species. You have a mysterious and consistent ability to avoid danger. You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Dodgy
entries: While you aren't wearing armor or wielding a {@item Shield|XPHB}, you can take the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

items.name: Slippery
entries: While you are {@condition Grappled|XPHB} or {@condition Restrained|XPHB}, your attacks don't have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} and attacks against you don't have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

feat.name: Sangromantic Initiate
entries: You have become adept enough with weaving blood magic to mitigate some of the harm of Sangromancy. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Blood Magic
entries: Choose a Sangromancy spell from any spell list of a level for which you have spell slots. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slot you have.

entries.name: Sanguine Potency
entries: You have a pool of two d12s that you can expend instead of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} when you cast Sangromancy spells. Your pool regains all expended dice when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Shadowsteel Adept
entries: You have learned to tap into the dangerous but powerful art of Shadowsteel casting. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Curse Caster
entries: You always have Shadowsteel curses prepared, and you can cast them with any spell slots you have.

entries.name: Shadowsteel's Bite
entries: While holding your {@item Shadowsteel Focus|GrimHollowPG24}, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells.

entries.name: Shadowsteel Weapon
entries: If your {@item Shadowsteel Focus|GrimHollowPG24} is also a weapon, that weapon has a +1 bonus to weapon attack rolls and damage rolls.

feat.name: Shadowsteel Master
entries: Your mastery over Shadowsteel grows stronger. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Necrotic Harmony
entries: While holding your {@item Shadowsteel Focus|GrimHollowPG24}, when you cast a spell that targets one or more creatures and requires an attack roll or saving throw, you can choose one target you hit or who failed the saving throw to also take {@damage 1d4} Necrotic damage for each spell slot level expended to cast the spell.

entries.name: Necrotic Weapon
entries: If your {@item Shadowsteel Focus|GrimHollowPG24} is also a weapon, that weapon has a +2 bonus to weapon attack rolls and damage rolls. Additionally, once on each of your turns, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack roll using your {@item Shadowsteel Focus|GrimHollowPG24}, you can cause the target to take an extra {@damage 2d8} Necrotic damage.

feat.name: Syndicate Spy
entries: Rising in the ranks of the Ebon Syndicate has taught you the clandestine skills of spycraft, valuable in your trade as a racketeer. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Locksmith
entries: You have proficiency with {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}. While holding {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, you can craft a key to a lock by spending 10 minutes with that lock.

entries.name: Master of Disguise
entries: You have proficiency with a {@item Disguise Kit|XPHB}. If you spend 10 minutes donning a {@item Costume|XPHB},  you decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and other distinguishing characteristics. You can make yourself appear as a member of another species, though none of your statistics change. You can't appear as a creature of a different size, and your basic shape stays the same; if you're bipedal, you can't use this benefit to become quadrupedal, for instance.

entries.name: Master Calligrapher
entries: You have proficiency with a {@item Forgery Kit|XPHB}. You aren't limited to 10 or fewer words when mimicking someone else's handwriting.

entries.name: Blending In
entries: When using the {@action Hide|XPHB} action to conceal yourself from creatures that aren't {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} to you, you need only be {@variantrule Lightly Obscured|XPHB} and you may use Charisma instead of Dexterity for the check.

feat.name: Thrown Weapon Master
entries: You excel at thrown weapons. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Multithrow
entries: After you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action to make a ranged attack roll using a Simple weapon that has {@itemProperty T|XPHB|Thrown}, you can make two additional ranged attacks using Simple weapons that have {@itemProperty T|XPHB|Thrown} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

entries.name: Quick Hands
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can retrieve and stow or wield all Simple weapons with {@itemProperty T|XPHB|Thrown} that are within 5 feet of you. You need a free hand to perform this maneuver.

entries.name: Returning
entries: Simple weapons with {@itemProperty T|XPHB|Thrown} that you are proficient with also have the Returning property (see Chapter 8: Advanced Weapons & Equipment).

feat.name: Witch Hunter
entries: You have honed and perfected your skills fighting against spellcasters, possibly from your background hunting mages as part of the Arcanist Inquisition. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Dodge Spells
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to avoid a spell that is targeting only you and doesn't create an area of effect. Make a Wisdom saving throw against the spellcaster's spell save DC. On a successful save, the creature must choose a new target or the spell is canceled. A canceled spell dissipates with no effect, and any resources used to cast it are wasted.

entries.name: Keep Your Enemies Close
entries: When you hit a target that can cast spells with an attack roll using a Melee weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can reduce its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} by 15 feet until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Resist Curses
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against all Shadowsteel curses, and also against spells with a duration of more than 10 minutes.

feat.name: Advanced Weapon Proficiency
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Weapon Proficiency
entries: You have proficiency with Advanced weapons, and your training allows you to use the mastery properties of those weapons.

entries.name: Special
entries: This feat can be taken as a General feat by a character of level 8 or higher.

feat.name: Close Combat Artillerist
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Firing in Melee
entries: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your attack rolls with Ranged weapons.

entries.name: Point Blank
entries: When you hit a creature that is within 5 feet of you with a ranged attack, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

feat.name: Dual Shot
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Dual Shot
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn and attack with a bow or crossbow, you can make one extra attack as part of the same action against a creature that is within 10 feet of the original target that is within the weapon's range. If you do so, both attacks are made with {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

feat.name: Flurry
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Quick Strike
entries: Once on each of your turns when you make an attack roll with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} and have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the roll, you can forgo {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on that attack roll. After resolving that attack, you can then make another attack with the same weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} against a different creature. The new target must be within 5 feet of the first target and within the weapon's reach.

feat.name: Mobile Combatant
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Slippery
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet and {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} against you until the end of your turn.

feat.name: Opportunist
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Exploit Weakness
entries: Whenever you make an attack as part of a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, you gain a +2 bonus to the attack and damage rolls.

feat.name: Prone Defense
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Defensive
entries: When you have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, you don't have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls. {@action Attack|XPHB} roll against you doesn't have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} because of the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Hop Up
entries: When you have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, you can right yourself with only 5 feet of movement.

feat.name: Boon of the Archlich
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Vessel of Vitality
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, if your {@optfeature Soul Vessel|GrimHollowPG24} is not charged, it gains a soul and becomes charged.

feat.name: Boon of the Ascended Vampire
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Inured to Sunlight
entries: You are no longer affected by sunlight.

feat.name: Boon of the Earthly Tether
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Persistent Haunter
entries: You are no longer affected by the {@optfeature Fraying Reality|GrimHollowPG24|Fraying Reality Transformation Flaw}.

entries.name: Divergent Growth
entries: Choose any {@filter Specter Transformation Boon|optionalfeatures|source=grimhollowpg24|feature type=spec:tb|miscellaneous=} that you don't already have but meet the prerequisites for. You gain that Boon.

feat.name: Boon of the Elder Horror
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Stabilizing Form
entries: When you roll a 25 or lower on the {@table Unstable Form|GrimHollowPG24|Unstable Form table}, you can choose to roll again. You must use the new result. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Divergent Growth
entries: Choose any {@filter Aberrant Horror Transformation Boon|optionalfeatures|source=grimhollowpg24|feature type=ah:tb|miscellaneous=} that you don't already have but meet the prerequisites for. You gain that Boon.

feat.name: Boon of the Elder Fey
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Fey Bulwark
entries: You are no longer affected by the {@optfeature Weakened Constitution|GrimHollowPG24|Weakened Constitution Transformation Flaw}.

entries.name: Divergent Growth
entries: Choose any {@filter Fey Transformation Boon|optionalfeatures|source=grimhollowpg24|feature type=f:tb|miscellaneous=} that you don't already have but meet the prerequisites for. You gain that Boon.

entries.name: Free Agent
entries: You are no longer affected by the {@optfeature Pull of the Netherworld|GrimHollowPG24|Pull of the Netherworld Transformation Flaw}.

entries.name: Divergent Growth
entries: Choose any {@filter Fiend Transformation Boon|optionalfeatures|source=grimhollowpg24|feature type=fi:tb|miscellaneous=} that you don't already have but meet the prerequisites for. You gain that Boon.

feat.name: Boon of the Elemental Temperance
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Controlled Chaos
entries: You are no longer affected by the {@optfeature Primordial Chaos|GrimHollowPG24|Primordial Chaos Transformation Flaw}.

feat.name: Boon of the High Seraph
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Absolution
entries: You are no longer affected by the {@optfeature Seraph Corruption|GrimHollowPG24|Seraph Corruption Transformation Flaw}.

entries.name: Divergent Growth
entries: Choose any {@filter Seraph Transformation Boon|optionalfeatures|source=grimhollowpg24|feature type=ser:tb|miscellaneous=} that you don't already have but meet the prerequisites for. You gain that Boon.

feat.name: Boon of Magic Resistance
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Heroic Resistance
entries: If you fail a saving throw, you can cause yourself to succeed instead. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Boon of Perfect Flight
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Flying
entries: You have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 40 feet and can hover.

entries.name: Graceful Fall
entries: If you fall more than 5 feet, your rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until you land.

feat.name: Boon of Shadowsteel Mastery
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Strange Bedfellows
entries: You are no longer affected by the {@optfeature Friendless|GrimHollowPG24|Friendless Transformation Flaw}.

feat.name: Boon of the Wilds
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Apex Predator
entries: When you enter your Hybrid Form, you gain 25 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. At the end of each of your turns while in Hybrid Form, if you have no {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}, you gain 10 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. While you are in your Hybrid Form and have no {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls.

entries.name: Armor-Piercing
entries: An Armor-Piercing weapon is a Melee weapon designed to punch through armor or thick hide. When you make an attack roll using an Armor-Piercing weapon, you gain a +1 bonus to the attack roll if your target is wearing armor or has an {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} of 18 or higher.

entries.name: Blackpowder
entries: Blackpowder weapons fire projectiles with ear-splitting noise, shredding armor with deadly force. When fired, Blackpowder weapons emit a deafening crack audible 300 feet away. A Blackpowder weapon exposed to heavy rain, submerged, or similarly drenched in water, can't fire until dried for 1 hour. These weapons use paper cartridge bullets as ammunition.

entries.name: Cumbersome
entries: Cumbersome weapons are difficult to wield but are effective ranged tools for those strong enough to wield them. When making an attack with a Cumbersome weapon, you must use your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: Damage
entries: A Damage property weapon can deal different types of damage. When you hit with an attack from this weapon, choose one of the damage types allowed.

entries.name: Double
entries: A Double weapon functions as two Light weapons, one in each hand, for the purposes of two-weapon fighting. If a Double weapon has {@itemProperty R|XPHB|Reach}, you can use only one of these properties per turn.

entries.name: Hafted
entries: A Hafted weapon's haft can function well as an off-hand attack. After you use the {@action Attack|XPHB} action to attack with a Hafted weapon, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make a melee attack with the haft. The haft deals {@damage 1d6} Bludgeoning damage, and you add your ability modifier to damage.

entries.name: Magazine
entries: A weapon with the Magazine property also has a number and an ammunition type. The weapon holds that amount and type of ammunition, which you can expend before needing to reload the weapon. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you may remove a {@item Magazine|GrimHollowPG24} and then reload it with a new {@item Magazine|GrimHollowPG24}. A {@item Magazine|GrimHollowPG24} weapon comes with two empty magazines included in the weapon's cost and weight. An additional empty magazine for a Magazine weapon costs 25 GP. Loading an empty Magazine with ammunition takes 1 minute.

entries.name: Momentum
entries: Momentum weapons allow you to deliver devastating attacks as part of rapid movement. When you hit with a Momentum weapon after you moved 20 feet or more in a straight line during the same turn, upgrade the damage dice to the weapon's Momentum Dice value.

entries.name: Repeater
entries: Repeater weapons can fire ammo in quick succession, using multiple barrels or quick-reloading mechanisms. When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action with a Repeater weapon, you can shoot multiple times if you have features that let you attack more than once as part of that action, such as Extra Attack. After taking the {@action Attack|XPHB} action you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to attack once with the same weapon. You don't add your ability modifier to the {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}'s attack, unless that modifier is negative.

itemMastery.name: Brutal
entries: A Brutal weapon is designed for maximum damage. Brutal weapons score Critical Hits on a natural roll of 19 or 20. If your Critical Range is already increased, instead increase it by 1 point (such as from 19-20 to 18-20).
When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} with a Brutal weapon against a creature, the weapon deals one additional die of damage.

itemMastery.name: Defending
entries: A Defending weapon is either made for parrying, has advanced techniques for use in parrying, or both. When wielding a Defending weapon, you may use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you are hit by a melee attack roll. Roll {@dice 1d4} and add the result to your AC, including against the triggering attack.

itemMastery.name: Disarming
entries: A Disarming weapon can catch a foe's weapon, allowing you to remove it from their grasp. When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn and hit with a Disarming weapon, you can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} later on the same turn to disarm the target. Both you and the attacker must make opposed attack rolls, ignoring any sources of {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} and {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}. If your result is higher and the weapon is something the target can drop, the weapon falls from the target's grasp, landing in its space.

If your winning result on the opposed attack roll was a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}, you can choose for the weapon either to land in a space of your choice up to 15 feet from the target, or to land in your hand if you have a free hand.

itemMastery.name: Entangling
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn and hit with an Entangling weapon, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} later on the same turn to entangle the target. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 10 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or have the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition until it escapes or until you release the weapon. The target succeeds automatically if it is Huge or larger.

To escape, the target must use an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics|XPHB}) check against the same DC. On a success, the target no longer has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition. While a creature is {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by this weapon, you can't use it to attack a different creature.

itemMastery.name: Returning
entries: A Returning weapon allows you to hurl the weapon in such a way that it returns to you. When you make a ranged attack with a Returning weapon, the weapon returns to you immediately after hitting or missing the target. You can catch the weapon if you have a hand free to do so.

itemMastery.name: Scatter
entries: Scatter weapons can devastate multiple enemies at once. When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action and hit a creature with a Scatter weapon, measure the weapon's scatter range from the target's space (or one square the creature occupies if it is Large or larger). Creatures other than the original target that fall within the weapon's scatter range take damage equal to your 1 + your Dexterity modifier (minimum 2). This damage is of the same type you dealt to the original target.

itemMastery.name: Set
entries: Weapons with the Set property allow you to prepare for an oncoming attack. If a target enters your reach while you wield a weapon with this property, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make a melee attack with the weapon against that target.

itemMastery.name: Strong-Draw
entries: A weapon with the Strong-Draw quality requires great strength to use. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls with a Strong-Draw weapon unless your Strength is 13 or higher. You add both your Strength and Dexterity modifiers to damage with a Strong-Draw weapon.

itemMastery.name: Swift
entries: Swift weapons help you recover quickly from missed attacks. When you miss with a Swift weapon, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the first attack roll you make with the weapon against the same target before the end of your next turn. If that attack hits, it also deals an extra {@damage 1d4} damage of the weapon's normal damage type.

item.name: Sling Bullet, Piercing
entries: Advanced Ammunition named after a damage type deals that damage type. Arrows and bolts can have wide heads that deal Slashing damage or blunt tips that deal Bludgeoning damage. A sling bullet can have facets that deal Piercing damage. All such ammo is heavier than normal; the weapon's maximum range while using it is halved.

item.name: Sling Bullet, Ranging
entries: Advanced Ammunition that has the Ranging property is lighter and better made than common counterparts. When you fire Ranging ammo, you can increase your weapon's normal range by 50 percent.

item.name: Sling Bullet, Whistling
entries: Ammunition with the Whistling property creates a high-pitched sound after firing. This sound is audible out to 300 feet from the ammo as it flies. Whistling ammo isn't heavier, but it catches the air with intricate baffles to create its sound, so its maximum range is half normal. Whistling ammo deals Bludgeoning damage.

item.name: Arrow, Whistling
entries: Ammunition with the Whistling property creates a high-pitched sound after firing. This sound is audible out to 300 feet from the ammo as it flies. Whistling ammo isn't heavier, but it catches the air with intricate baffles to create its sound, so its maximum range is half normal. Whistling ammo deals Bludgeoning damage.

item.name: Arrow, Slashing
entries: Advanced Ammunition named after a damage type deals that damage type. Arrows and bolts can have wide heads that deal Slashing damage or blunt tips that deal Bludgeoning damage. A sling bullet can have facets that deal Piercing damage. All such ammo is heavier than normal; the weapon's maximum range while using it is halved.

item.name: Arrow, Ranging
entries: Advanced Ammunition that has the Ranging property is lighter and better made than common counterparts. When you fire Ranging ammo, you can increase your weapon's normal range by 50 percent.

item.name: Arrow, Bludgeoning
entries: Advanced Ammunition named after a damage type deals that damage type. Arrows and bolts can have wide heads that deal Slashing damage or blunt tips that deal Bludgeoning damage. A sling bullet can have facets that deal Piercing damage. All such ammo is heavier than normal; the weapon's maximum range while using it is halved.

item.name: Bolt, Whistling
entries: Ammunition with the Whistling property creates a high-pitched sound after firing. This sound is audible out to 300 feet from the ammo as it flies. Whistling ammo isn't heavier, but it catches the air with intricate baffles to create its sound, so its maximum range is half normal. Whistling ammo deals Bludgeoning damage.

item.name: Bolt, Slashing
entries: Advanced Ammunition named after a damage type deals that damage type. Arrows and bolts can have wide heads that deal Slashing damage or blunt tips that deal Bludgeoning damage. A sling bullet can have facets that deal Piercing damage. All such ammo is heavier than normal; the weapon's maximum range while using it is halved.

item.name: Bolt, Ranging
entries: Advanced Ammunition that has the Ranging property is lighter and better made than common counterparts. When you fire Ranging ammo, you can increase your weapon's normal range by 50 percent.

item.name: Bolt, Bludgeoning
entries: Advanced Ammunition named after a damage type deals that damage type. Arrows and bolts can have wide heads that deal Slashing damage or blunt tips that deal Bludgeoning damage. A sling bullet can have facets that deal Piercing damage. All such ammo is heavier than normal; the weapon's maximum range while using it is halved.

item.name: Arrow, Acid
entries: Alchemical Ammunition carries an alchemical payload. Rather than hurling a vial, you fire Alchemical Ammunition from a Ranged weapon, using your normal attack bonus with that weapon.
Alchemical Ammunition is heavier than normal; the weapon's normal and long ranges are halved. The Alchemical Ammunition is destroyed once used, whether the attack hits or misses.

entries.name: {@item Acid|XPHB}
entries: When one of these pieces of Alchemical Ammunition hits, it deals the ammunition's normal damage, then applies the effect of the listed item to the target. No saving throw is allowed against this effect.

item.name: Arrow, Alchemist's Fire
entries: Alchemical Ammunition carries an alchemical payload. Rather than hurling a vial, you fire Alchemical Ammunition from a Ranged weapon, using your normal attack bonus with that weapon.
Alchemical Ammunition is heavier than normal; the weapon's normal and long ranges are halved. The Alchemical Ammunition is destroyed once used, whether the attack hits or misses.

entries.name: {@item Alchemist's Fire|XPHB}
entries: When one of these pieces of Alchemical Ammunition hits, it deals the ammunition's normal damage, then applies the effect of the listed item to the target. No saving throw is allowed against this effect.

item.name: Arrow, Holy Water
entries: Alchemical Ammunition carries an alchemical payload. Rather than hurling a vial, you fire Alchemical Ammunition from a Ranged weapon, using your normal attack bonus with that weapon.
Alchemical Ammunition is heavier than normal; the weapon's normal and long ranges are halved. The Alchemical Ammunition is destroyed once used, whether the attack hits or misses.

entries.name: {@item Holy Water|XPHB}
entries: When one of these pieces of Alchemical Ammunition hits, it deals the ammunition's normal damage, then applies the effect of the listed item to the target. No saving throw is allowed against this effect.

item.name: Arrow, War Oil
entries: Alchemical Ammunition carries an alchemical payload. Rather than hurling a vial, you fire Alchemical Ammunition from a Ranged weapon, using your normal attack bonus with that weapon.
Alchemical Ammunition is heavier than normal; the weapon's normal and long ranges are halved. The Alchemical Ammunition is destroyed once used, whether the attack hits or misses.

entries.name: War Oil
entries: A target hit by a piece of Alchemical Ammunition packed with War Oil takes damage as normal for the ammunition, then becomes coated in War Oil for up to 1 minute. Alternatively, you can target a point, such as the ground or a wall, and on an attack roll against AC 10, cause the War Oil to spill out of the ammunition, creating a circular patch of the viscous substance with a 10-foot radius.

War Oil is slick and highly flammable. An area coated in War Oil counts as {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}, and a creature that starting its turn in a coated area or enters the coated area for the first time on a turn must succeed a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or gain the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition and have its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} reduced to 0 until the end of its turn. Additionally, if a creature or area coated with War

Oil is exposed to an open flame or some other source of Fire damage, the oil ignites. The ignited oil burns for two rounds, dealing {@damage 2d4} Fire damage to any creature or object who comes in contact with it, and an additional {@damage 2d4} Fire damage to any creature that ends its turn while in contact with it. An ignited creature can douse the flames by using an action.
After burning for two rounds, being doused, or remaining unlit for 1 minute, War Oil dries up and ceases to be slippery or flammable.

item.name: Bolt, Acid
entries: Alchemical Ammunition carries an alchemical payload. Rather than hurling a vial, you fire Alchemical Ammunition from a Ranged weapon, using your normal attack bonus with that weapon.
Alchemical Ammunition is heavier than normal; the weapon's normal and long ranges are halved. The Alchemical Ammunition is destroyed once used, whether the attack hits or misses.

item.name: Arrow, Armor-Piercing
entries: This ammunition works like an {@itemProperty AP|GrimHollowPG24|Armor-Piercing} Melee weapon, but you fire the ammunition as a projectile from a Ranged weapon.

item.name: Arrow, Blessed
entries: When you hit with Blessed ammunition, the weapon's damage type becomes Radiant. Also, if the target is Fiend, Fey, or Undead, that creature's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn, and the creature can't take {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions} until the start of its next turn.

item.name: Arrow, Brutal
entries: Designed to open wide wounds, such as with a broad-bladed arrowhead, Brutal ammunition works like a {@itemMastery Brutal|GrimHollowPG24} Melee weapon.

item.name: Arrow, Desecrated
entries: When you hit with Desecrated ammunition, the weapon's damage type becomes Necrotic. Also, if the target is Celestial, Humanoid, or Plant, that creature's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn, and the creature can't take {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions} until the start of its next turn.

item.name: Arrow, Incendiary
entries: When you hit with Incendiary ammunition, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d4} Fire damage.

item.name: Bolt, Armor-Piercing
entries: This ammunition works like an {@itemProperty AP|GrimHollowPG24|Armor-Piercing} Melee weapon, but you fire the ammunition as a projectile from a Ranged weapon.

item.name: Bolt, Blessed
entries: When you hit with Blessed ammunition, the weapon's damage type becomes Radiant. item.name: Sling Bullet, Incendiary
entries: When you hit with Incendiary ammunition, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d4} Fire damage.

item.name: Blessed Stake
entries: A Blessed Stake is a necessary tool in the arsenal of vampire hunters everywhere. This wooden spike, roughly a foot in length, has been blessed by a servant of an Arch Seraph in a special ceremony.

As an {@action Attack|XPHB} action, a wielder can make a melee attack using Strength. Against most foes, this deals {@damage 1d4} Piercing damage. Against a Vampire that has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} or {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, a successful attack with the Blessed Stake kills the Vampire.

If the Vampire is CR 10 or lower, the Vampire instantly crumbles to dust. If the Vampire is more powerful, its form remains whole for one year before crumbling to dust. If the Blessed Stake is removed before then, the Vampire rises with 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}.

item.name: Breath of Beleth (Poison)
entries: Named after the Arch Daemon of Fear, this poison creates an extremely powerful hallucinogenic effect that evokes a victim's worst fears. The poison is airborne, and victims need only breathe it in to suffer its effects. On the rare occasions it has been used, people in crammed rooms have jumped out of windows or even killed each other out of abject fear.

Rumors say that the poison has been forbidden even by the Ebon Syndicate, deeming it too dangerous, too extravagant, and too conspicuous. Chances are that such a powerful substance wasn't simply abandoned, however, and other rumors say the Ebon Syndicate still uses a milder version during interrogation.

entries.name: Breath of Beleth (Inhaled)
entries: A creature who breathes and is in the same space as an open container of the substance must succeed at a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for 1 minute.

While {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} in this way, a creature has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition, and it is {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} to all creatures it can see. If a creature moves within 5 feet of a creature {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} in this way, the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} creature must use the {@action Dash|XPHB} action on its turn to move away. If it cannot move away, it must instead use the {@action Attack|XPHB} action against the adjacent creature.

item.name: Buckler
entries: This small shield is worn on the forearm. While worn, it gives you +1 to AC, and it can be used as a Martial Melee weapon with {@itemProperty L|XPHB|Light} that deals {@damage 1d4} Bludgeoning damage.

item.name: Concealed Blade
entries: A Concealed Blade is a {@item Dagger|XPHB} built into a mechanism hidden within a bracer or gauntlet. When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can make a Dexterity ({@skill Deception|XPHB}) check opposed by others' Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the first attack made in the first round of combat against any enemy who failed their check.

item.name: Fire Bomb
entries: You can throw a Fire Bomb by using an {@action Attack|XPHB} action. Target one space you can see within 20 feet. A creature in this space must make on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature in that space takes {@damage 2d6} Slashing damage and {@damage 4d6} Fire damage and starts {@hazard Burning|XPHB}. Creatures adjacent to the attacked space take half that damage and are not {@hazard Burning|XPHB}.

item.name: Grappling Gun
entries: A Grappling Gun can shoot a {@item Grappling Hook|XPHB} attached to a rope up to 150 feet, and the hook catches with a successful DC 10 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics|XPHB}) check.

Additionally, if you are falling, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to shoot the Grappling Gun at an attachable surface to stop your fall. You still must succeed on the check to ensure the {@item Grappling Hook|XPHB} catches on a solid object. On a successful check, you stop your fall.

item.name: Hunter's Armor
entries: Hunter's Armor is a favorite of monster hunters across the length and breadth of Etharis. Any type of armor can be constructed as Hunter's Armor by paying the listed extra cost. This reinforces the most vital areas with adamantine and mithral threads to turn devastating hits into normal wounds.
If a blow would cause a {@variantrule Grievous Wound|GrimHollowPG24}, roll a {@dice d20}. On an 11 or higher, the blow does not deliver a {@variantrule Grievous Wound|GrimHollowPG24}.

item.name: Iron Net
entries: This net is comprised of tiny interlocking iron rings. It acts as a normal Net, with the following changes:

items: The Iron Net's range is 10 feet.
The DC of the Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check to escape is 15.
The Iron Net has AC 13 and 15 HP.

item.name: Mastercraft Instrument
entries: These musical instruments are not just the work of the finest luthiers and artisans in Etharis, they have secret embellishments and innovations that can add to a musical performance.

If you are proficient in the instrument and have a {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} of at least +4, all Charisma ({@skill Performance|XPHB}) checks made using a Mastercraft Instrument have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

item.name: Noisemaker
entries: This small mechanical device is a specialty of gnomish crafters. As a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action, you can throw the Noisemaker into a space within 60 feet. When it lands, it makes a loud noise of some kind, depending on the whims of the creator: a musical clash, a whistling, a whirring, a buzzing, etc. This noise can be heard up to half a mile away.

A creature with an Intelligence score of 3 or less that is within 60 feet of the device when it goes off must succeed in a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition for one minute. As an {@action Influence|XPHB} action, another creature who the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} creature can see or hear can attempt a DC 20 Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling|XPHB}) or Charisma ({@skill Persuasion|XPHB}) check. On a success, the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition ends on that creature.

item.name: Prosthetics
entries: The brutal warfare and vicious monsters prevalent across Etharis leave many with {@variantrule Grievous Wound|GrimHollowPG24|Grievous Wounds}, including missing limbs and other potentially debilitating injuries. The engineers and crafters of the world have made great strides in helping those people deal with those injuries through Prosthetics.

When a creature with a {@variantrule Grievous Wound|GrimHollowPG24} uses a Prosthetic, they ignore the penalties imposed by the {@variantrule Grievous Wound|GrimHollowPG24} while wearing a Prosthetic that replaces the lost or wounded body part.
Some Prosthetics can be enchanted with magic, giving them even further powers. Rules for Magical Prosthetics can be found in the {@i Grim Hollow Campaign Guide}.

item.name: Retractable Shield
entries: This mechanized shield retracts into a bracer worn on the forearm. With a quick motion, it can be expanded just as an opponent believes they've snuck a blow.

You can wear the Retractable Shield as a bracer on your forearm, and it does not count as having that hand occupied while the shield is retracted. As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to an attack hitting you, you can extend the shield, giving you a bonus to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} against that attack. If this changes the attack from a hit into a miss, you may make one melee attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} against the provoking creature if they are within reach. The shield remains extended until the start of your next turn.

As a free interaction with an object on your turn, you can either extend or retract the shield. While the shield is extended, it occupies your hand and confers a +2 bonus to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}.

item.name: Seeing Glass
entries: This ornate silver hand mirror is decorated with a motif of withered roses. The mirror's reflection always shows the true form of any creature viewed in it as if the viewer had {@sense Truesight|XPHB}.
If the Seeing Glass is turned upon a vampire, the glass immediately shatters and is destroyed.

item.name: Shadowsteel Focus
entries: Shadowsteel Focus is a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} that contains some amount of Shadowsteel. Any {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} can be made as a Shadowsteel Focus.

There is no benefit to using a Shadowsteel Focus instead of a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB}; however, a spellcaster with the {@feat Shadowsteel Adept|GrimHollowPG24} and {@feat Shadowsteel Master|GrimHollowPG24} feats can gain the benefits associated with that feat when they use a Shadowsteel Focus.

item.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: As a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action, you can throw this smoky glass vial to a space up to 30 feet away. When the vial breaks, the concoction creates a 10-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} of smoke. The area is {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB}. The smoke lasts for {@dice 1d4 + 2} rounds, or half as long in a windy area.

item.name: Stitching Needle
entries: This black iron needle easily pierces the skin. If a creature's mouth is sewn shut with a Stitching Needle, it loses the ability to speak and cast spells with verbal components. The creature gains the ability to communicate with {@variantrule Telepathy|XPHB} out to a range of 60 feet.
Stitching the mouth of a willing, {@condition Unconscious|XPHB}, or {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} creature takes 10 minutes. Removing the stitches takes 1 minute.

item.name: Tower Shield
entries: This large shield provides more protection than a typical shield. While wielding a Tower Shield, you gain +3 to {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}. If you use an action to set the Tower Shield, you have {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Three-Quarters Cover} until the start of your next turn. Additionally, your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} becomes 0 and cannot be increased during that time.
To wield a Tower Shield, you must have a Strength of at least 15 and your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced by 10 feet while wielding the shield.

item.name: Watcher's Candle
entries: This black tapered candle cannot be lit. When a Celestial, Fey, Fiend, or Undead comes within 120 feet of the candle, its wick ignites and burns with a purple flame. Once the candle has ignited, it burns for one hour, and it cannot be used again. Watcher's Candles cannot function if they are wrapped in packaging or stowed in a container.

entries.name: Advanced Equipment
entries: The brilliant engineers and crafters who designed and built Etharis's highly advanced weapons and ammunition did not stop there. Other inventions of war—and of peace—became invaluable to the soldiers, guards, and adventurers of Etharis.

Some pieces of Advanced equipment, such as the corrupting {@item Shadowsteel Focus|GrimHollowPG24}, need special training to fully employ. Other items, like the {@item Retractable Shield|GrimHollowPG24}, are usable by anyone proficient with shields. And many other pieces of equipment are usable by anyone—though few would be able to afford and maintain these mechanical, alchemical, or even magical marvels.

As they are expensive and difficult to make, access to Advanced equipment is limited—maybe even as limited as some magic items. The largest cities, or locations housing master crafters, may only have a few items of Advanced equipment.

optionalfeature.name: Amphibious
entries: Surviving underwater is second nature to you. You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Water Born
