entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks or saving throws made while submerged in water. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Animal Friend
entries: Time spent among beasts has gifted you a way with those creatures. You have proficiency in the {@skill Animal Handling|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Animal Ally
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@skill Animal Handling|XPHB} checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Artifice Expertise
entries: Working with detritus and shattered objects has granted you an affinity for repairing and remaking things. You have proficiency with {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB}. (This is an Exploration trait.) Additionally, you can use your {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB} and 10 GP worth of appropriate materials to spend 10 minutes creating a small clockwork device. The device must fit in the palm of your hand, and can serve one of the following functions:

entries.name: {@style Smoker|small}
entries: The device exudes smoke in a 5-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} for 1 minute. Any objects or creatures within this {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} are considered {@variantrule Lightly Obscured|XPHB}.

entries.name: {@style Lighter|small}
entries: The device emits a small flame the size of a candle's that can light flammable objects.

entries.name: {@style Compass|small}
entries: The device always points north, or in a cardinal direction of the GM's determination on another plane.

entries.name: Expert Gadgeteer
entries: If you take this trait twice, you can make a device in 1 minute instead of 10 minutes. In addition, you can choose to imbue a device with the following extra function: (This is a Combat trait.)

entries.name: {@style Distractor|small}
entries: This device is set with blinking lights that can captivate other creatures. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you place or toss the device into a space within 30 feet of you. A creature sharing a space with the device must succeed on a DC 10 Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, attacks against that creature have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} until the start of your next turn. A creature can use an action to destroy the device. You can give up to three of your devices the Distractor feature. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Artificial Form
entries: You were made, not born, and your unnatural origin forever marks you as different. You are a Construct, but your enchanted form still benefits from healing spells. You can also heal yourself by spending {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} during {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short Rests} and {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB|Long Rests}, as normal.
You don't need to eat, drink, sleep, or breathe. You must still be inactive for 8 hours during a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} to gain its benefits.

entries.name: Self-Repair
entries: If you take this trait twice, when the {@spell Mending|XPHB} cantrip is cast on you, you can spend a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Die} to regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll of the die plus your Constitution modifier (minimum 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}). You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Artisanal Focus
entries: You revere the crafting skill of ancestors long dead. Choose an {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB}. You have proficiency with that tool.

entries.name: Artisanal Expertise
entries: If you take this trait multiple times, you gain proficiency with a new tool each time.

Additionally, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks made using any tool you selected with Artisanal Focus. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Athlete's Spirit
entries: Your reserves of physical power have kept you alive on more than one occasion. You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Athlete's Resolve
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Athletics checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Awakened Mind
entries: The dangers of Etharis have given you a focus that allows you to shrug off debilitating magical effects. You automatically succeed on saving throws against magical effects that would give you the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, {@condition Stunned|XPHB}, or {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} conditions. This does not include effects that leave you {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} because you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Reawakened
entries: If you take this trait twice, you also have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Awesome Critical
entries: When fortune favors your blade, you know how to make it count. When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} with a melee attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}.

entries.name: Maximum Critical
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you use Awesome Critical, you can add the maximum of the weapon's original damage dice and the extra Awesome Critical die to the extra damage of the {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}, rather than rolling them. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Battlefield Control
entries: When foes attempt to press you in melee, they do so at their peril. Other creatures provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} from you whenever they move into your reach, in addition to when they move out of your reach.

entries.name: Battlefield Dominance
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Born Healer
entries: When others suffer, you are there to help. You have proficiency in the {@skill Medicine|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Combat Doctor
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@skill Medicine|XPHB} checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Brave
entries: The horrors you've lived through have hardened you. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid being {@condition Frightened|XPHB}.

entries.name: Infectious Bravery
entries: If you take this trait twice, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to bolster the spirits of your allies, granting one ally who can see or hear you {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on a saving throw against being {@condition Frightened|XPHB}. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Breath Weapon
entries: A connection to draconic or elemental fury lets you unleash a blast of destructive energy. When you select this trait, choose a damage type: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder. Then choose an area of effect: a {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} that is 5 feet wide and 30 feet long, or a 15-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}.

When you use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to expel your Breath Weapon, each creature in the area of effect must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). A target creature takes {@damage 1d8} damage of the chosen type on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach character levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Potent Breath
entries: If you take this trait multiple times, you gain an additional breath weapon each time, with its own number of uses, damage type, and area of effect. Additionally, when you use any of your Breath Weapons, one target of your choice has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the saving throw. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Burst of Speed
entries: The many things that want to kill you must catch you first. On your turn, you can increase your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} by 30 feet until the end of your turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Furious Speed
entries: If you take this trait twice, on a turn when you use Burst of Speed, you don't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

optionalfeature.name: Calculating Listener
entries: The weak-willed around you are easy targets for your manipulation. By conversing with a nonhostile creature for at least 1 minute, you can attempt to charm them. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your Charisma modifier + your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for 1 hour. At the GM's discretion, you also learn one piece of information that the target knows that relates to the topic of conversation while you speak to them. Regardless of whether or not the target succeeds on the saving throw, they remain unaware of your attempt. You regain use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Master Manipulator
entries: If you take this trait twice, a creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the saving throw, and it has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for 8 hours on a failed save.

optionalfeature.name: Centered
entries: By focusing your inner strength, you gain a needed edge. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you grant yourself {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on an attack roll or ability check you make before the start of your next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Centered Edge
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you succeed on the attack roll or ability check made while using Centered, you can choose one creature within 30 feet of you. That creature has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll or ability check they make before the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Charging Attack
entries: The fury with which you throw yourself into battle forces your foes to feel your wrath. If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with a melee attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} on the same turn, you can make another attack against the same target as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} with the same weapon.

entries.name: Furious Charge
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you use Charging Attack, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on all attacks after the triggering movement until the end of your turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Climber
entries: Sometimes staying away from what threatens you means getting clear of those threats. You have a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Wall Walker
entries: If you take this trait twice, you can use your {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} to move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.

Additionally, while using climbing movement, you can use the {@action Dash|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Commanding Insight
entries: Those who attempt to deceive you do so in vain. You have proficiency in the {@skill Insight|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Exceptional Insight
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Insight checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Connection to Nature
entries: You've learned that paying attention to the environment around you is the best way to predict its threats. You have proficiency in the {@skill Nature|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Bond with Nature
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Nature checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Crafter's Eye
entries: The history of Etharis is written in relics, and you read that history better than most. When you make a {@skill History|XPHB} check related to any object (an item, device, building, or material) and you have proficiency in an {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} associated with creating that object, you are considered proficient in {@skill History|XPHB} and you add double your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to the check instead of your normal bonus.

entries.name: Crafter's Cunning
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the {@skill History|XPHB} checks you make with Crafter's Eye. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Creature Cover
entries: By slipping behind enemies or allies alike, you are able to fade from view with ease. You can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action even when you have {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover} from a creature, as long as that creature is of a size larger than you.

entries.name: Subtle Cover
entries: If you take this trait twice, you can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action when you have {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover} from a creature the same size as you.

optionalfeature.name: Damage Resistance
entries: Exposure to the worst effects of a specific energy has given you a tolerance to its effects. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to one of the following damage types of your choice: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder.

entries.name: Damage Immunity
entries: If you take this trait twice, as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to taking damage of the type you chose for {@variantrule Damage|XPHB} {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}, you gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to that damage type until the end of your next turn. You regain the use this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Darkvision
entries: A life spent in shadow has made you grow accustomed to the gloom. You can see in {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} within 60 feet of you as if it were {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB}, and in {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB} within 60 feet of you as if it were {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB}. You can't discern color in {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Improved Darkvision
entries: If you take this trait twice, the range of your {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} increases to 120 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Sangromancy
entries: A connection to the life force of others lets you shape that force to their benefit. Whenever an allied creature within 30 feet of you regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can spend a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Die} and add the roll of the die to the number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} gained by the ally.

entries.name: Sangromancy Savant
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you use Divine Sangromancy, you also regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Die} roll.

optionalfeature.name: Draining Attack
entries: As your enemy's life force ebbs, you grow ever stronger. If you have the {@optfeature Natural Attack|GrimHollowPG24} trait, each time you hit with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the damage dealt by the attack.

entries.name: To the Dregs
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you use Draining Attack, the target also takes a penalty to their {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum equal to the damage dealt by the attack. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Dreamwalking
entries: Whenever you rest, you touch the dreams of those around you, seeding their thoughts and memories into your own mind. When you make an ability check to recall lore or knowledge, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the check. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Secret Dreams
entries: If you take this trait twice, you gain an instinctive knowledge of the secrets of other creatures while you touch their dreams. Using a {@action Search|XPHB} action, you focus on one creature you can see and make a DC 15 Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) check. With a successful check, you learn one secret of the GM's choice known to that creature. The secrets of creatures that don't have a language come to you as vague images and impressions. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Driver
entries: The roads and waterways of Etharis are often no less dangerous than the open wilderness, and you dedicate yourself to moving others safely on those routes. You have proficiency with {@item Navigator's Tools|XPHB}, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks made to drive a vehicle.

entries.name: Remarkable Driver
entries: If you take this trait twice, you can make checks involving driving a vehicle that require an action without having to use your action. You can only get this free use once per round.

optionalfeature.name: Eager Deceiver
entries: You long ago learned that being open with others only gives them power over you. You have proficiency in the {@skill Deception|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Expert Deceiver
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Deception checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Embrace the Past
entries: The lessons of the past are harsh, but learning those lessons might give you the best insight for navigating the future. You have proficiency in the {@skill History|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Deep Lore
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@skill History|XPHB} checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Enemy in Motion
entries: A lifetime spent wandering lets you judge when others' movement works to your benefit. When you make an attack roll against a creature or make a saving throw against a creature's attack, spell, or ability, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the attack roll or saving throw if that creature moved since the end of your last turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Moving Insight
entries: If you take this trait twice, Enemy in Motion also lets you use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to affect an ally's attack roll or saving throw if your ally is within 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Environmental Awareness
entries: The natural world is a dangerous place, and your connection to specific parts of that world grants you an edge in survival. Choose an environment: arctic, coastal, desert, forest, grassland, hill and mountain, swamp, subterranean, or underwater. While in that environment, whenever you make an ability check to assess structures, monuments, or natural features; to find food or drinkable water; or to track creatures, you are considered to have proficiency in the appropriate skill for the check, and you add double your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to the check instead of your normal bonus.

entries.name: Adaptive Awareness
entries: If you take this trait multiple times, you gain its benefit for a new environment each time.

Additionally, when you make an ability check using Environmental Awareness, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the check. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Ethereal Fade
entries: Shifting away from the mortal world lets you move through and observe that world unseen. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you fade from the Material Plane into the Ethereal Plane for 1 minute. While you remain in this state, you can't interact with the Material Plane, and effects on the Material Plane can't affect you, including spells and creatures. You can move and hear as normal, and you see everything in shades of gray. When the effect ends, you reappear in the Material Plane in the closest unoccupied space to where you faded from. You can end the effect early as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. You regain the use of this feature again when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Ethereal Focus
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} when making Wisdom checks as part of a {@action Search|XPHB} action.

optionalfeature.name: Even in Sleep
entries: An instinctive sense for danger protects you at all times. While you have the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition while asleep, you are aware of your surroundings and can make {@skill Perception|XPHB} checks normally.

entries.name: Sleeping Ward
entries: If you take this trait twice, while you are asleep, you automatically detect the presence of any creature intending harm to you that moves within 30 feet of you. A creature that is simply capable of harming you does not trigger this trait until it has intent to do so. For example, a wild animal might approach you cautiously, then decide to attack only when it realizes you are sleeping.

optionalfeature.name: Fade Away
entries: You have learned to avoid notice at all costs, letting you momentarily obscure yourself from observation. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action to conceal yourself without needing to be {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB} or behind {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Three-Quarters Cover} or {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover}. You need not be out of a creature's line of sight to use this ability.

You become visible at the start of your next turn unless you have moved into a position that allows you to use the {@action Hide|XPHB} action normally. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Long Fade
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on your ability check when you take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action from Fade Away, and you become visible at the end of your next turn instead of the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Firm Influence
entries: Others have learned to fear you—and for good reason. You have proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Terrifying Influence
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intimidation checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: First Strike
entries: Hesitation in others is a weakness you've learned to take deadly advantage of. When you hit a creature that hasn't taken a turn in the combat yet, your attack deals an extra {@damage 2d6} damage. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Strong Strike
entries: If you take this trait twice, you can use the maximum value of the extra damage dice from First Strike, rather than rolling. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Fleet of Foot
entries: As you've learned more than once, moving fast is often the best way to avoid trouble. Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 5 feet.

entries.name: Shared Fleetness
entries: If you take this trait twice, your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by another 5 feet, for a total increase of 10 feet.

Additionally, as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose any number of creatures within 30 feet. Those creatures gain a 10 foot bonus to their {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} for 1 minute. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Focused Mind
entries: Your strength of will protects you from magic that would corrupt your mind. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against being {@condition Charmed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Immutable Mind
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you fail a saving throw against being {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to succeed on the save instead. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Focused Reserves
entries: No matter how badly beaten down you are, you find the will to keep fighting when you most need it. As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} after you take damage, you can roll a number of d6s equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the total. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Focused Edge
entries: If you take this trait twice, you can reroll 1s and 2s when you use Focused Reserves, but you must use the new rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Gifted Performer
entries: When you desire to stand out, you have a natural gift for impressing others. You have proficiency in the {@skill Performance|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: A Sight to Behold
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Performance checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Helping Hand
entries: You excel at aiding your allies, knowing that the time will come when you need them to return the favor. You can use the {@action Help|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to assist any ally making an ability check. (This is an Exploration trait.)

entries.name: Helpful Tactics
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you use Helping Hand, you can also assist an ally making an attack roll. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. (This is a Combat trait.)

optionalfeature.name: Hold Breath
entries: Whether trapped under black water or resisting poisonous fumes, you refuse to give in. You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour.

entries.name: Endless Breath
entries: If you take this trait twice, you can hold your breath for up to 8 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter's Instinct
entries: You summon a surge of ferocity when your prey least expects it. At the end of each {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you gain a number of d8s equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. When you make an attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can roll a {@dice d8} and add it to either the attack roll or the damage roll. If you add it to the {@dice d20} roll, you can decide to roll the {@dice d8} after the {@dice d20} roll is made, but you must do so before the outcome of the roll is known.

entries.name: Relentless Instinct
entries: If you take this trait twice, whenever you use Hunter's Instinct for an attack roll, if the attack roll misses, you retain the {@dice d8} and can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Impromptu Artisan
entries: You've never known the luxury of always having the  gear you need, but you have more than learned to make do. If you possess {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} with which you have proficiency, and if you have access to appropriate raw materials and any additional necessary equipment (as the GM determines), you can use a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} to craft any one nonmagical item worth 10 GP or less, including:

items: A unique item that performs a simple function approved by the GM

entries: The gear you create is workable but not high quality, and can't be sold except as the GM determines.

entries.name: Master Artisan
entries: If you take this trait twice, you can use Impromptu Artisan during a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, during which you craft one nonmagical item worth 50 GP or less.

optionalfeature.name: Improviser
entries: When needs demand, you get the job done better than most. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose one skill or tool that you don't have proficiency with. You have proficiency in that skill or with that tool for 1 hour. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Expert Improviser
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks you make using the skill or tool you select with Improviser. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Inborn Perception
entries: The best way to avoid danger is to make sure you're the first person to notice it. You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Piercing Perception
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Perception checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Instinctive Stealth
entries: When trouble comes for you, you excel at making sure it can't find you. You have proficiency in the {@skill Stealth|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Calculated Disappearance
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@skill Stealth|XPHB} checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Instrumentalist
entries: In the quieter moments, music can help you forget the horrors you've seen. You have proficiency with {@item Musical Instrument|XPHB|two instruments} of your choice.

entries.name: Virtuoso
entries: If you take this trait multiple times, you gain proficiency with two new instruments each time.

Additionally, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks made using any instrument. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Intrinsic Orientation
entries: A single misstep can lead to ruin, but your instincts for direction keep you from going astray. You always know which way is north, and you can reckon a cardinal direction of the GM's determination while on other planes. Additionally, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks made to avoid becoming lost, to navigate, or to track.

entries.name: Expert Orientation
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you fail an ability check made to avoid becoming lost, to navigate, or to track, you can choose to succeed instead. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Intuitive Acrobat
entries: Staying loose and limber means being able to get out of even the tightest spots when your life is on the line. You have proficiency in the {@skill Acrobatics|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Stunt Expert
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@skill Acrobatics|XPHB} checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Inured to the Elements
entries: Even beneath scorching sun and in freezing cold, you hold yourself strong. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Constitution saving throws made to resist the effects of extreme cold or extreme heat.

entries.name: Immune to the Elements
entries: If you take this trait twice, you automatically succeed on Constitution saving throws to resist the effects of extreme cold or extreme heat.

optionalfeature.name: Irrepressible Sight
entries: Any foe you can see is a foe you can take down—so you make sure nothing prevents you from seeing. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against having the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Resolute Sight
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you fail a saving throw against having the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to succeed on the save instead. You regain the use of this feature after you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Keen Survivor
entries: The wilds of Etharis have claimed many who lack the skill to navigate them. You have proficiency in the {@skill Survival|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Determined Survivor
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@skill Survival|XPHB} checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Larger Target
entries: Foes that outsize you quickly learn to fear your wrath. If you hit a creature that is one size larger than you, you can choose to deal extra damage to the creature equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Even Larger
entries: If you take this trait twice, Larger Target applies to creatures of any size larger than you.

optionalfeature.name: Light Armor Training
entries: Dealing with the threats you face requires the right combination of protection and movement. You have training with Light armor.

entries.name: Light Armor Expertise
entries: If you take this trait twice, your AC increases by 1 while wearing Light armor.

optionalfeature.name: Lucky
entries: The luck you carry will see you through the worst Etharis has to offer. When you roll a 1 on a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can reroll that die but must use the new roll. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Master of Fortune
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the reroll made with Lucky.

optionalfeature.name: Magical Fortification
entries: The more that magic threatens you, the more your resilience to it increases. Choose an ability score: Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws using that ability score against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Extended Fortification
entries: If you take this trait multiple times, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws using a new ability score each time.

Additionally, if you fail a saving throw against a spell or other magical effect and you do not have proficiency with that saving throw, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to reroll the save. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Magical Insight
entries: Magic is power in the right hands, and those hands are yours. You have proficiency in the {@skill Arcana|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Magical Historian
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@skill Arcana|XPHB} checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Magical Savvy
entries: Whether through intensive study or the innate touch of magic in your blood, you have the ability to invoke magical spells. You learn one cantrip of your choice from any spell list, which you cast using the associated ability score: Intelligence for Wizard spells, Wisdom for Cleric and Druid spells, and Charisma for Bard, Sorcerer, and Warlock spells. If the spell appears on multiple spell lists, choose one to determine the spellcasting attribute for that spell.

entries.name: Magical Savant
entries: If you take this trait multiple times, you select a different cantrip each time, or you can select a level 1 spell from the same list as a cantrip you have previously chosen. If you select a level 1 spell, you can cast it once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. If you have levels in the associated spellcasting class, you always have this spell prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day.

optionalfeature.name: Masterful Aptitude
entries: Your discipline and focus give you an edge that others lack. Choose one of your skill or tool proficiencies. You have {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} on ability checks made using the chosen proficiency.

entries.name: Focused Mastery
entries: If you take this trait multiple times, you gain its benefit for a new skill proficiency or tool proficiency each time.

Additionally, when you make a check using a skill or tool for which you've taken Masterful Aptitude, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the check. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Master of Distraction
entries: You draw your foes' attention to you, intending it to be the last diversion they ever see. As an {@action Influence|XPHB} action, you put on a tactical display (bravado, cowardice, confusion, or some other tactic) that gets your enemies' attention. Until the end of your next turn, any attack on an enemy within 10 feet of you that could see you when you took the {@action Influence|XPHB} action, is made with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Hindering Distraction
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you use Master of Distraction, one affected enemy of your choice also has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls it makes against any of your allies until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Meditative Rest
entries: Sleep is a luxury you've never needed to afford. When you rest, you meditate deeply for 4 hours, dreaming but remaining conscious. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that other humanoids do from 8 hours of sleep.

entries.name: Restorative Rest
entries: If you take this trait twice, you need to spend only 2 hours in your meditation to gain the benefit of 8 hours of sleep, and you gain a {@dice d6} at the end of each {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. Before the end of your next {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can roll the {@dice d6} and add it to any {@dice d20} Test you make. You can decide to roll the {@dice d6} after the {@dice d20} Test is made, but you must do so before the outcome of the roll is known.

optionalfeature.name: Medium Armor Training
entries: The pounding you routinely take in combat requires a formidable layer of defense. You have training with Medium armor and with Shields.

entries.name: Heavy Armor Training
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have training with Heavy armor.

optionalfeature.name: Menacing Roar
entries: Your battle cry can cause even the most formidable foes to quail before you. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you emit a roar, shout, or other loud vocal outburst. Each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} + your Constitution modifier) or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condtion until the end of your next turn. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Incomparable Roar
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you use Menacing Roar, one target of your choice has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Mighty Shove
entries: Your powerful blows send your targets reeling. When you hit a creature no more than one size larger than you with a melee attack, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to attempt to shove that creature. The target must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your Strength modifier + your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or be pushed up to 10 feet away from you.

entries.name: Overwhelming Shove
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you use Mighty Shove, the target creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Mindful Investigator
entries: Putting together the pieces of even the darkest mysteries is second nature to you. You have proficiency in the {@skill Investigation|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Thorough Sleuth
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@skill Investigation|XPHB} checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Moved by Faith
entries: The grimmest myths and legends of the past hold the keys to shaping the future. You have proficiency in the {@skill Religion|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Force of Faith
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@skill Religion|XPHB} checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Attack
entries: The gift of natural weaponry means you are never unarmed, as your foes learn to their peril. Your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} deal damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier. The type of damage dealt by your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} can be Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing, based on the type of natural weaponry you possess (claws, horns, a tail, and so forth).

entries.name: Swift Strike
entries: If you take this trait twice, you can use {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Camouflage
entries: Your ability to fade into the background of familiar territory helps keep you safe from threats. Choose an environment:  arctic, coastal, desert, forest, grassland, hill and mountain, swamp, subterranean, or underwater. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Stealth checks made with the {@action Hide|XPHB} action while in that environment.

entries.name: Shared Camouflage
entries: If you take this trait multiple times, you gain its benefits for a new environment each time.

Additionally, when you take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action, you can forgo making a {@skill Stealth|XPHB} check while in any environment chosen with Natural Camouflage, instead treating the check as if you had rolled a 15. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Movement
entries: The time you've spent in the natural world lets you travel at speed, and hinders the abilities of those who would hunt you. Choose an environment:  arctic, coastal, desert, forest, grassland, hill and mountain, swamp, subterranean, or underwater. While in that environment, moving through nonmagical {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} costs you no extra movement, and ability checks made to track you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

entries.name: Shared Movement
entries: If you take this trait multiple times, you gain its benefits for a new environment each time. Additionally, while in any environment chosen for Natural Movement, as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can grant creatures of your choice the benefit of Natural Movement for 1 hour, as long as those creatures remain within 120 feet of you and can see you.

optionalfeature.name: Nature's Voice
entries: Mastering the subtle expression of fauna and flora grants you an edge in dealing with the threats of the wilderness. Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with Beasts and Plant creatures, understanding if a creature is hungry, for example. This gives you no specific ability to control such creatures, and you can't understand or learn detailed information from them.

entries.name: Primal Voice
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks made as part of an {@action Influence|XPHB} action to interact with a Beast or Plant creature.

optionalfeature.name: Nimble Moves
entries: You have learned the value of being able to manipulate the world around you without attracting the notice of others. You have proficiency in the {@skill Sleight of Hand|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Exquisite Legerdemain
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@skill Sleight of Hand|XPHB} checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Out of Phase
entries: Your corporeal presence shifts and fades, softening your enemies' ability to harm you. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, for 1 minute, all creatures have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against you, and you can move through other creature's spaces without treating them as {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Phase Shift
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you use Out of Phase, you can extend its benefit to any ally within 10 feet of you.

optionalfeature.name: Pack Hunter
entries: Fighting in the thick of battle lets you aid your allies when it counts. When an ally within 10 feet of you is about to make an attack roll or a saving throw, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to grant that ally {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the attack or save. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Pack Leader
entries: If you take this trait twice, Pack Hunter can be triggered by any ally within 30 feet of you. Additionally, if the attack roll misses or the saving throw fails, you don't lose that usage of Pack Hunter.

optionalfeature.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Staying close to your allies in combat makes you even more dangerous. When you start your turn with at least one ally who isn't {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} within 5 feet of another creature you can see, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against that creature until the end of your turn.

entries.name: Pack Instinct
entries: If you take this trait twice, gaining {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} from Pack Tactics requires no action.

optionalfeature.name: Pass Through
entries: Making use of constant movement lets you minimize the threat of larger foes. You can move through the space of any creature at least on size larger than you.

entries.name: Nimble Passage
entries: If you take this trait twice, you do not treat another creature's space as {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Personal Bastion
entries: Focusing all your resolve, you stand fast and watch your enemies flail against your defenses. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you become motionless and gain the following effects:

items: You have a +4 bonus to AC.
You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity saving throws.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength and Constitution saving throws.
Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 and you can't benefit from any bonus to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries: You can't take actions, and you can't use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} except to end the effect of this trait.

entries.name: Mobile Bastion
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you use Personal Bastion, your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced to half your normal {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} (rounded down), you do not have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity saving throws, and you can use {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB|Bonus Actions}.

optionalfeature.name: Persuasive Knack
entries: You have learned that the best way to deal with certain threats is to keep those threats from escalating. You have proficiency in the {@skill Persuasion|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Tongue of Gold
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@skill Persuasion|XPHB} checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Poison Resilience
entries: Your exceptional fortitude lets you shrug off the effects of even the worst toxins. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against being {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}.

entries.name: Poison Indemnity
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you fail a saving throw against being {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to succeed on the save instead. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Polyglot
entries: The advantages of mastering the languages of enemies and allies alike are clear to you. You learn two languages of your choice.

entries.name: Language Expert
entries: If you take this trait multiple times, you learn two new languages each time.

Additionally, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@action Influence|XPHB} action ability checks made to interact with another creature using any language you selected with Polyglot. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Power Nap
entries: When you don't know how long it might be before your next full respite, you learn to take maximum advantage of any rest you can get. When taking a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can choose to sleep for 1 hour. If you do so, you reduce your {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} by one level and regain a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} in addition to the other benefits of a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Extreme Resilience
entries: If you take this trait twice, when using Power Nap, you can choose to regain a single resource that would normally refresh on a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. For example, a Sorcerer could choose to regain a Sorcery Point on a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Powerful Build
entries: Whether carrying well-earned loot or the body of a fallen companion, you shoulder that load with ease. You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift. A Small creature with this trait can use any weapon with {@itemProperty H|XPHB|Heavy} as long as they have proficiency with that weapon. (This is an Exploration trait.)

entries.name: Powerful Shove
entries: If you take this trait twice, you can move or knock foes {@condition prone} with ease. When you use {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} to shove a creature 5 feet or give it the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the saving throw. (This is a Combat trait.)

optionalfeature.name: Psychic Spirit
entries: Your strength of mind shields you from unnatural forces. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage.

entries.name: Spirit's Strength
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you fail a saving throw against an effect that deals Psychic damage, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to succeed on the save instead. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Initiative
entries: Danger is never far away from you, and you are always ready for it. You add your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls.

entries.name: Focused Initiative
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can treat a roll of 9 or lower as if you rolled a 10.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Slip
entries: Even in the thick of battle, anything that obscures your enemies' view of you gives you a chance to strike unseen. You can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on each of your turns. You must have appropriate cover to attempt to hide, as normal.

entries.name: Astute Slip
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the Stealth checks you make with the {@action Hide|XPHB} action when you use Quick Slip.

optionalfeature.name: Reach Attack
entries: As you hurl yourself into battle, your foes discover that trying to keep away from you won't save them. Your reach increases by 5 feet. This extra reach doesn't apply to {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

entries.name: Opportune Reach
entries: If you take this trait twice, your extra reach from Reach Attack applies to {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

optionalfeature.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: The battles you need yet to fight are many, and death is not an option. When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Unparalleled Endurance
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you use Relentless Endurance, you drop to {@dice 1d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} + your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. Additionally, when you use Relentless Endurance, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to spend up to five {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice}, rolling them and gaining that number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Resilient Ears
entries: Even as destruction rains down around you, your hearing stays sharp. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against having the {@condition Deafened|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Determined Hearing
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@skill Perception|XPHB} checks involving hearing. Additionally, when you fail a saving throw against being {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to succeed on the save instead. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Ruthless Response
entries: A creature that gets the drop on you is met with a swift and brutal reply. When you take damage from a creature within your reach, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make a melee attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} against that creature. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Focused Ruthlessness
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls made using Ruthless Response.

optionalfeature.name: Shroud of the Wild
entries: With any degree of obscuration, your instinctive ability to conceal yourself lets you avoid your enemies' notice. You can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action even when you are only {@variantrule Lightly Obscured|XPHB} by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Faultless Shroud
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@skill Stealth|XPHB} checks using the {@action Hide|XPHB} action while using Shroud of the Wild.

optionalfeature.name: Skill Prowess
entries: Your ingenuity and inventiveness help keep you alive in a dangerous world. Before you make an ability check using a skill you are proficient with, you can add your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} again. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Skill Mastery
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you fail an ability check made using the {@variantrule Skill|XPHB} Prowess trait, you can reroll the check and must use the new roll.

optionalfeature.name: Skirmish Tactics
entries: Your brutal strike leaves your foe reeling as you slip away. When you hit a hostile creature with an attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} against you by that creature have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} until the end of your turn.

entries.name: Supreme Skirmisher
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you hit a hostile creature with an attack with a weapon attack or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} until the end of your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Slippery
entries: Any enemy that tries to grab you is in for a surprise. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@skill Athletics|XPHB} and {@skill Acrobatics|XPHB} checks to escape a grapple.

entries.name: Supreme Slip
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you fail an {@skill Athletics|XPHB} or {@skill Acrobatics|XPHB} check to escape a grapple, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to succeed instead. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Stalwart Reserves
entries: Each time you lay into a foe, their state of peril lends you vigor. When you hit a creature with a melee attack, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to roll a number of d4s equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the total rolled. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Stalwart Edge
entries: If you take this trait twice, you can take the maximum number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} rather than rolling.

optionalfeature.name: Standing Leap
entries: Threats on the ground are of little concern as you leap over them with ease. You can make a {@variantrule Long Jump|XPHB} of up to 20 feet and a {@variantrule High Jump|XPHB} of up to 10 feet, with or without a running start. If your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is less than the distance you can {@variantrule Long Jump|XPHB}, you can leap only a distance equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Incredible Leap
entries: If you take this trait twice, you can make a {@variantrule Long Jump|XPHB} of up to 30 feet and a {@variantrule High Jump|XPHB} of up to 15 feet, as limited by your speed.

Additionally, when you jump out of another creature's reach, the movement of the jump does not provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} from that creature. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Steady
entries: No matter what kind of upheaval surrounds you, you stand your ground. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against having the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Stand Fast
entries: If you take this trait twice, standing from {@condition Prone|XPHB} takes only five feet of movement instead of half your movement.

Additionally, when you fail a saving throw against being knocked {@condition Prone|XPHB}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to succeed on the save instead. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Supple Squeeze
entries: With an effort of will, you contort your body into the tightest spaces. You can squeeze through a space that is large enough for a creature two sizes smaller than you, rather than one size smaller.

entries.name: Full-Speed Squeeze
entries: If you take this trait twice, squeezing does not cost you additional movement, and you do not have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws while squeezing.

optionalfeature.name: Swimmer
entries: You are in your element while in the water, moving with grace and ease. You have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Quickened Swim
entries: If you take this trait twice, you can use the {@action Dash|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} while swimming.

optionalfeature.name: Tenacious
entries: Your enemies might put you down, but you are never down for long. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws}.

entries.name: Hard to Kill
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} but don't die outright, you remain conscious. You must make {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws} as normal while at 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, and you suffer a {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB} failure each time you take any damage, but you can otherwise act freely. You can't become {@variantrule Stable|XPHB} while you remain at 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Timely Boon
entries: Fortune favors you at times when a threat might send you down. When you fail a saving throw, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to roll a {@dice d4} and add it to the save, potentially turning it into a success. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Born Lucky
entries: If you take this trait twice, you roll a {@dice d8} instead of a {@dice d4} when you use Timely Boon.

optionalfeature.name: Tireless
entries: An innate resilience lets you shake off conditions that would take others down. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws connected to gaining or removing {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels.

entries.name: Vigorous
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you fail a saving throw against {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to succeed on the save instead. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Touch of Life
entries: Effects that corrupt the essence of other living creatures are of little concern to you. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Strength of Life
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you fail a saving throw against an effect that deals Necrotic damage, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to succeed on the save instead. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Toughness
entries: An intrinsic hardiness marks you as one born for battle. Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 each time you gain a level.

entries.name: Extra Tough
entries: If you take this trait twice, your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by 2 instead of 1, and it increases by 2 each time you gain a level.

Additionally, when you make a saving throw against an effect that would decrease your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the save. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Unchecked
entries: Your ability to stay in motion is second to none, and foes try in vain to pin you down. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against being {@condition Restrained|XPHB}.

entries.name: Slip Free
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you fail a saving throw against being {@condition Restrained|XPHB}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to succeed on the save instead. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Unnatural Healer
entries: Your innate healing abilities let you recover from some of the grimmest wounds. During a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can automatically reverse Grievous Wounds. Additionally, you can reattach any severed body parts (fingers, legs, tails, and so on), which are automatically restored at the end of the {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. If your severed body parts aren't available, you can replace them with the same body parts of another creature of the same general anatomy as you. If you wish to intentionally swap out body parts with replacements, you can sever your own body parts with no pain or discomfort.

The ability to make use of unusual body parts (for example, giving yourself the taloned paw of a lion if you lose a hand) are left to the GM's discretion. In any event, swapping a severed body part for an unusual body part grants you no mechanical Advantages not covered by other traits (see "Features and Traits" on page 11).

entries.name: Regenerative Healer
entries: If you take this trait twice, you automatically reverse Permanent Wounds during a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. Additionally, you can restore any severed body part during a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, as if subject to the {@spell Regenerate|XPHB} spell. You can use this trait to create unusual regenerated body parts at the GM's determination.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Aptitude
entries: The weapons you wield might save your life one day, and you know their secrets. You have proficiency with three weapons of your choice.

entries.name: Weapon Specialist
entries: If you take this trait multiple times, you gain proficiency with three new weapons each time. Additionally, choose one weapon with which you have proficiency. You have a +1 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Well Protected
entries: Your ability to roll with even the worst attacks means that armor would only slow you down. When you are not wearing armor, your AC is equal to 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Protective Cover
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you make a Dexterity saving throw or are targeted by a ranged attack, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the saving throw or impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the ranged attack roll. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Befuddled
entries: {@b Cost:} 2 Jinx Points
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, choose a creature that you can see within 60 feet of yourself that is cursed by your Evil Eye and spend 2 Jinx Points. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for 10 minutes or until you or your allies damage it. When the effect ends, the target knows it was {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by you.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Clumsy
entries: {@b Cost:} 3 Jinx Points

When a creature cursed by your Evil Eye moves at least 5 feet on its turn, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and spend 3 Jinx Points to cause the creature to have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition and have its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} reduced to 0 until the end of its turn.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Debilitated
entries: {@b Cost:} 1 Jinx Point
When a creature cursed by your Evil Eye takes damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and spend 1 Jinx Point to roll {@dice 1d12}. The creature takes Necrotic damage equal to the roll.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Doomed
entries: {@b Cost:} 1 Jinx Point
When you miss with an attack roll against a creature cursed by your Evil Eye, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and spend 1 Jinx Point to reroll the attack. You must use the new roll.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Fearful
entries: {@b Cost:} 2 Jinx Points
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, choose a creature that you can see within 60 feet of yourself that is cursed by your Evil Eye and spend 2 Jinx Points. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} target repeats the save, ending the Misfortune on itself on a success.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Inept
entries: {@b Cost:} 1 Jinx Point

After a creature you can see that is cursed by your Evil Eye makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and spend 1 Jinx Point to make the target reroll, and it must use the new roll.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Insensate
entries: {@b Cost:} 3 Jinx Points
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, choose a creature that you can see that is cursed by your Evil Eye and spend 3 Jinx Points. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Deafened|XPHB} conditions for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the Misfortune on itself on a success.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Maimed
entries: {@b Cost:} 2 Jinx Points

When you hit a creature cursed by your Evil Eye with an attack roll using a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} and roll a 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and spend 2 Jinx Points to score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Marked
entries: {@b Cost:} 2 Jinx Points

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can spend 2 Jinx Points to increase the duration of your Evil Eye to 1 hour or until you mark a different creature with your Evil Eye, whichever comes first.
Additionally, while a creature is affected by this curse, you always know the direction and distance to the creature while the two of you are on the same plane of existence.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Plagued
entries: {@b Cost:} 1 Jinx Point

When a creature you can see that is cursed by your Evil Eye would regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and spend 1 Jinx Point to halve the number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} regained. Afterward, the creature can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} until the start of your next turn.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Somnolent
entries: {@b Cost:} 3 Jinx Points
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, choose a creature you can see that is cursed by your Evil Eye and spend 3 Jinx Points. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. The condition ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the Misfortune's effect.
Creatures that don't sleep, such as elves, or that have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} condition automatically succeed on saves against this Misfortune.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Unlucky
entries: {@b Cost:} 3 Jinx Points

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can spend 3 Jinx Points to put a pox on a creature cursed by your Evil Eye. Whenever the creature is about to make an attack roll or saving throw, you can roll {@dice 1d4} and subtract the number rolled from the total.
This Misfortune ends when the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Barbarian
entries: You've learned to fight with primal ferocity.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} while you aren't wearing Heavy armor, you can enter a rampage for 1 minute. During this time, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage, and you can't maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}. Your rampage ends early if you use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} or have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.
Once you use this talent, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Cleric
entries: You've gained the ability to channel divine energy directly from the gods, emboldening allies and sanctifying their attacks. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose a creature within 30 feet of you. For 10 minutes, the target gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your Bard level plus your Charisma modifier. While a creature has {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} granted by this talent, it can choose to lose all remaining {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} when it hits a creature with an attack made with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, dealing extra Radiant damage equal to the number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} lost.
Once you use this talent, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Druid
entries: You can cast the {@spell Polymorph|XPHB} spell without expending a spell slot.
