entries: Your transformation to an Elemental creature has changed your body entirely. You no longer need to sleep, breathe, or eat. Also, you no longer age normally and suffer no effects of aging.

Additionally, choose one damage type from Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, and Lightning damage. You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to that damage type. If you already have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}, you gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to it.

optionalfeature.name: Master of Many
entries: You add a third elemental to your {@optfeature Elemental Affinity|GrimHollowPG24|Elemental Affinity Boon}. When you do so, you gain the associated benefits of your new element.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Imbalance
entries: Your body reacts in strange ways to the application of severe elemental damage. When you take Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage, roll {@dice 1d6}. On a 1, your Primordial form reacts in a volatile manner, and the following effects occur:

items: You gain {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to the instance of damage you just took, even if you had {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to that damage.
Creatures within 5 feet of you take the original amount of damage that you took. A DC 15 Constitution saving throw halves this damage.

optionalfeature.name: Primordial Aura
entries: Creatures of your choice within 15 feet of you gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage. You choose the damage type after finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, and you can change the damage type as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. If they already have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to any of these damage types, they gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to that damage type.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Mastery
entries: You add the final element to you Elemental Affinity Boon. When you do so, you gain the associated benefits of your new element.

Additionally, you can summon the four elements to wreathe you in power. Whenever a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to force it to make a Dexterity saving throw, dealing {@damage 6d6} damage of a type of your choice from Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, or Lightning, or half as much on a successful save.
After you use this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, your Elemental Affinity features gain the following benefits until the end of your next turn

entries.name: Air
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on all Ranged weapon and ranged spell attacks.

entries.name: Earth
entries: At the beginning of your turn, you gain 20 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Fire
entries: At the beginning of your turn, each creature of your choice within 5 feet of you takes {@damage 2d6} Fire damage.

entries.name: Water
entries: Whenever a creature withing 60 feet that you can see regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by spending {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or through a spell or magical ability, that creature regains an additional 20 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, regaining all uses upon completing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Primordial Chaos
entries: The plane of Primordial energy that you're tied to strengthens its pull on you. Whenever you roll a natural 1 on a saving throw against a spell, you take {@damage 8d6} Force damage, which ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistances} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immunities}. This damage is in addition to any normal damage from the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Fanged Bite
entries: As an {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can make a Bite attack. You are considered proficient with this attack, and you can use Strength or Dexterity as the ability. This attack deals Piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier. This Bite attack is not a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

If the attack hits a creature that has blood, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take an additional {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage. You regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage dealt this way. The DC is 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage.

optionalfeature.name: Soman Bloodline
entries: Your vampirism follows the Soman bloodline, the most prevalent in Etharis. You gain the following features:

items: Your Strength and Dexterity scores increase by 1. Neither score can exceed 19 with this feature.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls with {@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24}.
The Necrotic damage dealt by {@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24} increases to {@dice 1d8}.
You gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Fzeg Bloodline
entries: Your vampirism follows the Fzeg bloodline, a line of vampires that combines the affliction with lycanthropy. You gain the following features:

items: Your Strength score increases by 2. Your Strength score cannot exceed 20 with this feature.

You gain a Claw attack. This attack deals {@dice 1d8} plus your Strength modifier Slashing damage, using your Strength modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} on attack rolls. This Claw attack is not a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.
When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action to make the Claw attack, you may use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make a Bite attack from {@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24}.

optionalfeature.name: Strigoi Bloodline
entries: Your vampirism follows the Strigoi bloodline. Your speed and guile almost match your ferocity. You gain the following features:

items: Your Dexterity score increases by 2. Your Dexterity score cannot exceed 20 with this feature.
If you make your {@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24} attack with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}, the Piercing damage increases to {@dice 2d4} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier.
You can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, and you can use the {@action Hide|XPHB} action anywhere that is not in sunlight.
You have proficiency with the {@skill Stealth|XPHB} skill. If you are already proficient in {@skill Stealth|XPHB}, you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in Stealth instead.

optionalfeature.name: The Sanguine Curse
entries: The Sanguine Curse has taken hold of you. As a result, you gain the following features:

items: You cannot enter a private residence that you do not own without one of the occupants inviting you. Once invited, you can enter without penalty as long as the inviter resides there. If you do enter uninvited, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on all {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} while in the residence. Additionally, you take {@damage 1d4} Psychic damage at the start of each of your turns. You cannot be {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistant} or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to Psychic damage while inside such a residence uninvited.
You must feed at least once within seven days of your last feeding. See the Feeding sidebar for more information.

entries.name: Feeding
entries: As a Vampire transforms further and further from its mortal form, its metabolic requirements change. The first change is a need for mortal blood. This need is approximately 1 pint of blood from a Humanoid, Beast, or other creature with mortal blood.

As an action, you can bite a living creature within 5 feet that is {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by you, or that has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, {@condition Restrained|XPHB}, or {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition. You drain the target of one pint of blood (or similar life-giving substance), leaving a visible bite mark on that creature. The bitten creature gains one {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level.

A Vampire that does not feed within the required time enters a rabid feeding frenzy under the GM's control. They attack the nearest creature they could feed from. A Vampire remains in this state until they have drained a creature completely (killing them), at which point the Vampire falls {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} for 4 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of the Night
entries: You gain {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} out to 60 feet. If you already have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB}, the range increases by 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Grave-Touched Soul
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage. If you already have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage, you gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} instead.

optionalfeature.name: Inhuman Reflexes
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Undead Resilience
entries: You become supernaturally tough to kill. When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by any type of damage except Radiant, you can choose to be reduced to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Sanguine Curse
entries: Your curse has taken a stronger hold onto you. You gain the following features:

items: You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on all {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} when you are in sunlight.

optionalfeature.name: Beguiler's Charm
entries: You gain the ability to manipulate the mind of a creature with your unearthly charm. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can choose a Humanoid or Beast within 30 feet of you that can see you. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw with a DC of 8 plus your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for 24 hours. At the end of the 24 hours, you can choose to automatically renew the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition on that creature with no saving throw. You may only have one creature {@condition Charmed|XPHB} in this manner at a time. If you use this feature on another creature, or you or an ally damages the creature, the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition ends on the previous creature immediately.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Fanged Bite
entries: As an {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can make 2 {@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24} attacks. Additionally, you can make a {@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24} attack as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} if you don't make a {@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24} attack as part of an {@action Attack|XPHB} action on the same turn.

optionalfeature.name: Mist Form
entries: You can cast the {@spell Gaseous Form|XPHB} spell a number of times equal to your Vampire Transformation Stage without using a spell slot or needing to use Verbal, Somatic, or Material components. You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

You can cast this spell as an {@variantrule Action|XPHB} on your turn, or as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you would take Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage. You cast the spell before taking the damage.

optionalfeature.name: Sangromancy Specialist

prerequisite.other: Stage 3 of the {@charoption Vampire|GrimHollowPG24|Vampire Transformation}, Spellcaster who can cast cantrips

entries: Your magic is tinged with the blood that you crave. You gain the following features:

items: You gain an extra {@dice 1d12} Sangromancy {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} per Vampire Transformation. You can use those dice on Sangromancy spells. You regain all spent Sangromancy Dice when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
When you successfully restore {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} using {@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24}, you regain one spent Sangromancy Die.

Any cantrip you cast that does Necrotic damage can be enhanced by your Sangromancy Dice. You can spend up to 2 {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} (including your Sangromancy Dice) to deal extra Necrotic damage with those cantrips. You can decide to spend these {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} after you know if the cantrip affects the target(s).

optionalfeature.name: Supreme Sanguine Curse
entries: Your curse continues to transform you, bringing about further debilitations. You gain the following features:

items: If you start your turn in sunlight, you take {@damage 1d10} Radiant damage. You cannot have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} or {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to this Radiant Damage.

Your appearance begins to resemble that of a true vampire. In stressful conditions, as determined by you or the GM, your appearance changes outside of your control. When you do, anyone observing you knows your true nature.

entries: You can hide your true appearance and disguise yourself as the humanoid you once were by {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on your composure. However, moments of bloodlust or stress are likely to reveal your true nature, including the following situations:

In these events, or times of other extreme emotional or physical stress, a GM can call or a Constitution saving throw with a DC based on your current Transformation Stage.  If you fail this save, your Sanguine Curse is revealed.
Non-evil creatures that witness your true form become instantly {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} to you, unless the GM decides otherwise.

optionalfeature.name: Final Soman Bloodline
entries: You reach the full manifestation of your Soman Bloodline. You gain the following features:

items: Your Strength and Dexterity scores increase by 1 to a maximum of 20.
{@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24|Fanged Bite's} Necrotic damage increases to {@dice 3d8}.

When a Humanoid creature is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by your {@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24} attack or through your feeding, it rises as a {@creature Vampire Spawn|XMM} 24 hours later unless the body is destroyed or undergoes rituals to prevent its rising. You can have two {@creature Vampire Spawn|XMM|Vampire Spawns} created this way under your control, and they follow your verbal commands to the best of their abilities. If you take control of a third {@creature Vampire Spawn|XMM}, you choose one of the other {@creature Vampire Spawn|XMM} you currently control to no longer follow your commands.

optionalfeature.name: Final Fzeg Bloodline
entries: You reach the full manifestation of your Fzeg Bloodline. You have the following features:

items: Your Strength score increases by 2 points to a maximum of 20.

The damage done by your Claw attack becomes {@dice 3d6} plus your Strength modifier Slashing damage, using your Strength modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} on attack rolls. You can also make three Claw attacks with an {@action Attack|XPHB} action.
You are {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistant} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage. Magic and silvered weapons ignore this {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Final Strigoi Bloodline
entries: You reach the full manifestation of your Strigoi Bloodline. You have the following features:

items: Your Dexterity score increases by 2 points to a maximum of 20.

You can summon {@dice 2d4} {@creature Swarms of Rats|XMM}, {@creature Swarms of Bats|XMM}, or {@creature Wolf|XMM|Wolves} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. They appear at the start of your next turn within 60 feet of you. They follow your verbal or mental commands. They disperse after 1 hour, when you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, or when you dismiss them with a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. You regain this ability after finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

You can cast the {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} spell up to four times without using a spell slot. You can also cast a spell in this way as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you are targeted with a weapon attack. You cast the spell before taking damage. You regain this ability after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampiric blood that flows in your veins gives you regenerative powers. You regain 15 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of your turn if you have at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} but less than 60 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. This feature has no effect if you are in sunlight or have taken Radiant damage since the end of your last turn.

optionalfeature.name: Ultimate Sanguine Curse
entries: Your transformation into a creature of the night is complete. And with that transformation comes susceptibilities. You gain the following features:

items: One strike may end your existence forever. When you are {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, {@condition Stunned|XPHB}, or {@condition Unconscious|XPHB}, and you are struck by a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} with a Piercing Weapon made of wood or silver, you must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you die and are reduced to ash. Only a {@spell True Resurrection|XPHB} or {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell can resurrect you.

optionalfeature.name: Celestial Form
entries: You become a Celestial in addition to any other creature type(s) you are. Additionally, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Radiant Damage.

optionalfeature.name: Angelic Wings
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can manifest feathered wings for 1 hour. While they are manifested, you have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} when you are not wearing heavy armor.
You can manifest these wings a number of times equal to your Transformation Stage, and you regain all uses after finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Holy Strikes
entries: When you hit with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} or damage a creature with a cantrip, you can add {@damage 1d6} Radiant damage to that attack. You can add this damage a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage. You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

At higher Transformation Stages, you deal an additional {@damage 1d6} Radiant damage per Transformation Stage, for a total of {@dice 2d6} at Stage 2, {@dice 3d6} at Stage 3, and {@dice 4d6} at Stage 4.

optionalfeature.name: Planar Binding (Seraph)
entries: Your body and soul are bound to the higher planes of good. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws} as the plane attempts to pull your soul into its place of final reward.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Clemency
entries: When an ally within 30 feet of you that you can see takes damage, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cast {@spell Healing Word|XPHB} at first level on that ally without using a spell slot.
You can do this a number of times equal to your Transformation Stage. You regain all uses of this feature after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Sacred Retribution
entries: When an ally you can see within 30 feet takes the {@action Attack|XPHB} action with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to imbue them with holy zeal, allowing them to make one additional attack. On a hit, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d8} Radiant damage. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Transformation Stage. You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Blinding Radiance
entries: Your Transformation into a Seraph brings with it changes to your physical features. Your body radiates a divine glow, your eyes may become hollow braziers of celestial light, or your many sets of wings may appear unsettling to mortal creatures.

You can suspend this form and manifest the appearance of the humanoid you once were, but this is taxing and requires effort. This form is not permanent, and moments of stress or wrath are likely to reveal your true nature. This might occur under the following circumstances:

items: Using your Seraph Transformation powers for the first time after a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}

entries: In these events, or times of other extreme emotional or physical stress, a GM can call  or a Constitution saving throw with a DC based on your current Transformation Stage.  If you fail this save, your Blinding Radiance is revealed.

When your true nature is revealed this way, all non-enemy creatures within 30 feet of you who can see you must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or have the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. Additionally, for the next minute, attacks against you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Cleanse Affliction
entries: When you use Divine Clemency on a creature, they gain the following additional benefits:

items: They gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the amount of damage healed by {@variantrule Healing|XPHB} Word.
They have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on their next {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} made within the next minute.
You end one of the following conditions on it: {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, or {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Protective Wings
entries: While you are manifesting your Angelic Wings, you gain the following benefits:

items: As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, when you or an ally within 5 feet of you is targeted by a weapon attack, you can impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on that attack. If the attack hits the ally, you take half the attack's damage (rounded up) and the original target takes the other half.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws or ability checks to avoid having the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition or to escape a Grapple.
Your {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} is increased by 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Bow of Celestial Judgement
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to manifest a powerful bow made of divine light. The Bow of Celestial Judgement lasts for 1 minute and grants you the following abilities while manifested:

items: You can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to target a creature you can see within 120 feet with your bow. The creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 6d6} Radiant damage, or {@dice 10d6} if it is a Fey, Fiend, or Undead. On a success, the creature takes half damage.
You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.
You gain 5 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of your turns.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Transformation Stage, and you regain all uses after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Beacon to Darkness
entries: You are now a Seraph of noted virtue and divinity, becoming a target for the world's evil. Whenever you or an ally within 30 feet commits an evil act, such as murdering innocents, you acquire a trace of darkness and you are Corrupted. GMs determine what constitutes an evil act.

While you are Corrupted, whenever you make an attack roll against an evil creature or a saving throw against a spell or effect from an evil creature, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the check. Also, if an ally is the one who caused your Corruption, they cannot be considered your ally or you theirs until the Corruption is removed.

You can remove the Corrupted condition by finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, during which you must pray for at least 1 hour and burn holy incense or donate wealth to a local good cause worth at least 100 GP times your Transformation Stage.

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Holy Purge
entries: You emit an aura of righteous fervor in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} centered on you, except when you have the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition. When an ally within your aura hits with a weapon attack, the ally can use their {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cause the hit to be a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}. If they do, you and the ally each gain a level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}. After an ally uses this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, that ally can't use it again until after they finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Righteous Mercy
entries: You emit an aura of peaceful resolution in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} centered on you, except when you have the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition. When an ally within your aura would be reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, they can use their {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead. If they do, you and the ally each gain a level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}. After an ally uses this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, that ally can't use it again until after they finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Bow of Celestial Domination
entries: While your Bow of Celestial Judgement is manifested, you gain these additional benefits:

items: When you use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to target a creature you can see within 120 feet, you can also affect one other creature with 10 feet of the original target.
You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Necrotic damage instead of {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}.
You gain 15 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of your turns instead of 5.

optionalfeature.name: Seraph Corruption
entries: The weight of evil in the world encumbers you more and more heavily as the days pass. Sometimes it becomes too much, and your celestial form is wracked with pain and doubt.
Whenever you roll a natural 1 on a saving throw, you suffer the following effects for 1 minute:

items: At the start of each of your turns, you take {@damage 1d10} Psychic damage. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.
You cannot regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or have {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.
You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the first attack you make every round.
Once per round, the first creature you force to make a saving throw against your spell has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowsteel Curser

prerequisite.other: Stage 1 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: If you do not already have it, you gain the {@feat Shadowsteel Adept|GrimHollowPG24} feat.
Additionally, when you cast a Shadowsteel curse, the casting time is reduced by half, and the saving throw DC increases by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowsteel Weapon

prerequisite.other: Stage 1 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: During a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you focus upon a Melee weapon within your reach, imbuing it with a fragment of your Shadowsteel corruption. This Shadowsteel weapon is considered magical.
When you reduce a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} with a melee attack made with your Shadowsteel weapon, you gain {@dice 1d8} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} for 1 hour.
You can repeat the process described above to imbue a different weapon with Shadowsteel. This removes the effect from your existing Shadowsteel weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Debilitating Magic

prerequisite.other: Stage 1 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: Choose one ability score. You lose 2 points in that ability as the power of the Shadowsteel slowly eats away at your body, soul, or both.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Resistance

prerequisite.other: Stage 2 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowsteel Absorption

prerequisite.other: Stage 2 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: As the Shadowsteel courses through you, it begins to harden your flesh. Your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} increases by 1 when you aren't wearing armor.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowsteel Caster

prerequisite.other: Stage 2 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: If you do not already have it, you gain the {@feat Shadowsteel Master|GrimHollowPG24} feat.

Additionally, when you use a Shadowsteel component to cast a spell using a spell slot, you can spend a Hit Die to regain that spell slot. The spell slot level cannot be greater than twice your Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation Stage.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. You regain all uses of this feature after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowsteel Weapon Master

prerequisite.other: Stage 2 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: You gain a +4 bonus to damage rolls made with your {@optfeature Shadowsteel Weapon|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel weapon}.

optionalfeature.name: Friendless

prerequisite.other: Stage 2 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: You are no longer able to connect with other creatures on a social level. You prefer isolation and twisted contemplation to friendship and camaraderie.
You cannot be considered an ally to any Humanoids or Beasts, and no living creature can be {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} toward you.
You also have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on all Charisma ability checks.

optionalfeature.name: Cursed Claw

prerequisite.other: Stage 3 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: You gain a Claw attack. This attack uses either your Strength or Dexterity for attack and damage rolls.
You can use this attack twice as part of an {@action Attack|XPHB} action, or once as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. The Claw attack deals {@dice 2d6} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier.

Additionally, when the Claw attack hits, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be afflicted with a random Shadowsteel curse at Stage 1. The saving throw DC is 8 plus your Constitution modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. A creature already afflicted with a Shadowsteel curse cannot gain another Shadowsteel curse with this attack.

optionalfeature.name: Healing Resistance

prerequisite.other: Stage 3 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: You heal at a slower rate than normal, whether that healing is magical or natural. Whenever you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you regain half as many {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} as you should. You still recover all {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the end of a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowsteel Arcane Vessel

prerequisite.other: Stage 4 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: When you cast a spell using a spell slot, the power of your Shadowsteel infection emanates from you. One creature targeted by the spell within 60 feet of you has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the saving throw to resist the spell, or you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the spell attack roll.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all uses after you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowsteel Fury

prerequisite.other: Stage 4 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: When you use the {@action Attack|XPHB} action to attack with your {@optfeature Shadowsteel Weapon|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel weapon} or {@optfeature Cursed Claw|GrimHollowPG24}, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make an additional attack with the same weapon or Claw. This extra attack carries with it the power of the Shadowsteel infection.

When you hit with this attack, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or gain a 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level. The saving throw DC is 8 plus the ability modifier used in the attack plus your Transformation Stage.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowsteel Explosion

prerequisite.other: Stage 4 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: The Shadowsteel that suffuses your flesh responds to stress, and you can do nothing to control it. The first time you are {@condition Bloodied|XPHB} or reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} after you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you risk hurting everyone around you.

When these events occur, all living creatures within 60 feet of you must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, creatures in the area suffer {@damage 4d10} Force damage and have the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, a target takes half damage and is not {@condition Stunned|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Spectral Form
entries: You are considered to be Undead in addition to your existing creature type(s). You cannot be excluded from Turn Undead.

Additionally, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage. If you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage from another source, you have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} instead.
Finally, you stop aging. You are immune to any effect that would age you, and you cannot die from old age.

optionalfeature.name: Ghastly Touch
entries: You can deliver a soul-chilling jolt through your attacks. Once per turn, when you hit a target with a melee attack when you are within 5 feet of the target, you can deal an additional {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage. You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: You are able to loosen the binds that tie you to the material world to move through solid objects and creatures. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can make yourself incorporeal until the start of your next turn. While in this form, you gain the following benefits:

items: You can move through solid objects at your full {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}. You take {@damage 1d10} Force damage if you end your turn inside a solid object and are moved to the nearest open space.
You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage types except Force damage.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and regain all uses after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Drawn to Darkness
entries: Your body and soul are bound to the cold darkness of the realms of death. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws} as your life force is drawn to oblivion.

optionalfeature.name: Ethereal Phasing
entries: You can cast the {@spell Blink|XPHB} spell without expending a spell slot. You can cast the spell using this Boon a number of times equal to your Transformation Stage, and you regain all uses after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

While you are under the effects of Blink when cast in this way, you also gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage at the start of each of your turns.

optionalfeature.name: Haunting Flight
entries: You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

Also, while you are flying, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to focus your terrifying presence on one creature you can see within 30 feet. That creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. The DC for the Wisdom saving throw is 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage. Once you use this feature, you must finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Untethered from Life
entries: Your life force is weaker than other creatures. When you would regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you regain half as many {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} as normal (rounded down).

optionalfeature.name: Draining Flight

prerequisite.other: Stage 3 of the {@charoption Specter|GrimHollowPG24|Specter Transformation}, {@optfeature Incorporeal Movement|GrimHollowPG24} & {@optfeature Haunting Flight|GrimHollowPG24}

entries: You can now use your {@optfeature Incorporeal Movement|GrimHollowPG24} feature as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. Additionally, your {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} while using {@optfeature Haunting Flight|GrimHollowPG24} becomes double your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

Additionally, while you are using {@optfeature Incorporeal Movement|GrimHollowPG24}, your movement does not provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} and you can damage creatures that you move through. Once per turn, when you enter a space occupied by a creature, you can choose to force that creature to succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 6d6} Psychic damage and have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. A creature takes half damage on a successful save and is not {@condition Frightened|XPHB}. The DC of the Constitution saving throw is 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: Your Ghastly Touch feature takes on a spirit-freezing quality. The damage from your {@optfeature Ghastly Touch|GrimHollowPG24} increases to {@damage 2d6} Necrotic damage. Additionally, you can force any creature you damage with {@optfeature Ghastly Touch|GrimHollowPG24} to make a Constitution saving throw. The DC for this saving throw is 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage.

On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, they have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition instead. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Transformation Stage. You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Fraying Reality
entries: Your mind begins to slip into the dark places where the world of life and world of death intersect. When you become {@condition Bloodied|XPHB} for the first time after finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you must make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, you act as though under the effects of a {@spell Confusion|XPHB} spell for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Call of Unmaking
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can give a mournful wail or otherwise set up a wracking vibration. This sound has no effect on Constructs and Undead.

All other creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. The DC of the Constitution saving throw is 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage. Creatures that can't hear you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the saving throw.
On a failed save, the creature bears the Mark of Unmaking for 1 minute. While bearing this mark, a creature takes an additional {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage each time it takes damage.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Possession
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you enter the space of a Humanoid or Beast and force that creature to make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. If the target fails, you disappear, and the target is {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} and loses control of its body. You control the body without depriving the target of awareness.

While possessing a target, you can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect. You retain your alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and any {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to having the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions. Otherwise, you use the possessed target's statistics but don't gain access to the target's knowledge, spellcasting abilities or {@action Magic|XPHB} actions, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts for 1 hour, until the possessed target drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you end it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, or you are forced out by an effect that ends possession. When the possession ends, you reappear in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the possessed creature. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Pull of Oblivion
entries: Your connection to the material realm becomes gossamer thin. When you roll a natural 1 on a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you take {@damage 4d6} Force damage, and this damage cannot be mitigated. If this damage reduces you to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you die.
When you die in this way or any other, you can only be brought back to life through magic equivalent to level 7 or higher spells.

optionalfeature.name: Hybrid Wolf Form
entries: You become a Monstrosity in addition to any other creature type(s).
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you may voluntarily transform into a hybrid half-wolf creature. While in your hybrid wolf form, the following rules apply:

items: Your Strength score becomes 18 unless it is higher.
Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet, and you can use the {@action Dash|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.
You can't cast spells or concentrate on spells. Your ability to speak is reduced to short, basic, guttural responses.
While transformed, you can use weapons and equipment as normal, unless specified elsewhere.

You gain a Claw or Bite attack that you may use in place of any weapon attack. These attacks deal {@dice 1d8} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier Slashing damage. You are proficient with this attack, and you add either your Strength or Dexterity modifier to attack and damage rolls. This attack is not an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, nor can it be used in place of an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.
After taking an {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you may take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} later in that turn to attack once with either your Claw or Bite.

entries: Your hybrid wolf form lasts 1 hour per Transformation Stage. If you entered your hybrid form voluntarily, you can revert to your normal form by using a {@action Magic|XPHB} action on your turn. ({@filter Flaws listed below|optionalfeatures|source=grimhollowpg24|feature type=ly:tf|miscellaneous=} may override this rule.)

optionalfeature.name: Hybrid Bear Form
entries: You become a Monstrosity in addition to any other creature type(s).
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you may voluntarily transform into a hybrid half-bear creature. While in your hybrid bear form, the following rules apply:

items: Your Strength score becomes 20 unless it was higher.
You gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.
You can't cast spells or concentrate on spells. Your ability to speak is reduced to short, basic, guttural responses.
While transformed, you can use weapons and equipment as normal, unless specified elsewhere.

You gain a Claw attack that you may use in place of any weapon attack. This attack deals {@dice 1d8} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier Slashing damage. You are proficient with this attack, and you add either your Strength or Dexterity modifier to attack and damage rolls. This attack is not an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, nor can it be used in place of an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

Immediately after hitting a target with a Claw attack, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to grab the creature with that hand, as long as it is no more than one size category larger than you. The grabbed target has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition. The escape DC is 8 plus your Strength modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

entries: Your hybrid bear form lasts 1 hour per Transformation Stage. If you entered your hybrid form voluntarily, you can revert to your normal form by using a {@action Magic|XPHB} action on your turn. ({@filter Flaws listed below|optionalfeatures|source=grimhollowpg24|feature type=ly:tf|miscellaneous=} may override this rule.)

optionalfeature.name: Hybrid Rat Form
entries: You become a Monstrosity in addition to any other creature type(s).
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you may voluntarily transform into a hybrid half-rat creature. While in your hybrid rat form, the following rules apply:

items: Your Dexterity score becomes 18 unless it was higher.
You can {@action Hide|XPHB} or {@action Disengage|XPHB} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.
You gain proficiency with {@skill Stealth|XPHB}, and you can double your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} when making a Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) check.
You can't cast spells or concentrate on spells. Your ability to speak is reduced to short, basic, guttural responses.
While transformed, you can use weapons and equipment as normal, unless specified elsewhere.

You gain a Claw or Bite attack that you may use in place of any weapon attack. This attack deals {@dice 1d6} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier Slashing damage. You are proficient with this attack, and you add either your Strength or Dexterity modifier to attack and damage rolls. This attack is not an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, nor can it be used in place of an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.
After taking an {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you may take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} later in that turn to attack once with either your Claw or Bite.
If you target a creature that is within 5 feet of one of its enemies, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Claw or Bite attacks made against the target.

entries: Your hybrid rat form lasts 1 hour per Transformation Stage. If you entered your hybrid form voluntarily, you can revert to your normal form by using a {@action Magic|XPHB} action on your turn. ({@filter Flaws listed below|optionalfeatures|source=grimhollowpg24|feature type=ly:tf|miscellaneous=} may override this rule.)

optionalfeature.name: Lust for the Hunt
entries: The savage nature of your curse sometimes causes you to lose control. These ferocious tendencies are a constant struggle between you and the beast within.

The first time you become {@condition Bloodied|XPHB} after finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. If you are in the light of a full moon, you automatically fail this saving throw.
If you fail this saving throw, you are subjected to the following rules until you can end the hybrid form:

items: You immediately enter your hybrid form. You go completely feral, and you cannot use any of your equipment or class features.

On your turn while in hybrid form, you must move toward the closest creature you can see, smell, or hear, prioritizing {@condition Bloodied|XPHB} creatures. If you end your movement and no creature is within 5 feet of you, you must use the {@action Dash|XPHB} action to move toward the closest one.
If there is a creature within 5 feet of you and you have not used your action, you must make an {@action Attack|XPHB} action using your Claw attack.
When you damage a creature on your turn and it is not reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you must use further attacks that turn against that creature.

entries: If you are at full {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of your turn, you can make a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a success, you return to your normal form. You also return to your normal form if {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} is cast on you, or after 1 hour passes.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter's Focus
entries: While in hybrid form, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to mark one creature within 60 feet as your prey. A creature remains marked this way for 1 hour, or until it dies. You may only have 1 creature marked at a time.
While a creature is marked as your prey, you gain the following benefits:

items: Whenever you hit the marked creature with a melee attack, you deal an additional {@damage 1d6} damage of that attack's type.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB} or {@skill Survival|XPHB}) check you make to find it.

optionalfeature.name: Iron Pelt
entries: While in hybrid form, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage. Magical and silvered weapons ignore this {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Kindred Form
entries: You gain the ability to transform into the animal form representative of your Lycanthropy type, known as your Kindred Form. Use the stat block of the creature your lycanthropy corresponds with and follow the rules of the {@spell Polymorph|XPHB} spell:

You are indistinguishable from other creatures of that type, and you can communicate with those creatures. You cannot speak, but you can understand languages you know. All equipment you wear and carry falls off you when transforming.

optionalfeature.name: Silver Sensitivity
entries: You have developed a debilitating sensitivity to silver. In all forms, you have {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage from silvered weapons. In addition, you cannot have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to damage inflicted by silvered weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Bestial Vigor
entries: Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Maximum increases by an amount equal to your character level, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a character level.
Additionally, when in your hybrid form, you gain 5 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of your turns.

optionalfeature.name: Shapeshifter's Savagery
entries: You have embraced the animalistic side of your transformation. While in your hybrid form, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your Claw and Bite attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d8} Slashing damage.
You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions.

optionalfeature.name: Frayed Thoughts
entries: You suffer the effects of sharing a mind with two personalities. Memories of less practical significance are lost to new ones of midnight hunts. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Intelligence ability checks and saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Hybrid Form Affinity
entries: You have achieved a state of equilibrium that most Lycanthropes never find. You gain the following benefits while you are voluntarily in your hybrid form:

items: You can cast spells without needing to provide their Verbal or Somatic components. Additionally, you can cast spells without needing to provide material components, provided they do not have a GP value listed.
Allies within 20 feet of you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ability checks and saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Savage Instincts
entries: You have developed an unrelenting thirst for bloodshed and carnage. While in your hybrid form, if you hit a {@condition Bloodied|XPHB} creature with a Claw or Bite attack, the attack deals an additional {@damage 1d8} Slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Ultimate Predator
entries: You realize the true cost of your transformation. The beast within has gained more control of your body than you have. While you can control it at times, you know it cannot be contained forever—and when it breaks free, it delights in any slaughter it can find.
You gain the following features:

items: If you can see, hear or smell a {@condition Bloodied|XPHB} creature, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom saving throws.

At the start of your turn, if you can see, hear or smell a creature with the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition, you must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, you transform into your hybrid form, or, if already in hybrid form you go feral as described under Lust for Hunt, above. On a success, you are immune to this effect until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
Whenever you kill a creature while in your hybrid form, you cannot transform back into your normal form until dawn the next day.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Joyous Life
entries: At the beginning of your turn, if you are {@condition Bloodied|XPHB}, you can choose to roll a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} (no action required) and regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll. If you roll a 1 on this die, you regain no {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and take 1 point of Force damage instead. You regain this ability when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Prodigious Talent
entries: Choose two Skills. Gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in the chosen skills.

If you roll a 1 or 2 on an {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB} using one of the chosen skills, you immediately lose half your maximum number of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}, rounded down. You do not regain {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} lost this way until you finish two {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB|Long Rests}.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Unsurpassed Fortune
entries: When an enemy you can see within 10 feet succeeds on an attack roll or a saving throw, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to roll {@dice d20}. On a 6 or higher, the triggering attack or save misses or fails, and you regain the use of your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}. Otherwise, you take {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage per Transformation Stage, which cannot be reduced. You regain your use of this ability when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Liberating Freedom
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} while aren't wearing Heavy armor, you can manifest a pair of leathery wings. You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to half your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}. These wings recede if you dismiss them as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your turn, if you have the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition, or if you become {@condition Bloodied|XPHB} while they are manifested.

You can have your wing manifested for 1 hour total, including several shorter stints adding up to 1 hour. You regain your ability to use your wings for an hour after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Unfettered Glory
entries: Each time you damage a creature with a melee attack, an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, or a cantrip, you can do an additional 2 points Force Damage per Transformation Stage.

Each time you roll a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} to regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you regain 2 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} fewer per Hit Die.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Second Chances
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to roll a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die}. If you roll a 2 or better, set your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} total to the result of the roll. If not, you suffer a {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB} failure. You regain the use of this gift when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Unconditional Love
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you fails a saving throw, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d10} plus your Transformation Stage. You regain the use of this gift when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
If you roll a 1 on the die, you gain no {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} and instead have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Martial Prowess
entries: Once per turn, when you miss with a weapon attack or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can reroll the attack roll. If the reroll hits, you must spend 3 {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} and add the result to the attack's normal damage as Force damage. If the reroll misses, you must spend 3 {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} and take Psychic damage equal to the result. If you have fewer than 3 {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} available, you cannot use this gift.
Once you hit a target with an attack using a rerolled attack, you cannot use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Unbridled Power
entries: Upon finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can spend 2 {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} and regain a number of spell slot levels equal to the highest number rolled. However, you take Psychic damage equal to twice the total that you rolled. You regain the reuse of this gift when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Adrenal Injection
entries: For 1 minute, your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet. In addition, once on each of your turns, you can jump up to 30 feet by spending 10 feet of movement.

optionalfeature.name: Allsense Injection
entries: For 1 minute, you have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Eye Oil
entries: For 1 hour, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.
This sense is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Bull's Strength
entries: For 10 minutes, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Cat's Grace
entries: For 10 minutes, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity checks and Dexterity saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Bear's Endurance
entries: For 10 minutes, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Constitution checks and Constitution saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Fox's Cunning
entries: For 10 minutes, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence checks and Intelligence saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Owl's Wisdom
entries: For 10 minutes, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom checks and Wisdom saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Eagle's Splendor
entries: For 10 minutes, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Charisma checks and Charisma saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Elfsight Oil
entries: For 8 hours, you have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 120 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Fleshknit Phosphate
entries: For 1 minute, you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} at the start of each of your turns if you have at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}.

optionalfeature.name: Ironmind Injection
entries: For 1 hour, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} or {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Liquid Courage
entries: You gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to twice your Fighter level plus your Constitution modifier. If any of these {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} remain after 1 minute, they vanish.

optionalfeature.name: Liquid Rage
entries: For 1 minute, your attacks with weapons and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage on hit.

optionalfeature.name: Presto Powder
entries: For 10 minutes, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls and you can take the {@action Dash|XPHB} or {@action Disengage|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Spellshine Ointment
entries: For 1 minute, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Force, Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant damage.

optionalfeature.name: Steelskin Ointment
entries: For 1 minute, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Tenmen Tincture
entries: For 1 hour, you count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity, and when you attack with a Melee weapon whose mastery property you can use, you can replace that property with the {@itemMastery Topple|XPHB} property for that attack.

optionalfeature.name: Dread Venom
entries: A foul-smelling blade oil that causes wounds to hemorrhage and refuse healing. Dread Venom can coat one Slashing or Piercing weapon or up to 10 pieces of Slashing or Piercing ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute and the oil lasts 8 hours once applied. When a creature takes damage from the {@condition poisoned} item, it can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} until it finishes a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Ammunition
entries: The head of an arrow or bolt is tipped with poison, loaded with an acid vial, dipped in flammable oil, or coated with another substance. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you imbue with elemental power a single piece of ammunition that can be fired from a Longbow, Shortbow, or Crossbow as part of an {@action Attack|XPHB} action. When a Elemental Ammunition is imbued, choose a damage type: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder. When a creature takes damage from the Elemental Ammunition, it takes an additional {@damage 2d6} damage of the chosen type.

Elemental Ammunition discharges its energy if it hits, and it can't be recovered. If the attack misses, the Elemental Ammunition can be recovered and used again. Elemental Ammunition retains its power for 48 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Runic Bomb
entries: Runic Bombs are used to hunt creatures resilient to mundane weapons. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can throw the runic bomb at a point  within 60 feet that you can see, creating a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on that point. The {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} spreads around corners, and its area is {@variantrule Lightly Obscured|XPHB}. It lasts for 1 minute or until a strong wind (such as one created by Gust of Wind) disperses it. Whenever Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage is dealt to a creature inside the sphere, that damage is Force damage instead of its normal damage type.
A Runic Bomb is destroyed after a single use.

optionalfeature.name: Scorpion Anchor
entries: This weapon is intended to keep flying foes anchored to the ground or stop monsters from fleeing. The Scorpion Anchor can be fired from a Longbow, Shortbow, or Crossbow as part of an {@action Attack|XPHB} action. When you hit a creature with an attack roll using a Scorpion Anchor, it has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. A creature {@condition Restrained|XPHB} by the Scorpion Anchor can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your Trapper Gadget save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer {@condition Restrained|XPHB}.
A Scorpion Anchor is destroyed after the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} creature escapes or dies.

optionalfeature.name: Terrain Cloak
entries: Composed of local materials, a Terrain Cloak allows wearers to conceal themselves within the environment. Terrain Cloaks can be worn over Light or Medium armor and are donned and doffed with the speed of Light armor.
Creatures have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks to see you.
The item lasts until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, at which point the item falls apart.

optionalfeature.name: Weretrap
entries: A Weretrap detonates when its fragile exterior is broken. You can take a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to set the Weretrap in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. A creature within 30 feet must succeed on a Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) check against your Trapper Gadget DC to spot the trap. Creatures have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on this check.

A creature that steps into a space containing a Weretrap triggers the trap and makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 3d10} Bludgeoning damage and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

The Weretrap can also be used as a Light Ranged weapon with the Finesse and Thrown property. It has a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. On a hit, the Weretrap deals {@damage 3d10} Bludgeoning damage and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.
The Weretrap is destroyed after it is triggered or thrown, regardless of whether it hits or misses.

optionalfeature.name: Damage Resistance (Armor Modification)
entries: The monster hide used to craft your armor grants some resistances. You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to two of the following damage types of your choice: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Charge (Armor Modification)
entries: You embed your armor with a Construct's gemstone or infuse it with the power of an Elemental. Choose one of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder. When you hit a creature with an attack, you can cause it to deal the chosen damage type rather than its normal damage type, and the attack deals an extra {@dice 1d6} of that type.

optionalfeature.name: Hardened Defense (Armor Modification)
entries: Hardened scales or magical pelts make your armor difficult to pierce. While wearing your crafted armor, you gain a +2 bonus to {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Phase Leap (Armor Modification)
entries: You have powdered your armor with fey dust or sewn a pelt of a phase-shifting monstrosity into it. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

optionalfeature.name: Regeneration (Armor Modification)
entries: You reinforce the armor with troll hide or soak it in vampire blood. You have a pool of six d10s. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend a die from the pool, roll that die and add your Constitution modifier, and regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll's total.
You regain all the expended dice when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Stealthy (Armor Modification)
entries: Your armor is draped with a shadowy cloak or made from hide as light as a feather. Your armor doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks, even if it would normally. While wearing your armor, creatures have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks to see you, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks to notice creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Creature of the Sea
entries: {@b Cost:} {@i 1 Mutation Point}

You gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and you can breathe underwater. For an additional 1 Mutation Point, you gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to twice your speed.

optionalfeature.name: Creature of the Sky
entries: {@b Cost:} {@i 3 Mutation Points}
You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 30 feet. For an additional 2 Mutation Points, your {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} increases to 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Darkvision
entries: {@b Cost:} {@i 1 Mutation Point}
You gain {@variantrule Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have Darkvision, its range increases by 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Disquieting Voice
entries: {@b Cost:} {@i 1 Mutation Point}
You can comprehend and verbally communicate with Beasts, and you can use any of the {@action Influence|XPHB} action's skill options with them.

optionalfeature.name: Echolocation
entries: {@b Cost:} {@i 3 Mutation Points}
You have {@variantrule Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 30 feet while you don't have the {@condition Deafened|XPHB} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Enlarge
entries: {@b Cost:} {@i 2 Mutation Points}

Your size increases by one category (from Medium to Large, for example). You can spend an additional 2 Mutation Points to increase your size by two categories instead (from Medium to Huge, for example), gaining the benefits of the spell again.
See the {@spell Enlarge/Reduce|XPHB} spell to determine the benefits gained from this ability.

optionalfeature.name: Manipulate Objects
entries: {@b Cost:} {@i 1 Mutation Point}
As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can take the {@action Utilize|XPHB} action.

optionalfeature.name: Multiattack
entries: {@b Cost:} {@i 2 Mutation Points}
You can attack twice with a Wild Shape form's attack instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Armor
entries: {@b Cost:} {@i 2 Mutation Points}
You gain a +1 bonus to {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}.

entries.name: Repeatable
entries: You can gain this Mutation more than once, but no more than three times.

optionalfeature.name: Reduce
entries: {@b Cost:} {@i 1 Mutation Point}

Your size decreases by one category (from Medium to Small, for example). You can spend an additional 2 Mutation Points to decrease your size by two categories instead (from Medium to Tiny, for example). See the {@spell Enlarge/Reduce|XPHB} spell to determine the benefits gained from this ability.

optionalfeature.name: Venomous Attacks
entries: {@b Cost:} {@i 2 Mutation Points}

Once per turn, a creature you hit with a Wild Shape form's attack takes an extra {@damage 2d6} Poison damage, and you can force a creature you hit with a Wild Shape form's attack to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} for 1 minute. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition on a success.

entries.name: Repeatable
entries: You can gain this Mutation more than once, but no more than three times. For each additional 2 Mutation points, the attack does an additional {@damage 2d6} Poison damage.

optionalfeature.name: Wall Crawler
entries: {@b Cost:} {@i 1 Mutation Point}
You gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your speed. For an additional 1 Mutation Point, you gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to twice your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Creature of Earth
entries: {@b Cost:} {@i 3 Mutation Points}
You have {@sense Tremorsense|XPHB} with a range of 30 feet. You can spend 2 additional Mutation Points to gain a {@variantrule Burrow Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Inurement
entries: {@b Cost:} {@i 2 Mutation Points}
You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to one of the following damage types of your choice: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder.

entries.name: Repeatable
entries: You can gain this Mutation more than once, but you must choose a different {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} each time.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Assault
entries: {@b Cost:} {@i 2 Mutation Points}
You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls you make with your Wild Shape form's attacks.

entries.name: Repeatable
entries: You can gain this Mutation more than once, but no more than three times.

optionalfeature.name: Mystic Monster
entries: {@b Cost:} {@i 3 Mutation Points}

You can cast spells while you're in this Wild Shape form. If you have 18 or more Druid levels, creatures have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells you cast while this Mutation is active.

optionalfeature.name: Rapid Regeneration
entries: {@b Cost:} {@i 5 Mutation Points}
At the start of each of your turns, you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} regained).

optionalfeature.name: Supernatural Hide
entries: {@b Cost:} {@i 5 Mutation Points}
You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Acid Blood (Aberration, Ooze, Plant)
entries: For 1 minute, your blood becomes acidic. Each time a creature hits you with an attack while within 5 feet of you, it takes {@damage 2d6} Acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Acumen (Celestial, Fiend, Fey)
entries: For 1 hour, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) checks. Additionally, choose either {@skill Intimidation|XPHB} or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks using the chosen skill.

optionalfeature.name: Awareness (All)
entries: For 10 minutes, you know the location of creatures that are the same type as the creature you consumed within 60 feet of you that are not behind {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover}.

optionalfeature.name: Flight (Celestial, Dragon, Elemental)
entries: For 10 minutes, you grow feathery, feathery, or spectral wings from your back. You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}. You can't benefit from this mutation while wearing Heavy Armor.

optionalfeature.name: Infused (Dragon, Elemental, Ooze)
entries: Choose one of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder. For 10 minutes, whenever you hit with an attack, you can cause it to deal the chosen type rather than its normal damage type.

optionalfeature.name: Invisibility (Fey, Fiend, Undead)
entries: For 10 minutes, you have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition. This effect ends early if you dismiss it (no action required), or you attack or cast a spell.

optionalfeature.name: Might (Beast, Construct, Giant)
entries: For 1 minute, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength checks and saving throws. You also have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls using Strength, and you deal {@damage 1d6} extra damage to targets you hit with a Strength-based attack. The damage is the same type dealt by the attack.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Weapons (Beast, Dragon, Monstrosity)
entries: For 1 hour, you gain natural weapons. You can roll {@dice 1d6} in place of the normal damage of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}. This damage can be Piercing or Slashing. You choose each time you make an attack. You can also make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your Unarmed Strikes.

optionalfeature.name: Regeneration (Beast, Giant, Monstrosity)
entries: You regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d8} plus your Monster Hunter level.

optionalfeature.name: Resistance (Construct, Elemental, Undead)
entries: For 1 minute, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Telepathy (Aberration, Fiend, Plant)
entries: For 1 hour, you can speak telepathically to any creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself. Your telepathic utterances are in a language you know, and the creature understands you only if it knows that language. Additionally, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage.

table.name: Unstable Form
rows: The stress of your Transformation becomes too much. You die. You cannot be restored to life by any spell below level 5.
Your form becomes fragile. Your Hit Point Maximum is half your normal maximum.
Your body starts to lose cohesion. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on all {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}.
Your body's metabolism quickly drains your energy. You gain 2 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels.
You have trouble processing what is happening. After rolling {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you have the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the end of your first turn.
Your limbs weaken. Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} (in all modes of movement) decreases by 15 feet and cannot be increased.
Your body does not react quickly to mental commands. You cannot take {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions}.
You are distracted by your changing form. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks.
Your body becomes unable to fight off attacks. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Constitution saving throws.
You become clumsy. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity saving throws and Dexterity ability checks.
You lose blood or other vital fluids during your mutations. You cannot add your Constitution modifier to any {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} spent to regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
Speaking is difficult. You can only utter one word during each turn. This does not hamper spellcasting.
Your lower limbs become more powerful. Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 5 feet.
Your flesh becomes more hardy. You start the day with 4 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} per Transformation Stage.
Your body's systems are enhanced. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws}.

entries: {@i Choose A, B, or C:} (A) {@item Scale Mail|XPHB}, {@item Longsword|XPHB}, {@item Light Crossbow|XPHB}, 20 {@item Bolt|XPHB|Bolts}, {@item Dungeoneer's Pack|XPHB}, and 5 GP; (B) {@item Studded Leather Armor|XPHB}, {@item Scimitar|XPHB}, {@item Shortsword|XPHB}, {@item Longbow|XPHB}, 20 {@item Arrow|XPHB|Arrows}, {@item Quiver|XPHB}, {@item Dungeoneer's Pack|XPHB}, and 10 GP; or (C) 160 GP

classFeature.name: Monster Grimoire
