entries: You create or inherit a repository of knowledge known as a Monster Grimoire. Each Monster Hunter carries a grimoire, a manual on dangerous creatures. A Monster Hunter's grimoire is an object entirely unique to each hunter. It may be a leather tome recovered from a dusty library with notes made in the margins, a set of blood-stained scrolls inherited from a previous hunter, or a precious stone with a communing spirit held within.

If a Monster Hunter ever loses a grimoire, the hunter has retained enough knowledge to not suffer immediate drawbacks. However, the hunter can't add to the grimoire until it is restored and therefore can't take another Monster Hunter level until a lost grimoire has been replaced. A grimoire can be recreated by spending 8 hours and 50 GP worth of materials such as books, scrolls, and ink.

Choose two types of creatures that you are specialized in hunting from the following list: Aberrations, Beasts, Celestials, Constructs, Dragons, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, Giants, Monstrosities, Oozes, Plants, or Undead.

You add your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to Intelligence and Wisdom checks you make that relate to the creature types in your grimoire. For example, if Undead are in your grimoire, you add your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to an Intelligence ({@skill History|XPHB}) check to recall lore about an Undead creature you're investigating or a Wisdom ({@skill Medicine|XPHB}) check to identify claw marks left on a corpse by an Undead creature. If you are already proficient in a skill when asked to make an Intelligence or Wisdom ability check relating to the monster types in your grimoire, you add double your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} instead.
When you gain this feature, you also learn one language based on the chart below. (You can add languages to this chart based on your own campaign world.)

classFeature.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of weapons of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as {@item Longbow|XPHB|Longbows} and {@item Longsword|XPHB|Longswords}. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can practice weapon drills and change one of those weapon choices.
When you reach certain Monster Hunter levels, you gain the ability to use the mastery properties of more kinds of weapons, as shown in the Weapon Mastery column of the Monster Hunter Features table.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You gain a {@filter Fighting Style feat|feats|category=FS} of your choice.

classFeature.name: Studied Response
entries: You have learned the most effective way to slay a monster is to strike its most vulnerable area at the right moment. Too early, and your attack glances away. Too late, and the monster may eviscerate you.

When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you targets you or another creature with a melee or ranged attack, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} before the attack roll to make one attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} against that creature.
If the attack misses, you regain the use of your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Monster Hunter Subclass
entries: You gain a Monster Hunter subclass of your choice. The Carver Guild, Devourer Guild, Occultist Guild, and Trapper Guild subclasses are detailed below. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Monster Hunter levels. The guild you choose grants you features when you reach Monster Hunter levels 3, 7, 10, 15, and 18.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Monster Hunter levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Expert Strike
entries: You learn the weaknesses of monsters so that you know exactly where to strike to inflict the most damage. You can add your Intelligence modifier to the attack and damage rolls of your weapons and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}.

classFeature.name: Improved Monster Grimoire
entries: You have expanded your Monster Grimoire with your experience and knowledge.

You can select a third creature type to add to your Monster Grimoire from the following list: Aberrations, Beasts, Celestials, Constructs, Dragons, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, Giants, Monstrosities, Oozes, Plants, or Undead. You can't choose a creature type you have chosen before. All the benefits you gain from your Monster Grimoire now also apply to this new type.

Additionally, your attack rolls with weapons and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} against creature types in your Monster Grimoire can score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Monster Hunter Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Knowledgeable Defense
entries: You can rely on your knowledge to anticipate a monster's actions and summon your best defense.
Whenever a creature type in your Monster Grimoire forces you to make a saving throw, you can make an Intelligence saving throw in place of that saving throw instead.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Monster Hunter Subclass.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Improved Monster Grimoire
entries: Your Monster Grimoire is further expanded by your encounters and studies.

You can select a fourth creature type to add to your Monster Grimoire from the following list: Aberrations, Beasts, Constructs, Celestials, Dragons, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, Giants, Monstrosities, Oozes, Plants, or Undead. You can't choose a monster type you have chosen before. All the benefits you gain from your Monster Grimoire now also apply to this new monster type.

classFeature.name: Lair Sense
entries: You are experienced at navigating the threats that arise near a monster's lair. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws and {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the damage of lair actions and regional effects caused by creatures. In addition, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws and {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to damage against the Legendary Actions of creature types in your Monster Grimoire.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Monster Hunter Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Slayer's Aid
entries: You're able to coordinate with your allies to quickly slay dangerous monsters.

When you use Studied Response, choose a {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} creature that can see or hear you. That creature can use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make one attack with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} against the creature that triggered your Studied Response. If the ally does not have their {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, they regain it but then must use it to make the attack. Your ally's attack occurs after yours but before the target creature rolls its own attack. This ability refreshes at the start of your turn.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Monster Hunter Subclass.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Grave Strike
entries: You gain the ability to strike mortal blows against the creatures you have studied.

Your attack rolls with weapons and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} against creature types in your Monster Grimoire can now score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 18 through 20 on the {@dice d20}. When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} against a creature type in your Monster Grimoire, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. The DC equals the damage taken, up to a maximum DC of 30. On a failed save, the creature drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. On a successful save, the creature takes the attack's normal damage.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Monster Hunter
entries: Monster Hunters are skilled professionals, specializing in identifying, tracking, and slaying monsters that threaten the lives and the livelihoods of the people of Etharis.

Each Monster Hunter trains in a different method for these tasks. Some hunters don heavy armor and carry shields to protect against crushing jaws and scything claws, others deploy cunning traps to keep a safe distance from the horrors they hunt, some assume the traits and powers of their enemies to better slay them, and others dabble in magic to supplement martial prowess with arcane wrath.

subclass.name: Path of the Primal Spirit
subclassFeatures: Path of the Primal Spirit|Barbarian|XPHB|Primal Spirit|GrimHollowPG24|3

subclass.name: Path of the Wrathful Dead
subclassFeatures: Path of the Wrathful Dead|Barbarian|XPHB|Wrathful Dead|GrimHollowPG24|3
Death Is but a Door|Barbarian|XPHB|Wrathful Dead|GrimHollowPG24|10

subclass.name: Warrior of the Leaden Crown
subclassFeatures: Warrior of the Leaden Crown|Monk|XPHB|Leaden Crown|GrimHollowPG24|3

subclass.name: Eldritch Domain
subclassFeatures: Sing the Song that Ends the World|Cleric|XPHB|Eldritch|GrimHollowPG24|17

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Fractured
entries: {@i Two Personalities Are Better than One}

Barbarians are defined by their rage, channeling it to unleash brief but potent destruction. Few are brave or unwise enough to study esoteric psychological techniques that split their rage from the rest of their psyche, dividing their identity into two parts: ego and id. When their ego is in control, the Fractured—as these Barbarians are known—possess self-control and cunning beyond most other Barbarians. When they allow their id to take control, their countenance turns monstrous and their bodies swell with the power of rage made physically manifest.

subclassFeature.name: Face of Rage
entries: When you activate your Rage, your countenance distorts and your body swells. Creatures that haven't witnessed your transformation, now or previously, don't recognize you. In addition, while your Rage is active, you gain the following benefits:

items: You can roll {@dice 1d8} in place of the normal damage of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, and whenever you deal damage with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, it can deal your choice of Force damage or its normal damage type.

When you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can push it 10 feet or force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your Strength modifier and your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.
You count as one size larger when determining the success or failure of a Grapple, and when you make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, your reach is 5 feet greater than normal.

subclassFeature.name: Mask of Civility
entries: You are proficient in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Arcana|XPHB}, {@skill History|XPHB}, {@skill Investigation|XPHB}, {@skill Medicine|XPHB}, {@skill Nature|XPHB}, {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}, or {@skill Religion|XPHB}. In addition, you gain proficiency with one type of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice or you know one language of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Brains and Brawn
entries: While your Rage is not active, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage. While your Rage is active, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to every damage type except Force and Psychic.

subclassFeature.name: Cunning and Brutal
entries: While your Rage is not active, you can take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} or {@action Help|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. While your Rage is active, your attack rolls with {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

subclassFeature.name: Better Half
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and not killed outright, you can drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead, and you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum. In addition, if your Rage is active, your Rage ends. If your Rage was not active, you immediately activate your Rage (even if you have no remaining uses of your Rage). If any of these {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} remain after 1 minute, they vanish.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Primal Spirit
entries: {@i Rage Alongside a Bestial Spirit}

Many Barbarians are in tune with the natural world, but few are as mystically intertwined with it as those who walk the Path of the Primal Spirit. These Barbarians forge powerful connections with beasts and nature spirits, inspiring such ethereal beings to manifest and journey on far-flung adventures.

Barbarians who follow this path have a deep reverence for the cycle of the natural world. Such Barbarians are as likely to accept quests and pleas for aid from local wildlife as they are from people. This respect for animals and spirits doesn't cross into naivety—few understand the delicate balance between the needs of predator and prey better than those who walk the Path of the Primal Spirit.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Companion
entries: You magically summon a primal spirit that adopts the form of a beast and accompanies you on your adventures. Choose its stat block: {@creature Primal Guardian|GrimHollowPG24} or {@creature Primal Striker|GrimHollowPG24}. In addition, choose an environment that will modify the creature's stat block: Land, Sea, or Sky. You also determine the kind of animal it is, choosing a kind appropriate for the stat block. Whatever companion you choose, it bears eldritch markings indicating its otherworldly origin.
The companion is {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} to you and your allies and obeys your commands. It vanishes if you die.

entries.name: The Beast in Combat
entries: In combat, the companion acts during your turn. It can move and use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} on its own, but the only action it takes is the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action unless you take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to command it to take an action in its stat block or some other action. You can also sacrifice one of your attacks when you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action to command the beast to take the Beast's Strike action. If you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, the companion acts on its own and isn't limited to the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action.

entries.name: Restoring or Replacing the Beast
entries: If the companion has died within the last hour, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to touch it and expend a use of your Rage. The companion returns to life immediately with all its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} restored.

Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can summon a different primal companion, which appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. You choose its stat block and appearance. If you already have a beast from this feature, the old one vanishes when the new one appears.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Rage
entries: While your Rage is active, your primal companion has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Kin to Beasts
entries: You always have the {@spell Animal Friendship|XPHB} and {@spell Speak with Animals|XPHB} spells prepared. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either spell in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for them.

subclassFeature.name: Skinrider's Trance
entries: You take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to enter a trance and choose your primal companion or one Beast currently under the effect of your {@spell Animal Friendship|XPHB} spell within 60 feet of yourself. For the duration of this trance, you possess the chosen creature.

Once you possess a creature's body, you control it. Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}, Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and senses are replaced by the creature's. You otherwise keep your game statistics. This possession ends if you choose to exit the trance (no action required by you), if the Beast you're possessing is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, or if you and the Beast are on different planes of existence.

While in this trance, your body falls into a catatonic state. You can't move or take {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions}, and you're unaware of your surroundings. You can remain in the trance for a number of hours up to half your Barbarian level plus your Constitution modifier.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending one use of your Rage (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Shape of the Wild
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can choose a new form for your primal companion, causing it to transform instantaneously. When you cause your primal companion to transform in this way, its current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} change to its new {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending one use of your Rage (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Wrathful Dead
entries: {@i Channel the Rage of the Unquiet Dead}

Barbarians who walk the Path of the Wrathful Dead commune with the spirits of the deceased and channel their spectral powers. These Barbarians are often preoccupied with the dead whispering in their ears, which urge them to act upon the whims and emotions of the haunting spirits. Some who walk this path learn to master the powers gifted to them; others find they've become servants to the unending chorus clamoring for their attention.

subclassFeature.name: Rage of the Dead
entries: Your Rage taps into the endless fury of the unquiet dead. While your Rage is active, you take on aspects of restless spirits and you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Shadow Form
entries: You ignore {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. In addition, you can move through the space of any creature, but you can't end your move in an occupied space.

entries.name: Shadowy Sidestep
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet, and {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} against you.

entries.name: Spectral Sight
entries: You see creatures and objects within 120 feet that have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane.

subclassFeature.name: Final Night Catharsis
entries: You are overcome by an emotion a nearby spirit experienced at its death. You gain one of the following options of your choice. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change your choice.

entries.name: Hate
entries: When you miss with an attack roll against a creature, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll you make against it before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Jealousy
entries: When a creature you have {@condition Grappled|XPHB} is about to make an ability check to end the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition on itself, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on that roll.

entries.name: Terror
entries: While you are {@condition Bloodied|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to take the {@action Dash|XPHB} or {@action Disengage|XPHB} action.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Doom Revisited
entries: Once per active Rage, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to channel a traumatic death. When you do, choose one of the following options.

entries.name: Contamination
entries: At the start of their turn, each creature of your choice in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or take Poison damage and gain the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for 1 minute.

To determine the Poison damage, roll a number of d6s equal to your Rage Damage bonus, and add them together. An affected creature can use an action to end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition on itself.

entries.name: Hypothermia
entries: At the start of their turn, each creature of your choice in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your Strength modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or take Cold damage and have its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} halved for 1 minute.
To determine the Cold damage, roll a number of d6s equal to your Rage Damage bonus, and add them together. A creature can use an action to end this effect on itself.

entries.name: Immolation
entries: At the start of their turn, each creature of your choice in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or take Fire damage.

To determine the Fire damage, roll a number of d6s equal to your Rage Damage bonus, and add them together. As an action, a creature can extinguish the fire on itself by giving itself the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition and rolling on the ground. The fire also goes out if it is doused, submerged, or suffocated.

subclassFeature.name: Death Is but a Door
entries: Your familiarity with death has left you resistant to its call. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Hard to Kill
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws}. In addition, you must fail four {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws} to die instead of three as normal.

entries.name: Return the Spirit
entries: You can call the spirits of the deceased to restore life essence to a nearby creature. You can cast the {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Raise Dead|XPHB}, or {@spell Revivify|XPHB} spell without providing Material components. When you do, you gain 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level for {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB}, 2 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels for {@spell Revivify|XPHB}, and 3 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels for {@spell Raise Dead|XPHB}. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this feature.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you expend two uses of your Rage (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Powered by Pathos
entries: Your Rage is empowered by the overwhelming emotions of the unquiet dead. Your Final Night Catharsis feature grants an additional effect based on the chosen emotion.

entries.name: Hate
entries: While your Rage is active, your attacks with weapons and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

entries.name: Jealousy
entries: Whenever a creature you can see starts its turn within 30 feet of you while your Rage is active, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to summon spectral assailants to Grapple the creature. The creature makes a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failure, the creature has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition until the end of its turn. On a successful save, the creature is not {@condition Grappled|XPHB}; however, each foot of movement costs 1 extra foot for that creature until the end of its turn.

entries.name: Terror
entries: Whenever a creature you can see starts its turn within 30 feet of you while your Rage is active, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make that creature terrified until the start of its next turn. A terrified creature's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved and {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} against it have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: College of Adventurers
entries: {@i Be a Master of Classes}

Bards from the College of Adventurers learn from heroes of old and stories of legend. Bards are jacks of all trades, and, for the College of Adventurers, this statement rings even truer. They combine all the skills of their companions into one, allowing them to be versatile and supportive. While not having a direct goal, many adventurer-studying Bards live to tell tales of other heroes or seek to create their own. Stories of great deeds, of desperate cunning, of magical anomalies, or of godly might fuel these Bards.

subclassFeature.name: Talented Adventurer
entries: You learn an adventurer's talent of your choice from the {@filter "Adventurer's Talent Options"|optionalfeatures|feature type=ca:at} section later in this subclass's description. You learn an additional adventurer's talent of your choice when you reach Bard levels 6 and 14.

subclassFeature.name: Party Planner
entries: While a creature has a Bardic Inspiration die from you, it can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to take the {@action Help|XPHB} action.

subclassFeature.name: Well-Rounded
entries: You gain proficiency with one type of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice, you gain proficiency in one skill of your choice, and you know one language of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Improvisational Talent
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can choose one adventurer's talent you know and replace it with one you don't.

subclassFeature.name: College of Fools
entries: {@i Laugh at Your Foes' Terror}

It's commonly believed the College of Fools is merely a front for a cult of Beleth. Bards in the College would say their relationship with the Arch Daemon of Fear is much more complicated. These Bards choose to laugh at Etharis's many horrors rather than be dismayed by them—a whimsical, if ghoulish, philosophy. Their delight in other creatures' terror encourages their obscene antics and cruel jests. One person's trick is another person's terror, after all.

subclassFeature.name: Antagonistic Antics
entries: You know the {@spell Vicious Mockery|XPHB} cantrip. If you already know it, you learn a different Bard cantrip of your choice. The cantrip doesn't count against your number of cantrips known. Additionally, you always have the {@spell Dissonant Whispers|XPHB} spell prepared.

In addition, when you take the {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, or {@action Influence|XPHB} action on your turn, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on the same turn to cast {@spell Vicious Mockery|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Cruel Jest
entries: When a creature that you can see or hear within 30 feet of yourself fails a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration; roll your Bardic Inspiration die and deal Psychic damage equal to the number rolled plus your Charisma modifier. In addition, the creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} it makes before the end of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Gallows Humor
entries: When a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or killed outright, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to regain an expended use of your Bardic Inspiration. When you do so, choose a creature within 30 feet of you that can hear and understand you. That creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or gain the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition and have its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. If the creature succeeds on the Wisdom saving throw, you regain the use of this ability. Otherwise, once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Last Laugh
entries: When you become {@condition Bloodied|XPHB} or take damage while you are {@condition Bloodied|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to regain all expended Bardic Inspiration dice and break out into a cackling fit of fatalistic glee at your own impending doom. For 1 minute, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage. Also, when a creature within 60 feet of you hits you with an attack roll, you can expend up to three Bardic Inspiration dice to force the attacker to make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, the creature takes Psychic damage equal to the total rolled on the Bardic Inspiration dice plus your Charisma modifier.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: College of Requiems
entries: {@i Sing the Songs of the Dead}

Performing macabre melodies filled with grief-stricken chords and mournful refrains, the College of Requiems stirs the very bones of the dead. Requiem Bards weave necromantic magic into their funerary songs to control and empower a host of Undead minions.

subclassFeature.name: Chilling Melody
entries: You learn two Necromancy cantrips of your choice. These count as Bard spells for you but don't count against the number of cantrips you know.

subclassFeature.name: Pluck the Heartstrings
entries: Your Bardic Inspiration can pluck at the tethers of life. Each creature that has a Bardic Inspiration die from you can use it for one of the following effects.

entries.name: Defense
entries: When the creature is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and not killed outright, the creature can roll the Bardic Inspiration die to be reduced to a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} rolled on the Bardic Inspiration die instead.

entries.name: Offense
entries: Immediately after the creature hits a target with an attack roll, the creature can roll the Bardic Inspiration die and add the number rolled as extra Necrotic damage dealt by the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Stir the Bones
entries: You always have the {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB} spell prepared. It counts as a Bard spell for you.

When you expend a use of Bardic Inspiration, choose Undead creatures under your control within 60 feet of yourself, up to a number equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one creature). The chosen creatures each gain a Bardic Inspiration die. These extra Bardic Inspiration dice do not count against your limit.

When an Undead creature under your control expends a Bardic Inspiration die on an attack roll, it can also add the number rolled on the Bardic Inspiration die to the attack's damage roll if that attack hits.

subclassFeature.name: Dual Death
entries: When you cast a Necromancy spell that targets only one creature, you can have it target a second creature within range.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending one use of your Bardic Inspiration dice (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Bulwark Warrior
entries: {@i Provoke Your Enemies, Protect Your Allies}

Those who learn the fighting prowess of the Bulwark Warrior Warriors protect their allies from certain death. With endurance and strength as their primary skills, these warriors are prepared to take lethal strikes for their companions.

subclassFeature.name: Protective Taunt
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with a melee attack using a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can taunt it. Until the start of your next turn or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against targets other than you. A creature can only be affected by one Taunt at a time.

subclassFeature.name: Weather the Storm
entries: You have grown accustomed to being battered and bruised. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you toughen up for 1 minute. At the end of each of your turns, you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Fighter level plus your Constitution modifier.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Threatening Presence
entries: You can provoke your enemies into single-minded hatred of you. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, each creature of your choice that can hear you in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 5d6} Psychic damage and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against targets other than you. When you use this feature, you restore your use of Weather the Storm.
You can use this feature twice. You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
When you reach Fighter level 15, you gain another use of this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Aggressive Defense
entries: You know when to switch from defense to offense. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an attack roll using a Melee weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can lose {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to no more than half your Fighter level (round down) to deal extra damage to the target equal to the number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} lost in this way.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Second Wind
entries: Your endurance is unrivaled. When you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} from Second Wind, you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll's total.

subclassFeature.name: Halt the Assault
entries: When another creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to change the target to yourself. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage against that attack.

subclassFeature.name: Living Crucible
entries: {@i Enhance Your Martial Prowess with Alchemy}

Fighters who become Living Crucibles have discovered an external means of power. While most Fighters train in martial traditions or study the art of war, Living Crucibles hone their craft of alchemy to endure compounds poisonous to others. In exchange for this rigorous physical and mental preparation, these Fighters are able to temporarily push their bodies past their natural limits. Under the influence of their alchemical compounds, these warriors can see in darkness, enhance their speed, inure themselves to magical attacks, and more.

subclassFeature.name: Compound Creator
entries: You learn to create alchemical compounds toxic to others but empowering to you.

entries.name: Compounds
entries: You learn three compounds of your choice from the {@filter "Compound Options"|optionalfeatures|source=grimhollowpg24|feature type=lc:co} section below. You learn two additional compounds of your choice when you reach Fighter levels 7, 10, and 15. Each time you learn new compounds, you can also replace one compound you know with a different one.

entries.name: Creating
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} while holding {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}, you can use that tool to magically produce any number of compounds. The compound appears in a vial, and the vial vanishes when the compound is consumed or poured out. If any compound remains when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, the compound and its vial vanish.

entries.name: Consuming
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can consume one compound. You can consume a number of compounds up to one plus your Constitution modifier (minimum of one). Once you reach this limit, you cannot benefit from more compounds until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
You can benefit from multiple compounds at the same time, but consuming multiple vials of the same compound provides no additional effects.

Only you can benefit from your compounds. Any other creature that consumes a compound must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your Intelligence modifier plus {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or have the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Student of Alchemy
entries: Your long nights of vigilance have left your senses attuned to signs of danger, granting you the following benefits.

You gain {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}, and you have proficiency with it. In addition, your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} is doubled for ability checks with {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Living Cauldron
entries: The number of compounds you can safely consume increases to three plus your Constitution modifier (minimum one).
At Fighter level 18, the number of compounds you can safely consume increases to five plus your Constitution modifier (minimum one).

subclassFeature.name: Rapid Consumption
entries: When you use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to drink a compound, you can drink a second compound.

subclassFeature.name: Toxin Transmutation
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage. Also, as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition on yourself.

When you end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition on yourself in this way, you can choose to gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Fighter level. You regain the ability to gain these {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} after completing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Living Catalyst
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can replace one compound you know with another one.

subclassFeature.name: Nightwatcher
entries: {@i Take Back the Night}

Nightwatchers come from humble origins, often toiling as guards or investigators. Undaunted by dangers in the darkness, they stand firm against the growing night. Ever vigilant, they use the darkness to surprise and overwhelm foes much greater than themselves.

subclassFeature.name: Skilled Guardian
entries: Unraveling mysteries under the cover of night has honed your skills. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Expertise
entries: Choose one of your skill proficiencies with which you lack {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB}. You gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in that skill.

entries.name: Skilled
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice from the following list: {@skill Deception|XPHB}, {@skill History|XPHB}, {@skill Insight|XPHB}, {@skill Intimidation|XPHB}, {@skill Investigation|XPHB}, {@skill Perception|XPHB}, or {@skill Stealth|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Ever Vigilant
entries: Your long nights of vigilance have left your senses attuned to signs of danger, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You gain {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} when you gain this feature, its range increases by 60 feet.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls and Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks.

entries.name: Warning Shout
entries: When you make an {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to warn creatures of your choice within 30 feet of yourself that can see or hear you. Each creature can then take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on its {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll and move up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Size Up
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you assess a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. Until the start of your next turn, when that creature makes an attack roll against you or another creature within 5 feet of you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on that roll and give {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to that damage.

subclassFeature.name: Night Stalker
entries: You are adept at tracking down enemies in the dead of night, giving you these benefits.

entries.name: Blindsight
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you gain {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 30 feet for 10 minutes. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Slippery
entries: {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} against you. While entirely within {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} or {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}, your movement doesn't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

subclassFeature.name: Ready for Action
entries: When you make an {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll, you can treat a {@dice d20} roll of 9 or lower as a 10. When you roll 18-20 on an {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll, you can take one additional action, except the {@action Magic|XPHB} action, on your first turn.

subclassFeature.name: Beat Down
entries: Immediately after you miss a creature under the effect of your Size Up feature with an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} or {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make a melee attack against that creature if it's within range. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the new attack roll against that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Leaden Crown
entries: {@i Harness the Will to Resist}

In contrast to the esoteric ideals of other orders, Warriors of the Leaden Crown have practical aims: the self-governance of all people. These Monks see history as a series of clashes between groups of powerful beings where Humanoids are at best collateral damage and at worst disposable pawns. To break this cycle of dependence and destruction, Warriors of the Leaden Crown master mental abilities to fight against the otherworldly powers of the multiverse and protect Humanoid sovereignty.

One component of this plan involves training to do battle with powerful planar foes. The other equally important component is ensuring that Humanoid societies are prepared to overthrow those already dominating them. To that end, these Monks seek political positions that place them in or near decision-making roles where they can influence others to fight back against Arch Seraphs, Arch Daemons, and Primordials.

subclassFeature.name: Subtle Hand
entries: Your martial arts are enhanced by a capacity for telekinetic strikes. During your turn, your reach is 5 feet greater with {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}. In addition, when you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can choose to have it deal your choice of Psychic damage or its normal damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Prowess
entries: Your psychic powers have manifested in the ability to cast certain spells. You know the {@spell Mage Hand|XPHB} cantrip. You can cast it without Verbal or Somatic components, and you can make the spectral hand {@condition Invisible|XPHB}.

In addition, you can cast certain spells by expending Focus Points. You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action and expend 1 Focus Point to cast {@spell Detect Evil and Good|XPHB} or {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|XPHB}. You can also take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action and expend 2 Focus Points to cast {@spell Hold Person|XPHB}, {@spell Levitate|XPHB}, or {@spell Shatter|XPHB}. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells, and you can cast them without Material components.

subclassFeature.name: Unsubtle Strike
entries: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} or Monk weapon, you can force it to make a Strength saving throw against your Focus Point save DC. On a failed save, you can move the target up to 10 feet toward or away from you.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Crush
entries: Each time you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, it gains a Pressure Point. A creature loses all Pressure Points if you cause a different creature to gain a Pressure Point or after 1 minute, whichever comes first. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend 1 Focus Point to telekinetically crush a creature with 1 or more of your Pressure Points. The creature loses all Pressure Points and must make a Strength saving throw against your Focus Point save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} Force damage per Pressure Point, and it has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Mastery
entries: After much training, you have mastered the psionic disciplines necessary to defend mortals from planar threats. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can spend 5 Focus Points to cast {@spell Dispel Evil and Good|XPHB}, {@spell Hold Monster|XPHB}, {@spell Telekinesis|XPHB}, or {@spell Wall of Force|XPHB}. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells, and you can cast them without Material components.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of Pride
entries: {@i Prove Your Superiority}

Monks who become Warriors of Pride value themselves above all. These monks focus on mastering their form, ego, and their destructive power. They display monastic aesthetics publicly with the intention of gaining the respect and admiration of "lesser beings."
The prideful traditions of this order include adorning themselves with jewelry, hiding their scars, and commanding respect from those who would oppose them.

subclassFeature.name: Tall Tales
entries: You have gained a knack for telling embellished tales of your past achievements. You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Deception|XPHB}, {@skill Intimidation|XPHB}, {@skill Performance|XPHB}, or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Bruised Ego
entries: Your ego strengthens you as you fight to prove your value. When you expend a Focus Point, you can also gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB|Temporary Hit Point}). While you are {@condition Bloodied|XPHB}, you gain twice that amount instead.

subclassFeature.name: Assertive Attacker
entries: While you are {@condition Bloodied|XPHB}, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} and Monk weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Irrational Retaliation
entries: Damage dealt to you is damage dealt to your pride, and that is something you simply can't allow. Whenever a creature deals damage to you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and expend 1 Focus Point. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against that creature until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Redoubled Efforts
entries: When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} while you are {@condition Bloodied|XPHB}, you can roll one additional damage die when determining the extra damage dealt by the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Ever Prideful
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and not killed outright, you can expend 1 Focus Point to enter a trance. While in this trance, you have the following effects:

items: You are {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition.
You can't cast or concentrate on spells.
You suffer 1 {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB} failure from damage from a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} instead of 2.

entries: Whenever you start your turn with 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}, you must expend 1 Focus Point to maintain a trance, and you make {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws} as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Egotistical
entries: Injuries to your pride enrage you. You are considered {@condition Bloodied|XPHB} if your current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} are below your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of Regret
entries: {@i Atone for Past Mistakes}
No one is born intent on bringing evil into this world, yet many lives are transformed by the suffering inflicted upon them. Warriors of Regret are haunted by the shadows of evil deeds done.

Through training and reflection, Warriors of Regret accept their past can't be erased. Instead, they focus on forging remorse and grief into a weapon against their foes. Though their misdeeds follow their every step, Warriors of Regret are not powerless to atone for them.

subclassFeature.name: Shade of Regret
entries: Once per turn, on your turn, you can expend 1 Focus Point (no action required) to create a shade of yourself in an unoccupied space you can see within 10 feet of yourself. The shade is intangible and doesn't occupy its space. It lasts until the end of your next turn, but it ends early if you dismiss it (no action required) or have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. While it persists, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Shade Strike
entries: When you use Flurry of Blows, you can have the attacks originate from the shade instead of you. Attacks originating from the shade deal Necrotic or Force damage (your choice) rather than their normal damage type.

entries.name: Move
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can move the shade up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is within 60 feet of yourself.

subclassFeature.name: The Road Not Traveled
entries: When you take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action, instead of moving, you can teleport yourself or an ally within 60 feet of you to the location of your shade.

subclassFeature.name: Aid Not Given
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to take the {@action Help|XPHB} action or touch a creature and restore a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die plus your Wisdom modifier. You can use this feature as though you were in the shade's space.

subclassFeature.name: Crushing Guilt
entries: You can expend 3 Focus Points to release your pent-up guilt in a crushing wave that drops your foes to their knees. Creatures of your choice in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you or your shade must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Focus Point save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes Psychic damage equal to three rolls of your Martial Arts die and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

subclassFeature.name: Relive the Past
entries: Your Shade of Regret now lasts for 10 minutes. After using Flurry of Blows, your Shade can make one additional {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} as per Shade Strike. You can also use the Stunning Strike feature through the Shade Strike.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Pestilence
entries: {@i Gain Strength Through Suffering}

Clad in grime-soaked armor and wielding rusting weapons, Oath of Pestilence Paladins spread corruption, disease, and filth. Bound by an oath that infests their bodies with all manner of plagues, these heralds of decay lumber forward with unholy toughness and grim resolve.
These Paladins share the following tenets:

items: Spread plague to foster strength in the survivors.
There is nothing unnatural or immoral about the ending of life.

subclassFeature.name: Debilitating Fever
entries: You can inflict disease upon a creature. When you hit a creature with an attack roll using a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to give that creature the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. While {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} in this way, the target also has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. At the end of each of its turns, the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} target makes a Constitution save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Entropic Infection
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity and select a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. For 1 minute, if you deal damage to the target, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} Necrotic damage. In addition, the target loses {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Necrotic damage. The target can make a Constitution save against the Paladin's spell save DC at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Pestilence Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of Pestilence Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Oath of Pestilence Spells
rows: {@spell Melf's Acid Arrow|XPHB|Acid Arrow}, {@spell Ray of Enfeeblement|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Rampant Sickness
entries: You emit an aura of contagion and virulence. When a creature within your Aura of Protection is about to make a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on that {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Disgusting Resilience
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and not killed outright, you can spend any number of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice}, roll them, and reduce the damage taken by the total rolled on those dice.

In addition, if you are killed, your corpse explodes in a shower of pus and gore. Each creature in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you makes Constitution saving throw gainst the Paladin's spell save DC, taking {@damage 8d6} Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

subclassFeature.name: Plaguebringer
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you gain the benefits below for 10 minutes, or until you end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).

entries.name: One with Plague
entries: You are {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to Poison damage and the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition, and you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Bolstered by Rot
entries: Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum can't be reduced.

entries.name: Entropic Radiance
entries: Whenever an enemy starts its turn within your Aura of Protection, it takes Necrotic damage equal to your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Slaughter
entries: {@i Revel in Unbridled Violence}

The only truth of war is death. The only virtue is to kill. The only victory is to survive. Heroism, honor, and glory are illusions. This is the creed of Tormach, Arch Daemon of Wrath, but this philosophy rings true for all warriors who devote themselves, body and soul, to the thrill of combat and the delight of bloodshed. Such champions find themselves at the forefront of armies, using the most violent methods at their disposal to bring battles to a swift close... or drawing out the war to sate their own appetites.
Paladins who take the Oath of Slaughter share the following tenets:

items: Violence is the end, not the means.
Break the body to break the spirit.
Revel in bloodshed, whether friend or foe.

subclassFeature.name: Frenzied Slaughter
entries: You can harness the rush of battle to drive you to even greater acts of violence. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to enter a battle frenzy. You gain the following benefits while this feature is active.

entries.name: Reflexive Attack
entries: When you miss with an attack roll using a Melee weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make another attack with the same weapon.

entries.name: Condition Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, and {@condition Stunned|XPHB} conditions.

entries.name: Duration
entries: Frenzied Slaughter lasts until the end of your next turn, and it ends early if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. If your Frenzied Slaughter is still active on your next turn, you can extend it for another round by doing one of the following:

items: Make an attack roll against an enemy.
Force an enemy to make a saving throw.
You are {@condition Bloodied|XPHB} at the end of your turn.

entries: Each time Frenzied Slaughter is extended, it lasts until the end of your next turn. You can maintain it for up to 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Slaughter Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of Slaughter Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Bloodthirst Aura
entries: Your lust for blood infects those around you. When a {@condition Bloodied|XPHB} ally within your Aura of Protection makes an attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, it gains a bonus to damage. The bonus equals your Charisma modifier.

Additionally, when a {@condition Bloodied|XPHB} creature within your Aura of Protection makes a saving throw against a Sangromancy spell, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the save.

subclassFeature.name: Follow Through
entries: When a creature in your Aura of Protection becomes {@condition Bloodied|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to half your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and make an attack with a Melee weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}. This movement doesn't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the attack roll

subclassFeature.name: Blood Knight
entries: Your bloodthirst imbues you with preternatural strength and resilience, allowing you to keep sowing slaughter. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you gain the benefits below for 10 minutes or until you end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).

entries.name: Crimson Armor
entries: When a creature within your Aura of Protection becomes {@condition Bloodied|XPHB} by an enemy, you gain 30 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Seeing Red
entries: When a creature hits you with an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make one melee attack against that creature, using a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

entries.name: Wanton Slaughter
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee attack roll using a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can choose any number of creatures within 5 feet of the original target and within your reach. Each chosen creature takes Force damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1) plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Zeal
entries: {@i Eliminate Threats to Ideological Purity}

The Oath of Zeal is taken by paladins consumed by hatred for a specific group or ideology. Zealots, as these Paladins are sometimes called, pursue an inquisition against their enemies at all costs. They abandon compassion and honor as impediments to the more important work of ridding the world of those they deem dangerous or heretical.
These Paladins share the following tenets:

items: Reveal heresy and destroy those who practice it.
Show unwavering conviction and unflinching resolve.
Perform any sacrifice necessary to stop wickedness.

subclassFeature.name: Mark of the Heretic
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to mark a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself as a heretic.

For 1 minute, your weapon attacks and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} against the chosen creature can score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}. In addition, whenever the target starts its turn, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make a melee attack against that creature if it's within reach.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Zeal Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of Zeal Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Oath of Zeal Spells
rows: {@spell Detect Evil and Good|XPHB}, {@spell Hunter's Mark|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Clarity
entries: You and your allies have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition while in your Aura of Protection. If a {@condition Blinded|XPHB} ally enters the aura, that condition has no effect on that ally while there. Additionally, you can see {@condition Invisible|XPHB} creatures within your Aura of Protection.

subclassFeature.name: Compel Confession
entries: You can cast {@spell Zone of Truth|XPHB} without expending a spell slot. In addition, a creature that succeeds on its saving throw takes {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage at the start of each of its turns while in your Zone of Truth until it chooses to fail its saving throw instead.

subclassFeature.name: Apocalyptic Revelation
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can reveal the true nature of your enemies for 1 minute. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required). You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Blinding Glory
entries: Enemies that start their turn within 5 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw against the Paladin's spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: See the Truth
entries: You have {@sense Truesight|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Smite the Heretic
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can choose a creature within 60 feet of yourself and reveal its weaknesses. You and your allies have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Blood
entries: {@i Wreak Bloody Havoc}

The Circle of Blood is a keeper of the old ways. They remember how ancient Druids performed sacrificial rituals under a blood-red moon to appease the uncaring forces of nature. These Druids trade blood for life in a delicate balance to bolster their allies and destroy their enemies.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Blood Spells
entries: When you reach a Druid level specified in the Circle of Blood Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Circle of Blood Spells
rows: {@spell Blood Rush|GrimHollowPG24}, {@spell Crimson Lash|GrimHollowPG24}, {@spell Sense Lifeblood|GrimHollowPG24}

subclassFeature.name: Rite of the Blood Moon
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape to adopt the violent savagery of the Blood Moon for 10 minutes. During this time, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Red Resilience
entries: You gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to three times your Druid level.

items.name: Speed Increased
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet, and you can take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

items.name: Violent Strikes
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage to the target.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Boon
entries: Whenever a creature you can see within 60 feet of you is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to claim the last vestiges of its vitality. You regain 1 spent {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Die} and grant a creature you can see within 60 feet of you {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Druid level.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum once). You regain one expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Lust
entries: While your Blood Moon is active, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Improved Violent Strikes
entries: The extra Necrotic damage from your Violent Strikes increases to {@dice 2d6}.

items.name: Red Rage
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Exsanguinate
entries: When you use your Blood Boon, you regain spent {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} equal to half your Druid level and give {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to twice your Druid level to a number of creatures up to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of one creature) that you can see within 60 feet of yourself.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Entropy
entries: {@i Become an Instrument of Decay and Ruin}

Druids of the Circle of Entropy see doom as a constant of the natural world. Lives end, works erode, and the civilizations of Etharis ultimately come to ruin. The inevitable end of the old brings opportunity for the new. These fatalistic Druids see themselves as agents of ruin, ending those whose time has passed to make space for those whose time has yet to come.

subclassFeature.name: Catastrophic Power
entries: You have mastered talents, both magical and martial, in your pursuit of the inevitable destruction of mortals and their works. When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you gain one of the following benefits until you finish your next {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Elemental Cataclysm
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend a spell slot to cause elemental energy to burst in a 10-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on a point within 60 feet of yourself. Choose a damage type: Acid, Cold, Fire, or Lightning.

Each creature in the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 1d6} damage of the chosen type per level of the spell slot expended, and then has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to that damage type for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} on a success.

entries.name: Ruinous Smite
entries: Once per turn when you deal damage with an attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can choose to expend a spell slot to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage, plus another {@dice 1d8} per level of the spell slot.

entries.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: Your supernatural connection to destruction allows you to use the mastery property of one kind of weapon of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as {@item Shortbow|XPHB|Shortbows} or {@item Quarterstaff|XPHB|Quarterstaffs}.

Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change the kind of weapon you choose. For example, you could switch to using the mastery property of {@item Sling|XPHB|Slings} or {@item Greatclub|XPHB|Greatclubs}.

subclassFeature.name: Ruin Incarnate
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape to adopt an aspect of entropy and the inevitable end of all things for 10 minutes. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: All Things Pass
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against {@condition Bloodied|XPHB} creatures.

entries.name: Inexorable Onslaught
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.

entries.name: Ironskin Armor
entries: Your base AC becomes 17 plus your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1) if your AC is lower than that.

subclassFeature.name: Many Roads to Ruin
entries: Your mystic connection to catastrophe and destruction grows stronger. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Elemental Assault
entries: While your Ruin Incarnate feature is active, whenever you hit with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can cause it to deal your choice of Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Necrotic damage rather than its normal damage type.

entries.name: Increased Might
entries: While your Ruin Incarnate feature is active, you can add your Wisdom modifier (minimum bonus of +1) to your Strength and Dexterity saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Shake the Earth
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can strike the earth with a thunderous tremor and grow. When you do so, your size increases by one category (from Medium to Large, for example) for 10 minutes. In addition, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from your new form must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. The tremor deals Bludgeoning damage to each structure in contact with the ground in the area. To determine this damage, roll a number of d10s equal to your Druid level, and add them together.
While your size is increased by this feature, your attacks with weapons and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage on a hit.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Entropy's Apex
entries: You have mastered the ability to hasten the inevitable slide toward entropy. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Enhanced Ruinous Smite
entries: Until the end of your next turn, any creature affected by your Ruinous Smite suffers a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19-20 on the {@dice d20}.

entries.name: Improved Inexorable Onslaught
entries: While your Ruin Incarnate feature is active, you can attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} three times instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.

entries.name: World Breaker
entries: You regain your use of your Shake the Earth feature when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Mutation
entries: {@i Mutate Into an Apex Predator}

Druids of the Circle of Mutation believe that nature should be improved in order to compete with the unnatural world. Their order hides in the darkest corners of swamps and forests, conducting experiments to warp the structure of their domain. They go unheard from for months, emerging from the wilds with twisted vines and mutated creatures at their side. These Druids have earned the scorn of other circles, discredited as those who have lost their way. In the eyes of these Druids, those who wish to preserve nature as it is simply fear what change brings.

subclassFeature.name: Circle Forms
entries: You channel the endless possibilities of nature when you assume a Wild Shape form, granting you the benefits below.

entries.name: Challenge Rating
entries: The maximum {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB} for the form equals your Druid level divided by 3 (rounded down).

entries.name: Predator's Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack roll using a Beast form's attack in Wild Shape, you add +2 to the damage dealt.

entries.name: Unpredictable
entries: You can take the {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, or {@action Influence|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Mutate Shape
entries: When you assume a Wild Shape form, or as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} while your Wild Shape is active, you can expend a spell slot to gain Mutation Points equal to the slot's level. These Mutation Points last until they are spent, you gain additional Mutation Points, or  you leave the form. While you have Mutation Points, you can spend them on your turn (no action required by you) to gain a Mutation from the list below. When you do, your body distends and reconstitutes in a gruesome display.
Mutations last until you leave the form or you expend a spell slot to gain Mutation Points.
{@style Mutation Options|large}
The following options are available to your Mutate Shape feature. The options are presented in alphabetical order.

entries.name: Repeatable
entries: A Mutation can be gained only once for each Wildshape use unless its description states otherwise in a "Repeatable" subsection.

subclassFeature.name: Unnatural and Unnerving
entries: When you expend a level 2+ spell slot to gain Mutation Points, you regain one expended spell slot. The slot you regain must be of a level lower than the slot you expended and can't be higher than level 5.
In addition, while in Wild Shape form, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Unnatural Attacks
entries: Each of your attacks in Wild Shape form can deal its normal damage type or Force damage. You make this choice each time you hit with those attacks.

entries.name: Unnerving Aura
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB} or {@skill Intimidation|XPHB}) and Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling|XPHB}) checks.

subclassFeature.name: Endless Evolution
entries: When you gain Mutation Points, you gain an additional number of Mutation Points equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1). In addition, you can now spend your Mutation Points on the following Mutations.

subclassFeature.name: Apex Predator
entries: Your mastery of mutation has made you an apex predator, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Evolved Attacks
entries: Once per turn, you can deal an extra {@damage 2d10} Force damage to a target you hit with a Wild Shape form's attack.

entries.name: Mutate Beasts
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can touch a Beast and expend a spell slot, causing the target to mutate. You gain Mutation Points equal to the slot's level, which you must immediately spend on Mutations for the Beast. Unspent Mutation Points are lost. Mutations remain until the Beast is targeted by this feature again. A {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB}, {@spell Greater Restoration|XPHB} or similar magic ends the Mutations.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Domain
entries: {@i Wield the Power that Killed the Gods}

Even the most benevolent divine beings operate outside the bounds of mortal comprehension. These eldritch forces sing a siren song that calls to mortal worshippers through lucid dreams and terrible whispers. The Eldritch Domain empowers the followers of the unknown and distant forces of chaos, divine entities of eldritch oblivion, and dead gods.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Domain Spells
entries: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Eldritch Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Eldritch Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB}, {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter}, {@spell See Invisibility|XPHB}, {@spell Sleep|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Contagion
entries: You've been gifted with the ability to impart a fleeting taste of the unknowable on others. When you take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cast a spell using a spell slot that targets one or more creatures, you can force one target of the original spell to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, roll on the Eldritch Effects table, and the target creature suffers that effect for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. This effect ends early if you use this feature again.

entries.caption: Eldritch Effects
rows: The creature can't speak or cast spells that have Verbal components.
The creature takes {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage at the start of each of its turns.
The creature is disoriented. If it uses more than 5 feet of its movement to do anything other than stand, it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.
The creature is distracted by visions and voices and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks.

The creature is unsure of itself. On its turns, it can take either an action or a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, not both, and it can make only one attack if it takes the {@action Attack|XPHB} action.
The creature is reckless. It has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls, but attack rolls against it have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.
