entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can expend an additional {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} for each spell slot level above 3. Additionally, the duration of this spell increases by 1 hour for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Sanguine Shield
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend two {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. You draw lifeforce from those injured around you to create a swirling shield of blood. You gain 5 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} for each creature within 30 feet of you that is below its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum (including you) to a maximum of 15 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. While you have {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} from this spell, you have {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover}. When the spell ends, all {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} from it are lost.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The maximum number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} you gain increases by 5 for each two spell slot levels above 2.

spell.name: Seal Spellcasting

components.m: wax mixed with lead and a stamp

entries: When you cast this spell, choose a creature you can see within range. When the target casts a spell, it must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature expends a spell slot to cast the spell as normal but the spell has no effect. On a successful save, the creature casts the spell but takes {@damage 3d8} Force damage. After the creature makes a saving throw, the spell immediately ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot above level 2.

spell.name: Sense Lifeblood
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend two {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. The lifeblood flowing within creatures tells you its secrets. Creatures that have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} condition are {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to this spell. Until the spell ends, you can determine if creatures you can see are related biologically. In addition, you know if a creature's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} are at maximum, below maximum, at half, or below half.

Once on each of your turns when you hit a {@condition Bloodied|XPHB} creature with an attack roll using a weapon, {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, or spell, you can cause the target to take extra Necrotic. To determine this damage, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Your {@status Concentration|XPHB} can last longer with a spell slot of level 3-4 (up to 1 hour) or 5+ (up to 8 hours).

spell.name: Serpent Tongue
entries: You transform your tongue into a poisonous serpent for the duration. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 10 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d12} Piercing damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for the duration of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for every spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Shared Judgement
entries: Once on each of your turns when you reduce an Undead to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can deal {@damage 5d6} Radiant damage to a creature you can see within 60 feet of you no action required.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 4.

spell.name: Shroud Blood
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend one {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} or the spell automatically fails.  You can choose yourself or a willing creature within 30 feet of yourself to have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks. When the target loses the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition, it can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to gain the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition for a number of rounds equal to the number of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell. The target loses the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition immediately after it makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target an additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Somnolence

components.m: sand mixed with the spellcaster's blood

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend one {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} or the spell automatically fails. Roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} expended to cast the spell plus {@dice 2d12} and choose a creature within range. If the roll's total is equal to or greater than the chosen creature's current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the creature falls into a magical slumber for 1 minute. If the roll's total is equal to or greater than the chosen creature's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum, the magical slumber lasts for 24 hours instead. The spell ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the spell's effect. A creature woken early from this spell gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level.
Creatures that don't sleep, such as elves, or that have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} condition automatically succeed on saves against this spell.

entries.name: The Long Sleep
entries: Adherents of the Prismatic Circle perform a variation of the Somnolence spell that takes 10 minutes and requires the sacrifice of a Humanoid. These adherents believe when the ritual is completed, it staves off the waking of Gormadraug for a day and night. Through the repetitive performance of this ritual, the Druids of the Prismatic Circle hope to ensure Gormadraug slumbers forever.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You roll an additional {@dice 1d12} and can expend an additional two {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} for every spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Spirit Swarm
entries: You invite spirits to take their revenge upon a target. A creature you can see within range must make a Charisma saving throw. The target must have a Charisma of 3 or higher. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 8d8} Psychic damage and has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the spell ends. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

spell.name: Splattering Smite

time.note: which you take when you hit a creature with a Melee weapon

entries: Your strikes drink the splattered blood of your foes. As part of casting this spell, you must expend five {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} or the spell automatically fails. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an attack roll using a Melee weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell and regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the numbered rolled.

spell.name: Steal Immortality

time.condition: which you take when a Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within range that you can see is reduced to 0 Hit Points

m.text: the skull of a humanoid encrusted in gems worth 1,000+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend nine {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. Roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell and gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to twice the roll's total. You gain the creature type of the spell's target, in addition to your own type.

While the spell lasts, you have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition; you no longer need to eat, drink, or breathe; you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage; and you gain a benefit based on your new creature type:

entries.name: Celestial
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Radiant and Necrotic damage and have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet.

entries.name: Elemental
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, and Thunder damage.

entries.name: Fey
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn, or teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

entries.name: Fiend
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold and Fire damage and have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet.

entries.name: Undead
entries: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Necrotic damage, and you have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions.
You have the creature type and benefits until you cast the spell again, or you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

spell.name: Suffocate
entries: You create a pair of grasping hands made from {@condition invisible} force. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature you can see within range. On a hit, the creature has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. While it has this condition, it can't breathe.

A creature can hold its breath for a number of rounds equal to 1 plus its Constitution modifier (minimum of 30 seconds) before suffocation begins. When a creature runs out of breath, it gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level at the end of each of its turns. When a creature can breathe again, it removes all levels of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} it gained from suffocating.

A creature {@condition Restrained|XPHB} by the hands can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer {@condition Restrained|XPHB}.

spell.name: Summon Plant

m.text: a ceramic pot filled with herbs and fertilizer worth at least 200 GP

entries: You call forth a plant spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the {@creature Plant Spirit|GrimHollowPG24} stat block. When you cast the spell, choose a floral feature: Blooming, Oaken, or Thorny. The creature resembles an animated plant marked by the chosen floral feature, which determines one of the traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, the creature shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

spell.name: Summon Sea Spirit

m.text: a bejeweled statuette of a sea serpent worth at least 300 GP

entries: You call forth an abyssal spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the {@creature Sea Serpent Spirit|GrimHollowPG24} stat block. When you cast the spell, choose an abhorrent feature: Enormous Mouth, Glowing Lantern, or Scaled Wings. The creature resembles a monstrous sea creature marked by the chosen abhorrent feature, which determines one of the traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, the creature shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

spell.name: Supernal Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a Melee weapon or an Unarmed Strike

entries: Your strike cause ambient magic surrounded a creature to collapse and detonate. The target hit by the strike takes an extra {@damage 4d6} Force damage from the attack. If the creature is {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on a spell, that {@status Concentration|XPHB} is broken.

In addition, each ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

spell.name: Theft of Vitae

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage

entries: Roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell. The triggering creature takes Necrotic damage equal to the result. You gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the result plus the triggering damage, to a maximum of 15 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The maximum number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} you can gain from casting increases by 10 for each slot level above 2.

spell.name: Thorn Armor
entries: When you cast this spell, a flexible exoskeleton covered in thorns appears around a willing target within range. The target gains {@dice 3d6} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. If a creature hits the target with a melee attack roll before the spell ends, that creature takes Piercing damage equal to the number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} lost as a result of the attack. This spell ends early if the target has no remaining {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} granted by this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The target gains an additional {@dice 2d6} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Tremor
entries: The ground around you in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} begins to shake violently. You are unaffected by the tremors. The ground is considered {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} and whenever the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} enters a creature's space, a creature enters the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, or the creature ends its turn there, the creature makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} Bludgeoning damage and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Undead Enthrallment

components.m: a clay pot filled with brackish water, another clay pot filled with grave dirt, and a black onyx stone worth 500 + GP for each corpse

entries: Choose a corpse, or a number or corpses, within range that are equivalent to the size of the creature you are animating (the GM determines how many corpses are required). Your spell imbues the target with a foul mimicry of life, raising it as an Undead creature. You can choose for the target to become an Undead creature of CR 3 or lower (the GM has the creature's game statistics).

On each of your turns, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 60 feet of you. (If you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one.) You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you've given it. To maintain control of the creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature again before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over 1 creature you have animated with this spell, rather than animating a new one. Any creature you have maintained with this spell for 30 days remains permanently under your control. You may only control a maximum of four creatures with this spell.

spell.name: Vampiric Claws
entries: You sprout wicked claws. When you use your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} to deal damage with the new growth, it deals {@damage 1d6} Slashing damage instead of dealing the normal damage for your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, and you use your spellcasting ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls rather than using Strength.

While the spell lasts, each time you deal damage with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} from the spell are lost when the spell ends.

spell.name: Vibrating Humors
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend one {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Die} or the spell automatically fails. A creature you can see within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes Thunder damage and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks from its blood vibrating loudly. To determine this damage, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} expended to cast this spell.
The target repeats the save at the end of each of turns, ending the spell on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You increase the damage by expending an additional {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Die} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Viscous Sheath
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend seven {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} or the spell automatically fails. Your body is wrapped in clotted blood. Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack roll, the attacker takes Necrotic damage. To determine this damage, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

If a creature hits you with a Melee weapon, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to have clots form around the weapon, entrapping it. The attacker must succeed on a Strength saving throw or the weapon sticks to you. If the attacker doesn't release the weapon, the creature has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition while the weapon is stuck. While stuck, the weapon can't be used. The target can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC, freeing the weapon on a success. The creature can also release the weapon to end the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition.
You can trap a number of weapons equal to the number of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} expended to cast the spell. When the spell ends, the weapons are released.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can trap an additional weapon for each spell slot level above 4.

spell.name: Wall of Gloom
entries: You create a wall of swirling gray energy, formed of the psychic pain of loss. The wall appears within range on a solid surface and lasts for the duration. You choose to make the wall up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick or a ringed wall that has a 20-foot diameter and is up to 20 feet high and 5 feet thick. The wall blocks line of sight.

The wall sheds {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} out to a range of 100 feet. When you cast the spell, you and creatures you designate can pass through and remain near the wall without harm. If a creature moves within 20 feet of it or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the start of its next turn.

A creature can move through the wall, though the attempt is emotionally draining. The first time a creature enters the wall on a turn or ends its turn there, it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or gain 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level.

spell.name: Weave Numen

m.text: a mithral sewing needle worth 300 GP+, which the spell consumes

entries: You can sense the presence of magic within 120 feet of yourself. You see a faint aura around any visible creature or object within that range that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.
In addition, you gain thirteen threads. You can spend these threads to gain benefits as described below, with no action required unless stated:

items: When you cast a spell, you can expend 1 thread to enhance the spell as if you had expended a spell slot 1 level higher than you did and you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to 1 plus the level of the spell.

When a creature you can see within 120 feet of you casts a spell, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend 1 thread to interrupt that spell. If it's a spell of level 3 or lower, the spell fails and has no effect. If it's a spell of level 4 or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC equals 10 plus the spell's level). On a successful check, the spell fails and has no effect.

When you cast a spell that causes a creature to be healed or take damage, you can spend up to six threads. The amount of damage or healing caused to one creature by that spell increases by four times the number of expended threads.

entries: You lose all remaining threads when this spell ends. If you spend all threads granted by the spell, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You gain an additional two threads per spell slot level above 6.

spell.name: Wilting Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a Melee weapon or an Unarmed Strike

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend two {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. The creature loses all Resistances to damage until the start of your next turn. The target hit by the strike takes extra Necrotic damage from the attack. To determine this damage, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell.

spell.name: Wipe Face
entries: You curse a creature that you can see within range. The target's face is replaced with completely smooth skin, sealing the creature's eyes, nose, and mouth. The creature has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} conditions and begins suffocating.

At the end of each of its turns, the target can attempt a Constitution saving throw to end the spell. Dealing at least 15 Slashing damage to the target opens an airway allowing it to breathe, but  the curse seals the opening at the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Wrack
entries: Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be afflicted with excruciating muscle spasms for the duration. On a failed save, the target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved and it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

spell.name: Curse of Conceited Obsession

m.text: a thread from the bed or clothes of your target, a handful of teeth, and a gilded mirror worth 1,000+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with an obsessive self-infatuation. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. Successful {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB}. On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 4d6} Psychic damage and is aware it was targeted by a curse. Additionally, for 1 minute, the target takes {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 8d10} Psychic damage and is cursed.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time the cursed creature looks into a mirror or reflective surface, the surface cracks or become distorted in some way, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature is compelled to stop and admire itself whenever it sees its reflection. It constantly fusses over its appearance.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The cursed creature becomes obsessed with looking for its reflection wherever it goes, including in the eyes of its foes. Attacks against the cursed creature have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: The cursed creature is driven to find or build a location where it can see its own reflection from many angles. The cursed creature is compelled to remain in this location and admire itself. Additionally, the cursed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls from its obsession with its own appearance.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a Weeping Willow.

spell.name: Curse of Crushing Sensation

m.text: a drop of the target's blood, a shred of silk material, and a horn worth 1,000+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with painful hypersensitivity to physical sensations. The target must make a Constitution saving throw.

entries.name: Successful Saving Throw
entries: On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 4d6} Thunder damage and is aware it was targeted by a curse. For 1 minute, the target takes {@damage 1d6} Thunder damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 8d10} Thunder damage and is cursed.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time the target hears a loud noise, it gets a crippling headache, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature avoids {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB}, loud noises, extreme temperatures, and doesn't like to be touched.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The cursed creature can't stand the feeling of rough or heavy clothing against its skin. It can't wear armor. It has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to Thunder damage from its hypersensitivity. Additionally, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls if it or its target is in an area of {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB}.

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: Even mild sensory input becomes intolerable to the cursed creature. It is driven to find a dark and quiet lair, such as a deep cave or dungeon. The cursed creature can't willingly leave this lair and has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to all damage except for Psychic damage while outside its lair.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a Sightless Agony.

spell.name: Curse of Damned Aging

m.text: a childhood possession of the target, a pint of blood, and a watch worth 600+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with horrific aging. The target must make a Strength saving throw.

entries.name: Successful Saving Throw
entries: On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 2d10} Necrotic damage and is aware it was targeted by a curse. For 1 minute, the target has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage (you choose when you cast the spell).

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d10} Necrotic damage and is cursed.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time the target finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, it finds multiple wrinkles, grey hairs, or spots it didn't previously have, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature is compelled to rest when the occasion permits it, becoming lethargic and lazy.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The cursed creature becomes feeble. After finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, the creature can only use 25 percent of its {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}, rounded up, to regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: The cursed creature starts to age rapidly, becoming decrepit. The cursed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a Body Snatcher.

spell.name: Curse of Fastidious Pride

m.text: a shred of the target's clothing, an uncrushed dead spider, and a sewing needle worth 600+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with narcissistic hubris.

The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. Successful {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB}. On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 2d10} Psychic damage and is aware it was targeted by a curse.

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 4d10} Psychic damage, has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition for 1 minute, and is cursed.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time the target hears its name spoken, the speaker sounds derisive regardless of its actual tone, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature hears veiled insults everywhere, believing everyone is jealous of its brilliance and talent.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The cursed creature feels restless unless it is actively working to accomplish a goal. The cursed creature gains no benefit from its {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short Rests}.

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: The cursed creature believes everyone is involved in a conspiracy to bring about its downfall. Whenever it fails a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} it makes.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a Mind Siphon.

spell.name: Curse of Foul Blight

m.text: a shred of the target's hair or flesh, a chunk of rotten meat, and a jewelry box worth 600+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with a putrefying and stinking pox. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. Successful {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB}. On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 3d10} Necrotic damage and is aware it was targeted by a curse. Additionally, it can't gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} or regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} for 1 minute.

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d10} Necrotic damage and is cursed.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time the target searches for its garments or equipment, it finds an infestation of insects, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature is afflicted with a minor cough. Whenever it speaks more than a few words at a time, it breaks into a fit of coughing. This does not affect spellcasting.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The smell of putrescence lingers in the air around the cursed creature. Food and drink quickly spoil, jewelry tarnishes, and wood rots within 10 feet of the cursed creature. Additionally, the cursed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Charisma ability checks and saving throws, and it can't maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: The cursed creature's skin becomes riddled with pockmarks, pustules, and lesions. Insects flock to the cursed creature, infesting its clothes. The cursed creature can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} except by spending {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} after finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a Plague Carrion.

spell.name: Curse of Ill-Fated Fortune

m.text: a discarded piece of the target's equipment, a splinter of bone, and a collection of dice worth 800+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with lethal bad luck. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw.

entries.name: Successful Saving Throw
entries: On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 3d10} Thunder damage and is aware it was targeted by a curse. Additionally,  the creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the first {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} it makes in the next 1 minute.

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 7d10} Thunder damage and is cursed.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time the target walks through a doorway, the target stubs its toe or bashes its head, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature falls victim to minor inconveniences and bad luck. Shops it wishes to visit close just as it arrives, and its equipment breaks at inconvenient moments.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The cursed creature becomes a beacon of bad luck as otherwise harmless setbacks become increasingly dangerous. Objects constantly seem to be placed in the creature's way. Additionally, the cursed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ability checks and saving throws.

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: The cursed creature becomes dangerously prone to accidents, as even the simplest tasks have unforeseen life-threatening consequences. The cursed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} checks, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced to 10 feet, and it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition if it misses an attack roll.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a Herald of Calamity.

spell.name: Curse of Insatiable Greed

m.text: a coin that the target has previously possessed, the tail of a rat, and a golden crown of thorns worth 800+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with a bitter and self-destructive greed. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. Successful {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB}. On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 4d10} Cold damage and is aware it was targeted by a curse.

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d10} Cold damage, and its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced to 0 for 1 minute. At the end of each turns, the target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 5 feet, until it reaches its maximum {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time the target finishes a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, it notices it has lost a valued item, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature becomes compelled to steal trinkets.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The cursed creature finds a secret place to start stashing its stolen trinkets, and it becomes anxious about leaving the location for extended periods of time. The creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ability checks and saving throws.

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: The cursed creature is driven to transform its hoard of trinkets into a labyrinth of possessions and treasure. The cursed creature desires to remain in this lair. The creature can't take {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions}.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a Verminous Abomination.

spell.name: Curse of Lost Sentiment

m.text: a lock of hair from someone the target loves, an animal's heart, and an idol worth 600+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with the loss of memories and horrific madness. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw.

entries.name: Successful Saving Throw
entries: On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 3d10} Force damage, has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn, and is unaware it was targeted by a curse.

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d10} Force damage, has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn, and is cursed.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time the target finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, it suffers nightmarish visions of being abandoned or left alone, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature begins forgetting events that have occurred within the past few days and the names of acquaintances.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The cursed creature forgets all but its closest companions, and it has delusions of hidden threats and scheming rivals. Additionally, the cursed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Intelligence ability checks and saving throws.

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: The cursed creature forgets its closest companions, its own identity, and its goals. The curse fabricates delusions of a great conspiracy that only the cursed creature can prevent. The cursed creature is compelled to take any action it believes necessary to uncover this conspiracy. The creature can't take {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB|Bonus Actions}.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a Dream Whisperer.

spell.name: Curse of Ravenous Hunger

m.text: a morsel of food that belonged to the target, a sun-dried slug, and a dining plate worth 400+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with painful and unending starvation. The target must make a Constitution saving throw.

entries.name: Successful Saving Throw
entries: On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 2d10} Poison damage, has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn, and is aware it was targeted by a curse.

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 4d10} Poison damage, has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for 1 minute, and is cursed.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time it eats a meal, the cursed creature bites its tongue and its mouth fills with blood, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature is gripped with an insatiable appetite.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The cursed creature becomes compelled to eat inappropriate items such as coins, flowers, glass, and dirt. Additionally, the cursed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Constitution saving throws, and its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum decreases by an amount equal to its character level (or {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} if it has no character level).

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: The cursed creature becomes ravenous and is compelled to consume the flesh of Humanoids. No other food satiates it. The creature can't have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a Bloated Gastromorph.

spell.name: Curse of Uncontrollable Wrath

m.text: blood or other fluid of the target, a severed hand, and a serrated knife worth 1,000+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with an uncontrollable temper and a lust for violence. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw.

entries.name: Successful Saving Throw
entries: On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 4d10} Psychic damage and is aware it was targeted by a curse. Additionally, for 1 minute, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attacks made using {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions}.

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 8d10} Psychic damage and is cursed.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time the cursed creature attacks with a weapon or casts a spell using a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB}, an old wound reopens, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature becomes easily agitated and aggressive.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The cursed creature becomes obsessed with violence. The thrill of solo battle intoxicates it, and its demeanor toward its allies sours as the curse grows. The cursed creature gains no benefit from its {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short Rests}.

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: The cursed creature is driven to insatiable bloodlust, unable to rest while there are enemies to slaughter. The cursed creature gains no benefit from its {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB|Long Rests}.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes an Avatar of Slaughter.
